story:
Summary

With the intention of paying for all the University and school fees for 21 people, we were blessed to have so much support. Our first years payment totaled a whopping $5,000 for 10 people to be educated and to be following their dreams. 
The 3 eldest children were enrolled into Western International school, with their uniforms, new school shoes and books paid for by our Hearts to Harmony donors. They were set. It was all a big shock for the little village kids at the beginning and with no English language experience they ended up taking to it like a duck takes to water. 
Our eldest Raksa (aged 12) began averaging D's an E's on her end of semester exam. Now, 12 months in, our bright star is averaging A's and B's. The future is so bright for them now. 
Our youngest babies were then put into "Mustard seed School" They can now say the days of the week, months and count to 100! We couldn't be more proud. 

With 5 older students then enrolled in University, studying things such as, Law, Tourism and Hospitality, Fine arts and Banking and Finance and Engineering, they we set for the year ahead. 

We then faced our first unexpected bump in the road. Our beautiful Bora (aged 20) was complaining about a toothache. After a visit to the dentist Bora needed 10 bridges, 3 teeth out, and 6 root canals. OUCH!  We then decided it was time for all to have a check up at the dentist. 16 out of 21 had NEVER visited the dentist.
 It was a trip that lasted all day and is still continuing for a lot of the adults and children and their teeth were in such bad condition. And you guessed it, EVERYONE GOT BRAND NEW TOOTHPASTE AND TOOTHBRUSH, and not to mention demonstrations on how to use them! 

What are we doing now you ask?

Well we have just started our first stages of our expansion! 
We are increasing our number of families from 21 to 36! This means more rices bag drop off's, more hygiene packs, hygiene education workshops, more water-wells, more toilet facilities, more beaming smiles and more full bellies!! 


So to kick start this new project we are launching a 3 month 'Fund A Family Campaign' called 'Bringing Hearts to Harmony'. 

So what’s the plan? H2H will be providing each family with the necessities and then following up on a monthly basis. Initial support lasts for a year and ongoing support will then be evaluated. Each family will receive:

-       -Toilet / water pump

-       -Monthly bag of rice

-       -Hygiene pack (soap, toothbrushes, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner)

-       -Hygiene education workshops

-       -Bicycle


    Other Ways You Can Help

    I invite you to stay in touch with us on Facebook as well, to see photos of our students who your donation is helping by visiting 

    www.heartstoharmony.org 

    www.facebook.com/heartstoharmony

    As always we appreciate any sharing of our project on Facebook, email or simply sharing our work with your family and friends. We have found word of mouth recommendations by family and friends is reportedly the number one reason people decide to give to a cause.

story:
Barefoot inspired running shoes and training clinics brought to your town, event, or gym.

What Good Feels Like

Born to Run was started for one simple reason: To feel good. But more specifically to feel good while running, walking, and standing. We sell barefoot inspired footwear and teach proper running technique so that you can feel good.


From Retail Store to Mobile Store

Three years ago I called Barefoot Ted (from the best selling book Born to Run) and told him that I wanted to spread the joy of barefoot inspired running by opening a retail and web store that specialized in selling barefoot inspired shoes and educating people on proper running form. Barefoot Ted said, "Dude, let's do it. Let's call it Born to Run." 

I was amazed at how many people loved our store and our purpose, but I constantly have customers from out of town tell me that they wish they had a store like this near them. So we decided that instead of making you wait for us to put a store in your town, we would take our store on the road and bring the experience to you.


What is the Born to Run Mobile Store?

Simply enough, it's a Born to Run retail store that is mobile. We pack a trailer full of shoes, apparel, accessories, and know-how and we head out on the road to towns, cities, events, and CrossFit gyms across the U.S. (and perhaps Canada too), to bring our retail experience to you.


Mobile Store Design

With your help through generous pledges, we will purchase a large trailer, which we will outfit with a retail display wall hidden behind two large awnings. We will then fill the trailer with all your favorite barefoot inspired footwear such as New Balance Minimus, Altra Zero Drop, Vibram FiveFingers, Luna Sandals, Skora, Merrell, Vivobarefoot, Inov-8, and Reebok CrossFit. We will also stock up on great apparel, accessories, and our expert know-how as we hit the road and bring our barefoot inspired footwear and running clinics to you.

Fundraising Goals

The minimum we need to buy and customize the trailer is $10,000, but for every $20,000 we raise, we will buy and customize another mobile store trailer and tow vehicle. More mobile stores mean that we can be in more places, teaching more running clinics, and bringing the Born to Run experience to more of you more of the time. So help us raise $40,000, $60,000, or $80,000 so that we can spread the joy of barefoot inspired running across the nation!

story:
Operation Grandma

Our beloved grandma (Shahar's car) is a flat liner.
This campaign is a celebration of life and the possible death of our favorite local tour bus. 
A whole community of musicians and artists has depended on it for a long time. You can learn more about this community here:   http://thehivenyc.wix.com/

Your much appreciated donation could save Grandma from a brutal scrap yard treatment.
Please, help us get granny back from the dead!


Rebuild Grandma's Transmission

  • Grandma is a 1997 Ford Explorer who've seen better days. Her transmission is basically shut and the cost of rebuilding it will be around $1700. If we reach our goal, the money will be invested in the resuscitation of Grandma or in buying a younger version of her.
  • In exchange for your donations, you will have admission to our glorious Grandma Benefit Concert, held on January 26th at The Hive in Brooklyn and starring Yula And The eXtended Family with special guests. http://yulaqoi.wix.com/extendedfamily 
  •  A guitar lesson with Shahar Mintz.
  • A video, specially dedicated to you, of Shahar singing one of his songs.
  • A ride in our new or rejuvenated Grandma!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still try and fix Grandma with whatever funds we get.

Spread The Grandma Love!

If you can't help us with a donation, please feel free to spread the word. Grandma was a senior and most respected member of our community and we would love her story to be heard.

Thank you so very much!

story:
Hey Everyone! I am Sean Rhinehart,

I am a parkour athlete and I want to go to the International parkour jam! Its located in north California, In San Francisco  What is it? Its a jam where other athletes from all over the world get together and just train and share knowledge of new tricks and fancy moves!

Parkour is very important to me, its something I love to do and it helps me become a better person, its a way to express how I feel through movement. I really want to go to this even because I have never been!

its a great way to meet new friends/athletes that may open the door to more opportunities in the future. Plus who doesn't like a huge road trip! thanks! anything helps!!

story:
Hamlet's Vintage is moving to a bigger, better location!

After 6 years on Bleecker Street we found an amazing space with full potential and at this moment it's a work in progress.

We need your support to build a future, a unique destination shop in NYC.  As you know we are a small business fighting to stay alive in NYC. 

I built this business from the ground up - I've fought to keep growing and expanding.  It's my passion to create the best vintage store experience in NYC - and as you know we are one of a kind!  At this moment I am reaching out to you - my valued customers and supporters and friends - to help me achieve my goal.

I am looking to raise up to $20,000 to complete the move and renovation expenses that are already in progress.  I know that you all know how special this store is - you have all been such an important part of it already - and I ask that you consider making a donation.

No support is too large or too small.  If every one of you can give even just a portion we can build a masterpiece.

Please consider helping and share this with anyone who you think supports small and unique businesses in NYC - we are a special breed!

story:
What is this?

Instead of attending college next year, I am taking a year off, commonly called a Gap Year, to travel and do service work. This fall I am traveling to Peru, Costa Rica, and the Dominican Republic with Rustic Pathways' Latin American Experience, and I need your help to pay for the trip. I will live with host families, learn Spanish, travel around the countries and see wonders like Machu Picchu, and, most importantly, participate in service projects. 

What You Get

In exchange for supporting me you can receive some of the perks listed. More perks to be added soon.

The Impact

For the past couple of years I have known that I want to spend my life doing missionary work, and I believe this is the perfect first step. Not only will I be doing service work this fall, but I will get the opportunity to grow as a person and experience first hand what it is like to spend all of your effort for service. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help! Your prayers and encouraging words are greatly appreciated. You can also share this fundraiser on all of your social media. Use the Indiegogo share tools to post this to Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.

story:
It's Simple.
Our friend Zachary has fallen victim to the ills of Chicago society and its insatiable need for his consumer electronics. Let's give them a big F-you by helping Zachary out.

story:
Short Summary

On November 10, 2013, the coastal districts of the North Eastern Somalia of Puntland were devastated by the tropical cyclone that hit the three major districts of Dangorayo, Eyl and Bandarbayla and caused heavy rainfall and floods. The Puntland state government of Somalia declared this a natural disaster on November 11, 2013. Within the hours following the storm, 157 persons and 300,000 camels, goats and sheep died as a result of the steep decline in temperature combined with heavy rains. Animals are the major source of livelihood for the affected communities.

The urgent response needed includes: food items, medical supplies, water trucking, shelter, non-food items (NFI) and livelihood support, primarily in the form of eventual restocking, replacement of lost fishing gear and rapid access to cash through either cash-for-work programs or income generation opportunities. Outbreaks of infectious diseases, including malaria and acute watery diarrhea, have been observed, and cases of moderate malnutrition are quite common in the area due to limited access to food. Major water sources, including boreholes and water basins, collapsed and access to safe and clean water is a challenge. Affected communities are also struggling with the dead bodies of their animals.

Community-led Total Sanitation (CLTS) is a team of community development activists that received seed funding from the Resolution Project to improve the hygiene and sanitation behavior of the displaced people in Puntland state of Somalia.

What We Need & What You Get

Community-led Total Sanitation team has a fundraising target of USD 7,000 to address the health, sanitation and medical issues to urgently assist the affected communities and prevent further deterioration of the health conditions of the orphaned children.

Based on the urgent needs on the ground, this amount will be used as follows:

  • USD 3,000 buys 250 goats for 50 families. Each family will receive 5 goats to generate daily income from the milk and butter of the goats to revitalize their livelihood sources.
  • USD 2,000 buys essential drugs and 20 dignity kits to enhance the access of the communities to basic health care services including daily treatment of infectious diseases, health education, and child immunization and assisting the safe delivery of pregnant women.
  • USD 1,000 buys 100 sanitary kits and 300 water purification tablets such as aqua tabs for 100 households.
  • USD 1,000 buys 40 wheelbarrows for garbage disposal and environmental cleaning to avoid the spread of infectious diseases and diarrhea outbreaks.

The Impact

With your support, our campaign will  improve the living conditions of the affected communities through income generation activities. Our campaign will protect 3,840 persons from the outbreak of infectious diseases and improve their hygiene and sanitation behaviors. The campaign will improve access of the communities to clean and safe water and will distribute hygiene kits.

So far, with the support of community cash contributions and the technical support of the Somalia health cluster and food security and livelihood clusters, the CLTS team mobilized USD 13,000 at a very early stage for affected communities to distribute dry food supplies including biscuits, milk powder and dates and provision of emergency medical assistance. The CLTS team assisted a total number of 3,840 persons most affected by the catastrophe. Given the huge number of households affected by the cyclone with the limited resources in place, the CLTS team could not maintain the distribution of services, and needs your help to continue our work.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your help to get our word out and make noise of our campaign. If you cannot contribute, please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread our word.

story:
Empowering a Community

Jocotenango is one of the poorest urban communities in Guatemala, where poverty, illiteracy, malnutrition and hopelessness have driven many people to substance-abuse, gangs and a violent way of life.

For ten years, Education for the Children Foundation (www.eftc.org.uk) have been educating children that would otherwise never receive an education. Today, they have 567 children attending a purpose-built school: offering a window of opportunity in an otherwise dark world of poverty. 

I first heard about about this project in 2010, after watching their videos on YouTube. I was touched by the love and warmth of everyone involved, their dedication to the kids and their determination to create lasting value for the next generation.

Now it's time to tackle some of the root-causes of poverty. Rather than keep providing  more services, EFTC want to empower families to help themselves. By employing a community leader to work alongside the school, EFTC can engage parents in sex-education classes, form self-help groups for isolated parents suffering from violence and create badly needed AA and Al Anon groups in the area.

           

How can a child learn when they go home to a violent household?  

What We Need & What You Get 

Breaking it down in more detail:

  • The funds cover the costs of employing a community leader, as well as resources and materials used for sex-education classes.
  • Not only will we send you videos and photos of our progress, we are happy to invite you to visit us. Every year, dozens of volunteers visit - some for short periods - all reporting a life-changing experience!
  • Could we tempt you to visit?  Or to sponsor a child in the school?

The Impact

In February 2014, we conducted an independent needs analysis. The key findings were:

  • That much of the good work done in school to encourage students was being undone after 3pm, in the "dead-zone" between school and night-time
  • Many children and parents talked about abusive home situations, which go beyond the power of the school to remedy or influence
  • That there were many untapped opportunities for self-help groups to encourage and support afflicted families - at no cost to any donor or charity
  • That sex-education classes were vital to prevent and identify sexual abuse and allow young women to make informed choices about starting a family at a young age.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Can you share this page and tell others about our campaign?
  • Can you sponsor a child in the EFTC school?  See www.eftc.org.uk 

(Please email Nelly@eftc.org.uk so that we can deliver what we have promised.)

EFTC: Breaking the cycle of poverty through education, empowerment and enterprise at the heart of the community.

story:
Help us STRETCH our GOAL to $25,000 so we can expand our impact, provide more rewards, and broaden our pilot!

An anonymous donor made a commitment to match the next $5,000 of donations to our Indiegogo Campaign!! So now every gift counts double! 

************************************************************************

Union Capital Boston is a new model to fight poverty. We need your support to make our mission a reality!


We reward people for taking steps to improve their lives and their community. Our members, Union Capitalists, earn reward points for giving back to their community. They redeem their points for social services and financial needs they need to get a leg up. When we participate to improve our community, we improve ourselves, our families, and our surroundings, breaking the vicious cycle of poverty and creating a virtuous cycle of positive change.


We launch our pilot program in September with 250 members from our partner organizations: Family Independence Initiative, KIPP Academy Boston, Codman Square Health Center, and Codman Academy Charter Public School.


Throughout the fall Union Capitalists will give back to their community and earn reward points by volunteering at their children’s schools, participating in health center programs, working on community projects, and shopping at local businesses. In December they will redeem these Union Capital points for financial rewards based on how much they earned from giving back and investing in their community.


With your support we can launch this transformative model for community improvement. We want YOU to be one of our founding supporters. Your donation will enable us to invest all of our efforts and resources this summer toward a successful pilot. The amount of financial rewards we are able to distribute will be based on how much money we are able to raise. $20,000 will ensure our first 250 members get a leg up out of poverty for helping improve their community. With the success of this pilot, we will launch a full-scale program in 2015 with the goal of doubling membership and impact every year.


As a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization, your contribution is entirely tax deductible. You will receive an official letter with your donation amount after the fundraising campaign ends on July 3, 2014.


Join us as we reward involvement, create opportunity, and improve community. For more details about our mission, and an FAQ about this campaign and its perks, please visit unioncapitalboston.com/faq


Thank you for your support,
The Team of Union Capitalists
story_txt:

story:
Please Help Our Friend

Our friend Ryan has always helped us out so we wanted to help him. His car is breaking down and he has no way of fixing it. So we decided to try a crowd fundraiser for him. Please help us out to do something nice for him. We found out he is trying to save up enough to get a car from a coworker and we want to make sure he gets it.

story:
Who We Are & What We're Brewing

The Bramble Collective is a group of four Ithaca, NY-based herbalists with a dream to bring accessible, sustainable medicine to our community. With over 45  years of herbal training and services combined, we are coming together to offer our skills, passion and innovation to bring an herbal hub to downtown Ithaca on Press Bay Alley. This herbal hub will act as a retail store for bulk herbs, medicine-making supplies, local herbal products, and a community space for consultations, workshops, classes and events to be held by local practitioners, teachers, and wildcrafters. We believe that a sustainable and healthy community begins with access to sustainable medicine. This is why we are creating this space to host a low-cost herbal clinic where community members can access consultations with local herbalists and receive reduced-cost herbal remedies.


How YOU can help us bring this dream to life!

As a collective we are investing our own time, money and resources into this endeavor, but we can't do it on our own. Bramble is rooted in community: herbs from community farms, knowledge from community herbalists, and support from community members. This is why we are seeking your support to help us enrich our community by keeping it local and putting money back into the pockets of our neighbors. Your donations will help us:

  • pay local craftsmen to help us build the infrastructure of our space
  • stock our shelves with as many locally-sourced and organic herbs as possible
  • cover some of the costs to create promotional materials for the classes, workshops and events hosted by community members
When you donate you'll have the opportunity to receive various prizes from local community members. You will know that your money is not only supporting community herbalism through Bramble, but also local medicine makers, farmers, chefs and artists who believe in what we're doing and are offering their skills and products to our campaign.
We strongly believe in the collective efforts of a community and our ability to create sustainable change together. If you can't support us today financially, you can still support our project by sharing this campaign with your friends, families and even other communities who may want to create a community herbal hub in their area.


    What if we don't raise enough money?

    The Bramble Collective is committed to making this dream a reality, but our ability to offer a low-cost clinic and locally-sourced herbs may be compromised. We want to keep our resources local by applying the financial support of our friends and neighbors directly to our cause. We are creating this space for our community, not the banks, but if we don't raise enough money we will have to seek financial support through multiple loans. 

    However, if we surpass our goal, we will be able to offer a larger variety of locally sourced herbs (therefore further supporting our local farmers and herbalists) and begin to subsidize the costs of running a low-cost clinic!


      Want to become more involved with Bramble?

      The Bramble Collective is created for the community and by the community. We want Bramble to represent what can happen when community members come together to share their skills, visions and resources. If you are a local herbal enthusiast, farmer, herbalist or wellness practitioner and you want to become more involved in the collective you can become a "friend" of Bramble. Being a friend  is an on-going relationship that offers a variety of perks with a financial commitment that says you believe in what Bramble has to offer this community.

      Acquaintance  $150 per year ($12.50/month)
      Host free classes & free events (or 10% off on events with a fee), and receive love letters from the collective to be in-the-know about what's going on at Bramble.

      Buddy  $300 per year ($25/month)
      Host free classes & free events (or 10% off on events with a fee), receive love notes from the collective to be in-the-know about what's going on at Bramble 
      PLUS
      Earn a lower rental fee for consults AND earn a higher commission rate (75%) on products sold in the store!

      Friend  $600 per year ($50/month)
      Host free classes & free events (or 10% off on events with a fee), receive love notes from the collective to be in-the-know about what's going on at Bramble, earn a lower rental fee for consults and a higher commission rate (75%) on products sold in the store
      PLUS
      Be invited to special "friend" events, we'll place your name and logo on the front of our glass door, AND we'll feature your events/classes/products in a designated area of our store!

      Best Friends Forever  $1,200 ($100/month)
      Host free classes & free events (or 10% off on events with a fee), receive love notes from the collective to be in-the-know about what's going on at Bramble, earn a higher commission rate (75%) on products sold in the store, be invited to special "friend" events, your events/classes/products will be featured in a designated area of our store
      PLUS
      FREE rental fee for consults AND an even BIGGER version of your name and logo will be placed on the front of our glass door!


      For more information about becoming a friend of The Bramble Collective email us: BrambleIthaca@gmail.com

story:
We Are Looking Toward The Future And You Are An Important Part Of It!

              

In the video I talk about the challenges I've had to overcome both personally and professionally.  A two minute video isn't enough time to relay the hardship my family and business endured over the last three years. Nearly losing my business and my life within months of each other is almost more than one can endure. And then the mounting  personal and business bills just added more stress.  I would  never have overcome these obstacles without the help of an amazing family, an incredible network of friends, community  and barn family who helped keep the lights on in my absence,  stood side by side to change the government's position and helped me get healthy. I owe them everything!!

And the best way to thank everyone is by having a bright and successful future! I need your help to get Meadowood back on its feet. Capital improvements are essential for our success. Details are outlined below. The Meadowood Stables family  will be forever grateful for your contributions.  Great gfts for every donation level have been put together as a way to thank you.

Your contribution will also help the local Virginia economy. This viable business has pumped over $500,000 annually into the community by spending on support services such as farriers, vets, hay and grain suppliers and our great employees. Your contribution will allow the on-going support of these local businesses.

Capital Improvements: 

1. Arena Footing.  Footing is the material we ride on in the arena. Good footing is essential as it softens the horse’s steps and prevents slipping and tripping keeping the horse and rider safe. Ideally it is several inches deep and groomed regularly. There is a large indoor arena that needs to be regraded and new footing added. New new training aids such as an arena mirror and ground poles poles are needed.  

 Estimated costs:  $4000.00

A student  planking on  gentle pony Cookie in the arena


2. Pasture Management Items-Good pasture management is essential for a healthy horse and environment. Fence repair and maintenance, reseeding and pasture rotation, equipment storage and maintenance are just some of the things required to keep the farm up and running. The following items are needed for pasture managment:

Forage Seed/Spreader; Fencing-both wood and electric; Storage Unit for farming equipment.   

                                        

Estimated costs: $2000.00



Ben and Toby, residents at Meadowood Stables, enjoying a morning sunrise

Business Support:

Adopt A School Horse-Our riding lesson program is an essential part of the business.   Students range from very beginners to advanced riders. Equine Education classes are also offered for those who want to learn about horses and spend time in a barn, but not necessarily commit to ongoing riding lessons. Each of these classes ends with a pony ride. Onsite Pony Parties are offered too! Your help is needed  to offset costs of the wonderful school horses until I get back on my feet. For example a set of horse shoes for one horse is $140.00 every 7 weeks; a round of Spring vaccines/deworming is $50.00 per horse; a visit from the Equine Dentist which is essential to horse care is $100.00; a used quality bridle is $40.00; winter blankets range from $100-300.  Another horse is also needed for the lesson program

Estimated costs: $2000.00   

One of my clients working with Cookie

Meadowood Stables has been in operation for over 40 years and is an integral part of the community. Thank you for helping me and Meadwood "get back in the saddle" again!

Happy Trails,

 Allison

story:
Blissipline: it does a body good!  

Greetings!

Mary Clare here... happily creating sacred space on Erie Boulevard in Schenectady, NY.  Yoga is BLISS on the boulevard!   The energy in this building and the yoga community coming together in this space, creates an atmosphere that just plain 'old, "feels good."  

                 it will be the perfect space to get your bliss on- 

YogaBliss on the Blvd is founded under the guiding principles of love, grace, and gratitude.  We invite you to be in on the love, right from the beginning.  This campaign is to give the space a "kick in the bliss!"  That is an infusion of excitement and energy involving the community (you!) in laying a strong foundation.  Every contribution strengthens our supportive space.

As you can see by this video, there is a lot of work to be done.

Through this campaign we will be laying down a bamboo floor - sweet! - and purchasing all kinds of cushions - blissfully sweet! -

The floor is important, as it is our renewable connection to the earth.  The cushions come in to lend support in seated meditation, to support asana, and for restorative yoga.


...so check out how to be in and get blissed on the ground floor!



  • What We Need & What You Get

We're going for $5,000 in 21 days - we like to be modest and ambitious! 

The bamboo flooring adds up when you've got 720 square feet of studio floor to cover.

The cushions ranging in price from $15 to $60 each, add up fast too!  

Some might say walking into the space and enjoying a practice of yoga on a beautiful floor supported by cushioning in all the right places would be blissful enough!

Well, here is the exciting part.... we want you to feel the bliss and have it too!  

We are offering Blisses with every pledge - 

With every pledge we offer our gratitude for your good intention with a "Tea of Bliss" - that is, a  cup of a Blissful Blend by Divinitea.  Other Blisses can include the following:  "Sea of Bliss" that would be, specially blended bathsalts," created with love by Crossroads Gifts and Wellness, "Bliss Tea Cups" designed by a beloved local potter, Bliss-tees,  or even a whole  Bliss Party for you and up to 6 of your friends - Most important though, is the yoga and the wonderful blissful feeling that comes from practice and sharing in community.

 Who knew you could get blissed on the boulevard!

So check out your options, and help us lay the foundation!  

YogaBliss on the Blvd  is all about personal inquiry with compassion and conscious living...it is a place of good vibrations...  a safe and sacred space to develop practices for conscious, deliberate, joyful, healthy living.  

It is all good at YogaBliss...

Feel free to spread the bliss and put out the word!

Let the world know there is YogaBliss on the Blvd in Downtown Schenectady!

story:
Introducing Colorfully.me

Simple to use but powerful in-browser JS application that allows You to pick and/or type the design of Your website live in the browser. All You need to do is select the element You want to style and customize it via the easy to use tabbed by categories GUI. As You design elements CSS rules are created, updated, optimized, vendor-prefixed and saved automatically. Browse, organize, modify the style rules on the fly. Customize colors, borders, shadows and more...

Made with passion to ease and speed up your web development!

What We Need & What You Get

We want to develop a new version (v0.3) of the app with many new features suggested and funded by You! A month developing in full time will be invested in the new version if the goal is reached. You know this will be fun but it coast money because developers do not work for free...

We are passionate about web design and want to build the easiest to use but powerful and user friendly in-browser editor. That is where the funding will go to, no matter if campaign goal is touched or not!

 Our perks in detail:

  • Thank You! - we are grateful about your support and because we want to maintain "all time supporters list" we will add you as recognized supporter.
  • API key - you obtain lifetime API key! With the help of all app features will unlock and you will receive automatic updates when they are available. One key = unlimited installations thus suitable for all your projects.
  • Feature implemented - lift up website development to the next level by suggesting a feature and see it implemented in the coming release! We would like to know Your idea and will be happy to convert it to working stable code (if this is possible).
  • Campaign sponsor - become the backbone of v0.3 and start a long term relationship with innovation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about this campaign and share it with the world via the social buttons!

story:
• My name is Kelli Woody and I am from Springfield, Missouri. I am very passionate about ministry! I absolutely love people and helping anywhere I can. Last year I was very blessed to go on my first mission trip to Africa and this year, I feel called to go again. The organization that I go on these trips with is called iPourlife. The trip is in late May and so far I have raised $1,600 by selling pocket tee shirts that I make, saving tips from work and money I receive from babysitting. That leaves me with $1,400 to raise! That is why I need the help of my friends and family! The Lord has called me to missions and I wouldn't be here without His guidance. Not only His guidance in me, but in all of you. 

  • This campaign is very important to me because I feel called to go back to Africa and serve the people of Ethiopia. I was blessed with the opportunity last year and would love to go on the same trip this year. Although this year, our focus will be on the medical clinics that will be set up in Korah and Chuko, the areas that we visit on our trips. - Korah is a community made up of 100,000 people in a 1.5 mile radius. The men, women and children of this area essentially live around and on a trash dump. They have no clean water, no food and hardly any shelter. They are forgotten by most people because they have no education, hardly any communication and are very fearful of leaving Korah due to judgment. My heart was left in Korah last year and going back will again, change my life.  - Chuko is a small village south of Addis Ababa. We spent a portion of our time in this village last year because our team was apart of a water well being built in this village. A piece of my heart is also in this village because of the community and the amazing things that God has done for it. Continuing to bless this village with medical care is unbelievably exciting. - By investing in this trip, you will be apart of change in Africa. Much needed change that can only be done by our loving God, He moves mountains! Donations will be used for lodging, food and airfare, as well as supplies for the trip. 
  • Another thing that this trip needs is prayer. Prayer is more important than any amount of money and whether you donate or not, please keep us in your thoughts and prayers!
story_txt:
My name is Kelli Woody and I am from Springfield, Missouri. I am very passionate about ministry! I absolutely love people and helping anywhere I can. Last year I was very blessed to go on my first mission trip to Africa and this year, I feel called to go again. The organization that I go on these trips with is called iPourlife. The trip is in late May and so far I have raised $1,600 by selling pocket tee shirts that I make, saving tips from work and money I receive from babysitting. That leaves me with $1,400 to raise! That is why I need the help of my friends and family! The Lord has called me to missions and I wouldn't be here without His guidance. Not only His guidance in me, but in all of you. 



This campaign is very important to me because I feel called to go back to Africa and serve the people of Ethiopia. I was blessed with the opportunity last year and would love to go on the same trip this year. Although this year, our focus will be on the medical clinics that will be set up in Korah and Chuko, the areas that we visit on our trips. - Korah is a community made up of 100,000 people in a 1.5 mile radius. The men, women and children of this area essentially live around and on a trash dump. They have no clean water, no food and hardly any shelter. They are forgotten by most people because they have no education, hardly any communication and are very fearful of leaving Korah due to judgment. My heart was left in Korah last year and going back will again, change my life.  - Chuko is a small village south of Addis Ababa. We spent a portion of our time in this village last year because our team was apart of a water well being built in this village. A piece of my heart is also in this village because of the community and the amazing things that God has done for it. Continuing to bless this village with medical care is unbelievably exciting. - By investing in this trip, you will be apart of change in Africa. Much needed change that can only be done by our loving God, He moves mountains! Donations will be used for lodging, food and airfare, as well as supplies for the trip. 

Another thing that this trip needs is prayer. Prayer is more important than any amount of money and whether you donate or not, please keep us in your thoughts and prayers!

story:
CLICK HERE FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN 


Short Summary

Last December, the UC Davis chapter of Project RISHI visited Anandwan, our partner community in India, for the first time. Anandwan was founded to give individuals with leprosy and disabilities a chance to live their lives to the fullest and thrive in society. Many of the people we had met were forced to leave their homes and families and had no other place to go. By providing them with healthcare, education, and vocational training, Anandwan serves to reintegrate many of these individuals back into the societies from which they once fled.

While Anandwan has made great strides against the inequalities faced by its residents, there are still a lot of barriers they face.


Goals & Incentives

The projects we have planned for our upcoming trip include:

  • Developing a curriculum of professionalism workshops that incorporate critical thinking/reasoning, interview and resume skills, and computer skills such as email and web search. 

  • Donating a Xerox machine to the local school to allow teachers to make copies of worksheets and class materials.

  • Acquiring a braille printer so that students at the school for the blind can have alternate ways of learning class material.

  • Raising funds to buy functional hearing aids for hard-of-hearing students in the school for the deaf.

  • Establishing an English Language Learning Center to enable students to compete in an increasingly competitive and global job market.


The Impact

In Anandwan, we found that many students have trouble gaining employment outside of the village due to their lack of English proficiency. While many informal English classes are taking place, some of the students who attend these classes do not fully understand the lessons and lack conversational skills. Additionally, blind and deaf/hard-of-hearing students face barriers from the inaccessibility of lecture material. The hearing aids currently used by some of the deaf students are of very poor quality and the blind students are taught solely by lecturing without access to written materials to supplement those lectures. Many of the local teachers also lack proper resources and informed us that the expenses for printing workbooks and class materials currently come out of their own pockets.

We aim to provide pathways to success for every student in the village by providing them with key resources that they can use to advance their studies. By empowering the students, we will ensure that they will be able to eventually contribute back to their community. As part of our mission, we hope to make all of the projects self-sustainable by the Anandwan community. We will be taking an evidence-based approach to ensure that all of our projects will truly have an impact.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word about Project RISHI and our work by sharing the link to this campaign. You can also read about our experiences in India at http://projectrishiucdavis.blogspot.com/

story:
About GenSexNYC:


GenSexNYC is an anti-oppression sexuality workshop for all gender identities.  We work to build a safer, braver community of participants in the New York City area to share and explore our experiences of identity.


Help us make this happen!


This fall, we will have three workshop sections in the NYC area. To cover the cost of space, materials, and our online presence for the season, we need to raise $3,000. All our organizers and facilitators volunteer their time and are unpaid. 100% of your donations will go towards the cost of running the workshop.


We are committed to making the workshop available to all--regardless of their ability to pay. Participant fees are by donation and go towards the cost of workshop materials.


By helping to make GenSexNYC a reality, you will support a movement of empowerment, allyship, community, and learning in New York City. We are so excited about bringing this workshop series into the NYC community.


Other Ways you can help:


Share this fundraising link! Are you a past participant of a FemSex or GenSex workshop in another city? Send it to your old section with a hello and an update! Send it to your siblings, friends, co workers, parents, and mentors! Let them know what you got out of the workshop and why you think it's important to hold in communities everywhere.  


A little more about us:

GenSexNYC is a volunteer-organized, multi-week discussion- and activity-based workshop.  At weekly facilitated meetings, participants explore different facets of identity and how they intersect:  gender, sexuality and pleasure, race and ethnicity, communication and consent, class, health and ability, and others.  Each topic is discussed in the framework of privilege and oppression.  Personal narratives can be spoken or expressed creatively, and meetings also include a variety of collaborative group activities.  While facilitators provide readings and other educational resources, participants are also welcome and encouraged to share new or additional resources.

By recounting and listening, we challenge our assumptions and learn from our peers as a community, setting aside judgment to validate each others’ ideas and experiences.  GenSexNYC becomes a safer space by encouraging mutual acceptance, and by extension a braver platform for sharing vulnerable thoughts and stories.

GenSexNYC strives to include people of all genders, races, ethnicities, sexualities, incomes, ages, religions, and abilities.


If you have questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us at gensexnyc@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary.

Enrique is on a team of workers remodeling our kitchen.  He is always on time, does excellent work, and cleans up the work area at the end of every day.  I would describe him as a hard worker, extreamly competent, quiet and polite.  Enrique has been working five days a week at my house and told me he works Saturdays and Sundays also, seven days a week, because he needs the income. 

He bought his used red truck less than a year ago and carried all his tools in the attached and locked tool boxes in the truck bed.  This truck was not only his valued transportation but the source of his livelihood.

Last Wednesday, he and his brother Flavio, who is also working on the remodel, were going back and forth from the truck to my kitchen with various tools during their workday.  On one return to the truck, between 12:30 and 1 p.m., the truck disappeared.  Enrique has the keys in his pocket and assumes the truck was hot wired.  They called the police and a report was made, but to date, the truck has not been found.  Enrique carried liability car insurance only, so his truck is not covered under his policy.

I am launching this campaign because I would like to help Enrique with funds to replace his truck. A number of people in our neighborhood also feel badly that this happened on our block and expressed an interest in contributing.  I know a number of of our friends and aquaintances have used the same contractor and thus Enrique may well have worked on their houses too.  This campaign will allow him to raise funds from his own friends and family as well. 

What We Need & What You Get

The amount of this campaign is the exact amount Enrique paid for his truck about 8 months ago.  Our family is contributing to this campaign and we hope you will too.  If we don't reach our goal, we will give Enrique everything we have raised.  If we reach our goal before the 3-month deadline, we will stop this campaign as soon as our goal is reached.

Anyone who contributes to this campaign will be invited to an open-house, with food and drink, once our kitchen is remodeled!

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign, you are sending the message that we are all responsible for each other and the kind of world or neighborhood we want to live in.  We are helping someone in need, doing a kind deed. 

This is also a teachable moment as we have discussed this unjustice with our children and they are going to have a lemonade stand and other fundraisers to contribute to this campaign. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please send this campaign information to others (use the Indiegogo share tools).  You could also send a note and I will get it to Enrique.   

Thank you, Elizabeth

story:
Who are we?

My name is Trent Jones. I am 20 years old. I am the founder and owner of T3 Bat Company. We are a baseball bat company and brand based out of Georgia. 

After playing baseball for 17 years, I decided I would really love to continue to be around the game after I graduate college. I have also coincidentally been infatuated with business since the earliest days of my youth which led to my choosing of a business major in college. So of course, this sparked the idea for my own baseball brand. Since then, this spark has ignited a fire that continues to be the heart of T3 Bat Company.


Why do we need funding?

Well, thank you for asking.

T3 Bat Company is currently supplying high-quality handcrafted wood baseball bats to players from all parts of Georgia and even a variety of other states through our social media and website. We are currently struggling intensely to make bats as quickly as we sell them due to poor equipment. 

From my experience selling T3 bats, it has become apparent to me that our customers are also interested in purchasing shirts, hats, etc. That is why I would also like to expand in the near future to selling apparel. Being a college baseball player, I not only know what baseball players would purchase and wear, but I also have a great opportunity to get feedback directly from the target market. 

In addition to this, custom bat making is one of our top selling products. And at our current size, we have not been able to purchase a wood engraving laser capable of adding custom text onto our bats. This would, without question, have a serious impact on sales.

So specifically, here is what all funds will go to:

  • More durable wood-working Tools
  • Higher Quality Wood Lathe
  • T3 Apparel Line
  • Wood-engraving Laser

What is in it for you?

You really cannot understand how much your support helps. By helping fund T3 Bat
Company, you are making a positive difference on myself, my customers, and hopefully someday, the baseball community. That is why it is so important for me to make sure I show my appreciate to those who help me. Please take time to read what is in it for supporters: 

Reward Packages

  • Firstly, the extreme gratitude of me and my company for even taking the time to read this. 
  • At $10.00, supporters will receive a written letter of thanks, a shout-out on our twitter page, and a certificate of support. (All supporters of greater than $10.00 will also receive these.) 
  • At $25.00, supporters can receive a T3 Bat Company T-Shirt
  • At $50.00, supporters can receive a mini souvenir wood "Thank You" bat made by T3 Bat Company  
  • At $65.00, supporters can receive a handcrafted, bone-rubbed, customized professional grade baseball bat.
  • At $75.00, supporters can recieve a handcrafted, bone rubbed, customized professional grade fungo bat. 

Sounds pretty good right? Well check this out. In addition to the above packages, we have also created a different type of reward if you prefer: We are offering lifetime discounts to supporters. These discounts range from 10% to 30% depending on the amount donated. And that is correct, those discounts are good for life.
Discount Reward Packages
  • Support of $100.00 - this is good for a lifetime discount of 10% on all T3 Products
  • Support of $200.00 - this is good for a lifetime discount of 20% on all T3 Products
  • Support of $300.00 - this is good for a lifetime discount of 30% on all T3 Prodcuts

The Future of T3 Bat Company

Of course, T3 Bat Company is much more than just a business. As T3 grows into a more widely recognized baseball brand, I would like to promote positive messages to players, specifically the youth, across the country through the game. Whether it be the importance of school, sportsmanship, helping others, or anything else we are called to do. 

We would reward select players we see playing the game with good sportsmanship and volunteering in their community, as well as academic scholarships for players who work hard in school as well as on the field. 

This is one of the many ways T3 Bat Company is different than any other baseball brand. Not only will we supply the highest quality baseball equipment and apparel, but we will also work hard to encourage positive attributes in players and reward them when we witness these qualities at work.



Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? No worries! Here are other ways to can help T3. 

  • Spread the word about T3 Bat Company and encourage them to contribute to this campaign!
  • Visit our website and follow us on social media
  • Need a bat? T3 Bat Company would love to craft you a custom one, and you are helping this business grow. 


Thank you again for taking the time to read about T3 Bat Company. We sincerely hope that we have caught your attention and shown you the great value of a company with values like ours. We appreciate your time.

Spread the word about T3 Bat Company and encourage them to contribute to this campaign! Visit our website and follow us on social media

story:
Oklahoma Organic Farm & Ranch 

NO GMO OR HARSH CANCER CAUSING CHEMICALS. THE EARTH WAS HERE LONG BEFORE MAN AND WILL BE HERE LONG AFTER.


Hello and thank you viewing our fundraising campaign. Allow me to introduce myself to those who do not know me. I am Marc Mills, an American Farmer in Guthrie, Oklahoma. I have an amazing passion for growing, cooking and eating organic food. Food ranging from salad greens to tomatoes and peppers, to organic grass fed meats. Not only enough to feed my friends and family, but enough to feed a whole community.

Our farm is nestled in the cottonwood creek valley, just southwest of Guthrie Oklahoma and approximately 10 miles north of Edmond, Oklahoma. The meandering Cottonwood creek runs through the east, south and north sides of our farm giving us approximately a mile of water front. We are blessed with an abundance of bottomland flood plane which keeps our soils deep and rich and our pastures support life.

We currently raise organic hay and small vegetable crops and pasture raised beef, chicken & pork. When we complete the funding we will diversify our farm in amazing ways by completing a steel building, and converting an old barn to a aquaponics greenhouse where we will have fresh green vegetables year round.

Our vision of the plan for the steel building, when complete, is to process tree nuts, from our own organic pecan and black walnut groves, as well as being available for others to process their and market their tree nuts in an efficient affordable manner. Central Oklahoma has many pecan and black walnut trees, there is a demand for processing tree nuts. 

Secondly, but as equally as important as the first is our aquaponics greenhouse. When complete, It will supply fresh fish and vegetables, enough to feed a hundred people a DAY with fruits, vegetables and fish/pork/beef/chicken. We have scaled the greenhouse into 3 phases, this fundraiser will only complete phase one, which is the initial setup of the of the aquaponics system, we already have the components in place. 


Major Milestones

We have the steel building kit which is 64' x 45' x 17' high already delivered and on the ground. The concrete footing has already been completed. What still needs to be done, rocks that were dumped in our footing need to be removed, the dirt leveled, plumbing and electric conduit roughed in, gravel poured in and then concrete. After this is complete it takes a 5-6 person crew 3 days to erect the steel structure. 

This building will house our nut operation with 2 commercial hard nut crackers, separators, shakers, scales and bag/packaging systems. 

Aquaponics is the the combination of aquaculture (fish farming) and hydroponics.

Phase one of the aquaponics greenhouse will be small, retrofitting an existing pole barn by our crew, using a polycarbonate panel system.  For the aqua part of the project we have one 3800 gallon tank which is ready to be put in service, just have to put in a pump and plumbing. The greenhouse will be located in an old 50x75 pole hay barn and use a closed water system with soil, yes soil, we have very good soil, and our soil is forgiving. With the skills we have gained in 20+ years of gardening, we will be on a fast track to growing in no time at all. The tank will house and grow tilapia.

Our future plans, phases 2 and 3, for expansion will be using a deep water pond. Temperature and light are the key to success in the aquaponics success.The water in the tank will be recirculated below the freeze line to keep a stable temperature for both the fish and the plants.

Currently we are using traditional gardening, we have also set up indoor grow rooms.

Our fundraising goals are quite ambitious. If we do not meet them, the projects will still go on and the perks will still be done. 


Perks!

This has probably been the greatest challenge of the entire crowd funding endeavor. I do not like the idea of taking money for nothing. Then a couple of young friends were making a film and asked to use the farm as a back drop for aerial photo shots. One thing led to another and the conversation led to crowd funding, this is what gave them funds to shoot the film. After hearing about their perks, I was confident I could come up with my own. I had a brain storming session with my wife and family, each offering up some great ideas. I then had hundreds of potential perk ideas, from giving away half a processed pork or an eighth of a beef steer to sending out salad. Finally a few perks stuck. Each conveys a passion of myself or my family, the value of the perks cannot be measured in nickels and dimes, nor can the value of your generosity be measured in cost. Each perk is made with love using the Oklahoma standard of doing it we'll or not doing it at all.  With that said, travel to and from the farm is not included in the perks.


Video Shout Out From The Farm!

Our fundraising Happens nickels and dimes at a time.  While we have made every effort to have quality perks, we understand that times are hard everywhere, not just on the farm. Our video shout out can be on YouTube, Facebook, or Instagram, you choose, it will express our heartfelt gratitude and be personally made to you, not just some generic thank you.  Also we will send you our monthly news letter.


8" Pumpkin & 8" Pecan Pie! 

Adding this perk just in time for holiday parties. You will get two pies, one pumpkin and one pecan, both made with the major ingredients produced organically right here  on our farm.

We will then produce 100 of each for this campaign. As of July 2014, this will be the only way you can get one of these pies. If our harvest is bountiful, then it will be possible to make more, but won't know until November.

The Impact We Make On The Community

By our very nature as a family whom seeks to serve others, we make a community impact. From our humble beginnings on 3 acres in Spencer, Ok, to now being able to grow acres of organic crops, raise free range poultry, grass fed beef and pork on over 100 acres, we have made a very positive impact all along the way.

Ultimately, when complete, we will grow enough good organic food to feed multiple families at a cost they can afford. Feeding your family wholesome organic fruits, vegetables and meat should not be privilege left to the elite. As grocery store prices are on the rise, we will be able to offer our organic food at or below grocery store prices.

Our pumpkin patch in October opens the farm to the community with agro tourism and fun games pick your own pumpkin patch and hayrides open to the public.

We listen to the weeds tell us what crops will grow best, the grass and bugs sing a song of joy by not being forced to die from harsh chemical poisoning. The trees ring in harmony as the rain falls to the earth gracefully. Everything we do on this farm is for the future generations. 

Risks & Challenges

Agribusiness is a very challenging risky field in of itself. In addition to the unthinkable loss of life and limb, modern agriculture of working the land that has been over used, not regenerated and in an environment that is ever changing. The future of feeding the masses is going to have to change to more localized food sources. With factory farming relying on petroleum based fuel & fertilizers the cost of food will ever be increasing in the supermarket. The largest risks we face in this phase of fundraising and putting the building will be weather related. 

We face numerous trials and errors every day on the farm with no magic one size fits all plan. Our biggest challenge thus far with the crowd funding has been the perks and finding the "crowd". While I thought of hundreds of ideas, I finally had to narrow them down to make them feasible so everyone can participate.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like the Idea of Oklahoma Organic Farm, but impossible for you to be a financial contributor? Help us make some noise about this campaign. Share it on your social networking sites and groups, tell people about it at church, school and on the street. Indiegogo has some excellent sharing tools, feel free to email me and I can send you calling cards or flyers to pass out, together we can fund this whole campaign. Lettuce goes from seed to the table in about 6 weeks, one person can grow a lot of lettuce, however, to feed the masses it takes the masses. Help spread the word, I would be happy to send you my quarterly news letter so you will be informed as to what is happening on the farm and when. Also in the news letter, available shares for sale in the csa will be listed.
story_txt: Oklahoma Organic Farm & Ranch NO GMO OR HARSH CANCER CAUSING CHEMICALS. THE EARTH WAS HERE LONG BEFORE MAN AND WILL BE HERE LONG AFTER.Hello and thank you viewing our fundraising campaign. Allow me to introduce myself to those who do not know me. I am Marc Mills, an American Farmer in Guthrie, Oklahoma. I have an amazing passion for growing, cooking and eating organic food. Food ranging from salad greens to tomatoes and peppers, to organic grass fed meats. Not only enough to feed my friends and family, but enough to feed a whole community.Our farm is nestled in the cottonwood creek valley, just southwest of Guthrie Oklahoma and approximately 10 miles north of Edmond, Oklahoma. The meandering Cottonwood creek runs through the east, south and north sides of our farm giving us approximately a mile of water front. We are blessed with an abundance of bottomland flood plane which keeps our soils deep and rich and our pastures support life.We currently raise organic hay and small vegetable crops and pasture raised beef, chicken & pork. When we complete the funding we will diversify our farm in amazing ways by completing a steel building, and converting an old barn to a aquaponics greenhouse where we will have fresh green vegetables year round.Our vision of the plan for the steel building, when complete, is to process tree nuts, from our own organic pecan and black walnut groves, as well as being available for others to process their and market their tree nuts in an efficient affordable manner. Central Oklahoma has many pecan and black walnut trees, there is a demand for processing tree nuts. Secondly, but as equally as important as the first is our aquaponics greenhouse. When complete, It will supply fresh fish and vegetables, enough to feed a hundred people a DAY with fruits, vegetables and fish/pork/beef/chicken. We have scaled the greenhouse into 3 phases, this fundraiser will only complete phase one, which is the initial setup of the of the aquaponics system, we already have the components in place.    Major MilestonesWe have the steel building kit which is 64' x 45' x 17' high already delivered and on the ground. The concrete footing has already been completed. What still needs to be done, rocks that were dumped in our footing need to be removed, the dirt leveled, plumbing and electric conduit roughed in, gravel poured in and then concrete. After this is complete it takes a 5-6 person crew 3 days to erect the steel structure. This building will house our nut operation with 2 commercial hard nut crackers, separators, shakers, scales and bag/packaging systems. Aquaponics is the the combination of aquaculture (fish farming) and hydroponics.Phase one of the aquaponics greenhouse will be small, retrofitting an existing pole barn by our crew, using a polycarbonate panel system.  For the aqua part of the project we have one 3800 gallon tank which is ready to be put in service, just have to put in a pump and plumbing. The greenhouse will be located in an old 50x75 pole hay barn and use a closed water system with soil, yes soil, we have very good soil, and our soil is forgiving. With the skills we have gained in 20+ years of gardening, we will be on a fast track to growing in no time at all. The tank will house and grow tilapia.Our future plans, phases 2 and 3, for expansion will be using a deep water pond. Temperature and light are the key to success in the aquaponics success.The water in the tank will be recirculated below the freeze line to keep a stable temperature for both the fish and the plants.Currently we are using traditional gardening, we have also set up indoor grow rooms.Our fundraising goals are quite ambitious. If we do not meet them, the projects will still go on and the perks will still be done. Perks!This has probably been the greatest challenge of the entire crowd funding endeavor. I do not like the idea of taking money for nothing. Then a couple of young friends were making a film and asked to use the farm as a back drop for aerial photo shots. One thing led to another and the conversation led to crowd funding, this is what gave them funds to shoot the film. After hearing about their perks, I was confident I could come up with my own. I had a brain storming session with my wife and family, each offering up some great ideas. I then had hundreds of potential perk ideas, from giving away half a processed pork or an eighth of a beef steer to sending out salad. Finally a few perks stuck. Each conveys a passion of myself or my family, the value of the perks cannot be measured in nickels and dimes, nor can the value of your generosity be measured in cost. Each perk is made with love using the Oklahoma standard of doing it we'll or not doing it at all.  With that said, travel to and from the farm is not included in the perks.Video Shout Out From The Farm!Our fundraising Happens nickels and dimes at a time.  While we have made every effort to have quality perks, we understand that times are hard everywhere, not just on the farm. Our video shout out can be on YouTube, Facebook, or Instagram, you choose, it will express our heartfelt gratitude and be personally made to you, not just some generic thank you.  Also we will send you our monthly news letter.8" Pumpkin & 8" Pecan Pie! Adding this perk just in time for holiday parties. You will get two pies, one pumpkin and one pecan, both made with the major ingredients produced organically right here  on our farm.We will then produce 100 of each for this campaign. As of July 2014, this will be the only way you can get one of these pies. If our harvest is bountiful, then it will be possible to make more, but won't know until November.The Impact We Make On The Community By our very nature as a family whom seeks to serve others, we make a community impact. From our humble beginnings on 3 acres in Spencer, Ok, to now being able to grow acres of organic crops, raise free range poultry, grass fed beef and pork on over 100 acres, we have made a very positive impact all along the way.Ultimately, when complete, we will grow enough good organic food to feed multiple families at a cost they can afford. The trees ring in harmony as the rain falls to the earth gracefully. Everything we do on this farm is for the future generations.    Risks & Challenges Agribusiness is a very challenging risky field in of itself. In addition to the unthinkable loss of life and limb, modern agriculture of working the land that has been over used, not regenerated and in an environment that is ever changing. The future of feeding the masses is going to have to change to more localized food sources. With factory farming relying on petroleum based fuel & fertilizers the cost of food will ever be increasing in the supermarket. The largest risks we face in this phase of fundraising and putting the building will be weather related. We face numerous trials and errors every day on the farm with no magic one size fits all plan. Our biggest challenge thus far with the crowd funding has been the perks and finding the "crowd". While I thought of hundreds of ideas, I finally had to narrow them down to make them feasible so everyone can participate. story:
Hard-working, Snarky Couple want time elsewhere

Hey guys, my girlfriend, Carly, and I are trying to go on a vacation this fall. We both work full time and take on any odd jobs we can to earn $$$. We have saved and sacrificed what we could, including Motley Crue's last concert tour tickets, baby-sitting awful children and we haven't eaten out for months, Can you say TOP RAMEN? We have sold precious personal belongings, including Mondo Posters and all of Carly's Christmas and birthday gifts (like the brooch given to her by her grandmother while on her deathbed!) to increase the fund. But it's not quite enough. So we are reaching out to you for some help! We are willing to make it worth your time! Don't have the vacation time to go to Disney World? Not enough moola to take the family to Harry Potter World? Or is it Mondo Posters you want but can't make it to Austin for MondoCon? We got YOU covered! Help us to our destination and we happily get you what you desire, and you'll probably get some sarcastic replies along the way!

Yo, it's simple! Get us outta town and we'll give you a magical experience!

Enjoy the fun from the comfort of your own home! We'll send you touristy photos and novelty keepsakes. You won't even have to endure the tedious parts of walking miles trying to avoid parades, paying $9 for a rubbery cheeseburger, pretending to smile or pay big bucks for some hunk-o-junk souvenir. 

  • I promise you'll get fun stuff! Also, you'll be able to track us on our journey via Facebook!
  • Most importantly, you can make my true love's dream come true (and keep me out of the doghouse!) 

Risks & Challenges

Carly has MS and gets super cranky and uncomfortable in the heat (not sure why she thought Florida would be fun)... 

  • She will be wearing an ugly-ass vest (It is pretty ugly...) with pockets that hold ice packs to keep her icy heart at a nice and cool temperature! 
  • I will try to be understanding and ENJOY going into EVERY air-conditioned gift shop. Each freaking one!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Apparently we aren't the only poor people in town. *SIGH* Share this super hilarious page with your friends and family. Maybe they are better than you and have enough money to actually do something. Maybe you want one of our super cool prizes and you ask them to contribute for your birthday present! 
  • We would love your feedback and ideas of where to go or, more importantly, NOT go... We will be setting up a facebook page for all comments you might have for us!
  • This is where we remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools!

You will probably notice that the prizes in our tiers are vague. They are as much a mystery to us as they are to you. We don't know what cool items we will find and we don't want to get bogged down with the details. We promise you a magnet and then find the world's coolest toy, we will be forced to adhere to our promise of the magnet... Keeping our promises vague, will allow us to keep the stashes awesome! We won't cheap out, that we DO promise! Everyone loves a mystery and we are excited to find fun things to send out. We are also looking forward to bringing you on vacation with us. Remember, the crazier the pic, the more interesting the trip!!!

And that's all there is to it. Pay up Mutha truckers! Donate some money or advice, we're not asking for your kidney. Yet... Mua ha ha ha! We figure if everyone were to donate a little (or even better, A LOT), then we could make this happen and do it right! And don't worry, we called ahead to make sure Wally World was open!

story:
The story

Hello, my name is Valentin Barbu, I'm 27 years old, and I`m from Romania. I`m opening this campaign with the hope I can get your help in order to pay the legal expenses I need to pay to the lady I had a car accident. Here what happened.

On 13 February 2012, around 10:15 AM, my future wife at that time ( now we are married ) got a call from the person for which she was working and asked her to come and check something related with her job. She asked me to take her to there with my father car. 

I drive to the place, and because I couldn't find a place where to stay with the car, I had to go outside and move the car, and while I was driving, in time of less then a second I got blinded by the sun  and a lady appeared in front of me, I instantly pressed the brake but she was too close and I couldn't stop the car without hit her. 

I was shocked, and it took me some seconds to get my mind cleared a bit, then shaking I went out from the car and went immediately to the lady and asked her if she`s fine and called 112 ( our urgency phone number ), and asked the other people who came there to step away and don't move her from the place as that may put her live in danger.

In about 10 minutes a rescue car came and get her to the hospital. after that I had to go to the police and explained what happened, and then went to the hospital to see if the lady is safe and to see if I can help her with something, but her family refused and I understand this, because probably the same would do anyone in a such time when some beloved just had an accident. After about 1 month after the lady exit the hospital, she proceeded and took me in front of the judge, asking me to pay her around 150.000$ ( this is simply a huge amount for a normal person, here in Romania that amount is simply a dream for a person ).

After two years of trials the lady won, and the judge asked the car insurance company to pay her, and I had to pay some expenses.

Now I received a citation from the lady asking me to pay her around 1500$ in 10 days, meaning some legal expenses, but I can't afford paying her that amount, specially in a such short period.

I would be really grateful if you can help me to raise this amount.

Thanks.

story:
The magnitude of this disaster will unfold over the coming months. The focus now is to save as any lives as possible, and rightly so. Most of the people who have made it to rescue camps do not have a second base outside the state, and will have to rely on Govt and voluntary support and donations to survive the next few months. Hundreds of houses have collapses or have been been rendered inhabitable. 

As days go by the situation in the valley is worsening. People urgently need drinking water, food, medicines for critical illnesses, clothes and shelter. Though the government is doing their part for the rehabilitation, we feel the need to reach out to the wider community around the world to contribute towards relief efforts which aims to raise funds to provide the following support: 

Immediately: 

  1. Support rescue of people still stranded 
  2. Provide food, drinking water and medicines 

Longer Term (2-3 months): 

  1. Provide shelter, clothes and blankets to families that have been made homeless who do not have the option of leaving the valley and will have to face a bitter winter
  2. Provide medical support to counter spread of water borne diseases

If you prefer to donate food, clothing or medicines instead, please email gaurav.k.bahri@gmail.com or parveshbahri@gmail.com, and we will guide you to the nearest collection point.

Please help spread the word around. This is a massive effort and we will need all the support we can get.

story:
What are we fighting for?

Concept:

CitySpecialz didn’t agree with the current model for Daily Deal Websites. Why would we pay a third party to discover our favorite local businesses? In response to this question we created something different, fun, engaging, and conscientious. CitySpecialz is absolutely free for its members! We use daily deal websites to enjoy the awesome businesses that our cities have to offer. CitySpecialz is founded on principles that allow local businesses to receive 100% revenue from their offers so they can keep providing you with the excellent experiences that make our cities unique. CitySpecialz does not take a percentage for the deals offered!

Values:

Striving for excellence, CitySpecialz is the most contemporary marketplace for the best things to do in your city. As a new wave in its genre of daily deal websites, we provide a trusted and beneficial source of advertising and customer service. We help local and national businesses grow by introducing them to high-quality new customers. Our marketing solutions for businesses large and small provide our partners with the tools to make customers their regulars.

Customers:

CitySpecialz offers you an opportunity to explore undiscovered businesses to add to your favorite places. You can win vouchers and download Specialz for services and products offered by those businesses. Be a part of the newest genre in Daily Deals and help your local business succeed by paying them directly. 

The Team:


Kolio Plachkov - Kolio has a great passion for local businesses and non-profits. He graduated at the prestigious Julliard School in New York City and is currently the Associate Principle Horn at the Colorado Symphony. Kolio came up with this great idea 8 months ago, when he introduced it to the rest of the CitySpecialz team.

Koko Zarov - Koko attended the Academy of Economics in Bulgaria, until 2011, when he moved to the US. He transferred to Metropolitan State University of Denver, where he played for the Men`s soccer team, and is currently majoring in Economics and International Business. Before CitySpecialz, Koko worked for a major bank in the US. His work and life experience helped him to see the importance of CitySpecialz and the impact it might have on the local businesses. 

Jacob Glenn - Jacob Glenn is currently attending Metropolitan State University of Denver with Koko Zarov. He has a rich background of creating and training teams to perform to their utmost potential. His meticulous nature is complimented by his drive to problem solve obstacles of any magnitude.

Concept:

CitySpecialz didn’t agree with the current model for Daily Deal Websites. Why would we pay a third party to discover our favorite local businesses? In response to this question we created something different, fun, engaging, and conscientious. CitySpecialz is absolutely free for its members! We use daily deal websites to enjoy the awesome businesses that our cities have to offer. CitySpecialz is founded on principles that allow local businesses to receive 100% revenue from their offers so they can keep providing you with the excellent experiences that make our cities unique. CitySpecialz does not take a percentage for the deals offered!

Values:
