As a new wave in its genre of daily deal websites, we provide a trusted and beneficial source of advertising and customer service. We help local and national businesses grow by introducing them to high-quality new customers. Our marketing solutions for businesses large and small provide our partners with the tools to make customers their regulars.

Customers:

CitySpecialz offers you an opportunity to explore undiscovered businesses to add to your favorite places. You can win vouchers and download Specialz for services and products offered by those businesses. Be a part of the newest genre in Daily Deals and help your local business succeed by paying them directly. 


Let`s do it together! Let`s change the way daily deals websites operate. It is a billion dollar industry and together we can direct that money where it belongs! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $40,000 that we are going to use for our app development. We will need a total of between $80,000 and $120,000 for the application, but we are hopping to raise the rest of the money in the next 2 to 3 months outside of indiegogo.

If you support us we will send you a gift card for a local business of your choice.  

Without the mobile application we will not be able to compete with our competitors.  

    The Impact

    One of our greedy competitors has recently reported a profit of over $1 billion, money that could have gone to the local businesses. The total industry revenue is over $3 billion annually. Many small local businesses have gone out of business because of their advertising on daily deals websites. Daily deal websites usually charge 30-70 % of every deal they sell.  CitySpecialz does not take a percentage and our users will be paying directly to the businesses. 

      Greedy Competitors 

      We do not want to mention the names of our competitors, but most you will know them and probably use them. Our biggest concern is that as soon as they find out about us, they will try to shut us down. It has happened in the past. Nothing will stop us to achieve our goal, and we will not sell the concept at any price. We want to make sure that the local businesses get what they deserve!

        Money does not buy everything! 

        The team of CitySpecialz will greatly appreciate any advice from people with experience in marketing, start-ups, app and web development.

        If you believe that our idea is going to benefit local businesses, please get the word about us to people and business owners you know.

use daily deal websites to enjoy the awesome businesses that our cities have to
offer. CitySpecialz is founded on principles that allow local businesses to
receive 100% revenue from their offers so they can keep providing you with the
excellent experiences that make our cities unique. CitySpecialz does not take a percentage for the deals offered!
Values:
Striving
for excellence, Cityspecialz is the most contemporary marketplace for the best
things to do in your city. As a new wave in its genre of daily deal websites,
we provide a trusted and beneficial source of advertising and customer service.
We help local and national businesses grow by introducing them to high-quality
new customers. Our marketing solutions for businesses large and small provide
our partners with the tools to make customers their regulars. 
Customers:
CitySpecialz
offers you an opportunity to explore undiscovered businesses to
add to your favorite places. You can win vouchers and download
Specialz for services and products offered by those businesses. Be a part
of the newest genre in Daily Deals and help your local business succeed by
paying them directly. Let`s do it together! Let`s change the way daily deals websites operate. It is a billion dollar industry and together we can direct that money where it belongs!    What We Need & What You Get We are looking for $40,000 that we are going to use for our app development. We will need a total of between $80,000 and $120,000 for the application, but we are hopping to raise the rest of the money in the next 2 to 3 months outside of indiegogo.
If you support us we will send you a gift card for a local business of your choice.  Without the mobile application we will not be able to compete with our competitors.    The Impact One of our greedy competitors has recently reported a profit of over $1 billion, money that could have gone to the local businesses. The total industry revenue is over $3 billion annually. Many small local businesses have gone out of business because of their advertising on daily deals websites. Daily deal websites usually charge 30-70 % of every deal they sell.  CitySpecialz does not take a percentage and our users will be paying directly to the businesses.   Greedy Competitors  We do not want to mention the names of our competitors, but most you will know them and probably use them. Our biggest concern is that as soon as they find out about us, they will try to shut us down. It has happened in the past. Nothing will stop us to achieve our goal, and we will not sell the concept at any price. We want to make sure that the local businesses get what they deserve!  Money does not buy everything!  The team of CitySpecialz will greatly appreciate any advice from people with experience in marketing, start-ups, app and web development.If you believe that our idea is going to benefit local businesses, please get the word about us to people and business owners you know.

story:
S'il vous plaît soutenez le rêve d'un couple de jeunes mariés de commencer un éco-village et une ferme éducative.

Por favor, apoye el sueño de una pareja de recién casados ​​para comenzar una eco-aldea y granja de retiro educativo.

Together we can unite one green world!

OM SHANTI EMPOWERMENT CENTER is the embodiment of our vision:
an educational eco-village and farm retreat. At Om Shanti, we make various natural products, such as soaps, candles and jewelry (seeds, coconut shells, hydroponic clay pebbles). We also offer workshops via Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/Om-Shanti-Empowerment-Sustainability-Meetup/. Although we love Downtown Phoenix, we’ve outgrown our current location and need to expand to meet our growing demand and take our mission to a much higher level.

We’ll be creating a peaceful (shanti), happy eco-village where you can get more than produce: an intentional commUNITY of worldwide volunteers, an on-site Eco-store, housing on premises, and a wide variety of community events and Empowerment Workshops. At Om Shanti, we prefer a diversity in crops - wild and colorful layouts, like a botanical garden with natural ponds, rather than monocultural farming with rows. We are planning to grow crops that do well in Arizona like citrus, greens, pulses, herbs, spices, grapes, then experiment with exotic varieties.

Budget / Startup Goal: Your contribution will go towards the security deposit and first month's rent on our new location in the Arizona area, making our first round of raised beds there, renovating/remodeling existing structures, building a new, mobile Earthship for our volunteers and workshop trainers to reside in, and the construction of the Eco-store. The bigger the gifts, the bigger and faster the reality. We’ll work with whatever we raise, because there is no other rational choice for us, and we are passionate about executing our vision. We’ll also be uniting with sustainable supporters to host fundraising parties in both Arizona and Miami until we reach our startup goal; however, we need your help to make it on Indiegogo’s front page of Most Popular Campaigns!

What will we offer at our new location?

Eco-Store
Our Eco-Store will supply even more of our trusted, local, truly organic and natural food produce: all governed by permaculture practices far more stringent than the FDA’s. We’ll also have up-cycled furniture and natural gardening products available. Our sustainable practices will keep costs low so we can give you more. At Om Shanti, we’re not motivated by greed.

Workshops and Eco-vocational Classes
One of our objectives is to promote sustainable and healthy living. Therefore, we will hold workshops and classes for all ages, emphasizing a hands-on approach to learning the following:
·  Natural Soap and Candle-making

·  Healthy Cooking - with an emphasis on international cuisine
·  Create!: Up-cycled Jewelry, Art and Furniture-making
·  Eco-vocational Training & Up-cycling 
·  Survival & Homesteading Skills
·  Gardening and composting: Techniques and Fundamentals
·  Yoga, Meditation & Natural Remedies
·  Liquids & Solids: Making Natural Drinks (including crop-based beer & wine) and Healthy Bread                                                                                                                                        ·  Sustainable Living & Natural Building
·  Fermentation: Probiotics, Kefir & Kombucha Production
·  Business and Legal: Green-related Business and Legal Skills

Community Events & Gathering Venue                                                                     Our fun, budget-conscious events are intended to bring back unity and respect for one another; and promote a strong sense of community. Events will have different themes, but will always be geared towards a “green” and healthy (emotionally and physically) way of life. Om Shanti will strive to be a popular, gathering venue for enthusiasts and activists in the agricultural field and related topics to meet, discuss, connect, raise awareness, share and take action.       

Intentional Volunteer Community
Om Shanti’s primary objective is to become an intentional volunteer community where foreigners and local residents interested in the “eco” movement can reside free of charge in exchange for their skills, knowledge, labor and/or services. Most importantly, we want to help grow green warriors, unite sustainable supporters into one Green World and work together to promote sustainable living worldwide.

Farming

Although we will be an educational and experimental farm, Om Shanti will follow permaculture principles. With the help of our volunteers, we’d like to experiment with various farming techniques utilized in different countries; and we’ll eventually build a greenhouse and outbuilding for those purposes.

Most of our workshops will take place in outbuildings which will have their own garden. For example, the brewery outbuilding will have its own Spirit Garden; as the outbuilding used to teach various cooking skills will have its own garden and so forth.

What are we doing now?

We’re still operating Om Shanti Empowerment Center. Until we get a bigger place, we’re checking out locations, meeting and uniting with a lot of cool, sustainable supporters and raising money to finally make our dream a reality. In the meantime, we’re continuing to garden, experimenting (on growing techniques, incorporating farming systems, fermenting and probiotic recipes, etc.), and making a lot of the natural products we would on the farm. 

This is more than just a hobby or community business for us; this dream is about sustaining our survival, uniting with like-minded people and improving the world one farm/garden at a time. We also want to show people there are successful holistic methods to conducting business and that it is perfectly acceptable to just say no to 9-5 cubicle dwelling. If you share our vision of a healthier, greener, unified world, join us and become part of our cherished family of sustainable supporters worldwide!

Who We Are:

Tatiana:
I'm a lawyer who left everything behind to unknowingly embark on my own, extraordinary "Eat, Pray, Love" journey to sustainability, taking me from Miami to New York to India, where I learned the techniques and fundamentals of sustainable farming. I was extremely sick and exhausted from being cuffed to cubicles where I gave my blood, sweat and tears to end up being the first one laid off. I no longer felt fulfilled and was compelled to explore other avenues. What I was ultimately looking for was a way to get involved in something bigger than myself.

In New York, I was offered the opportunity to volunteer my grant research and writing skills to a reforestation project and sustainable vegan community in South India that operated mainly through volunteers from all over the world.

Rohit:
I grew up in Udaipur, Rajasthan. I got involved in a non-profit organization that teaches alternative education, and it opened my eyes to a lot of other things. Since then, I started volunteering and attending many workshops. At 12 years old, I started traveling with a group of people all over India. With the newly found knowledge and independence acquired on my journey, I challenged my family that in one year, I would learn more traveling than being in school. I won the challenge and at the age of 14, I learned massage therapy. At 16, I again challenged myself to travel, but this time, without money. I learned a lot about myself and used my massage skills to convince people to contribute money for my journey, along with gardening, conducting children's workshops and helping out at restaurants. At that time is when I first went to the vegan community in South India, but I met Tatiana the fifth time I went to volunteer there. Along my journey, I also learned how to cook Indian/vegetarian/vegan and Thai cooking; acupressure; making natural jewelry from seeds, shells and even hydroponic clay pebbles. I also love to garden and make natural juices.

Together we travelled throughout Southeast Asia, from India to Thailand, and eventually found our way back in the United States – travelling in Florida and Georgia. All along this circuitous route we volunteering at various farms and sustainable projects, building our knowledge and gaining valuable experience. This wasn’t all we gained on this journey, we gained each other and recently got married.

In the end, we vowed not to return to the 9-5, constantly stressed life. This is where the idea of the eco-village began, and the vision of Om Shanti Empowerment Center was born.

A Peek Into the Future

Our ideal location would be to re-purpose an abandoned town!! Imagine the first off-grid eco-village that is an actual town! Throughout the United States, business has run off in search of higher profits through cheap labor. Along the way they have uprooted families and devastated infrastructure. In our search for land, we have come across several towns abandoned by industry. We imagine a future where projects like Om Shanti could repurpose these types of small abandoned towns, growing green warriors in the ruins left by greedy business.


Other Ways You Can Help

Another way you can help is by sharing our campaign with as many people as possible by using Indiegogo's share tools. Proceeds from our workshops and fundraising parties, which can be found on our Meetup page, will also go towards implementing the final phases of Om Shanti Empowerment Center and the startup of the Eco-Village & Farm Retreat. And, most of all, help grow green warriors in your community and in yourselves by supporting CSAs, growing gardens, and supporting green businesses in your community!

Questions?
Please feel free to email us with any questions or comments at omshantifarm@hotmail.com You can also connect with us and find updates, eco-related workshops, training and events worldwide on our Facebook and Meetup pages (which are linked below). Stay tuned for news on our upcoming website and new videos!

**A vision to improve the community and the quality of life of others cannot become true without the help of others.**

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Om-Shanti-Empowerment-Center-LLC-Community-Farm-Retreat/662915453777786#

http://www.meetup.com/Om-Shanti-Empowerment-Sustainability-Meetup/

story:
Short Summary

IndieTech is a company that puts our customers first. Since the first day we opend our doors we have put our customers before big profit margins. Because of this approach we have some of the best and most loyal customers in the world.  When we started we were not expecting the sudden need for expansion so agreements with third parties were made which had brought us to the current need to expand.

We need to purchase new equipment and new licenses so we we can get away from third party providers. In recent weeks some of our customers have had downtime on their hosting and though this can be expected from time to time we could do nothing to fix the situation. These expansions would also allow us as a by product to introduce higher quality and more cost effective VPS's to our customers. All of these additions would allow us to expand on our very personal customer server while giving our customers a much better product.

What We Need & What You Get


  • We are currently seeking $500 (The minimum for IndieGoGo) to lease new servers and purchase licenses. These will allow us to provide the best VPS servers for our customers and a better web hosting environment. 
  • As a thanks to you for contributing we are offering some of what we do best at a very deep discount. Though we cant beat the price of the big guys we do beat them in customer service. We make ourselves available 24/7 to every customer and your not just an invoice, we make a point to know every customer by name. 
  • As long as we are able to reach $200 we will use the funds to start the project and move current hosting customers to a new server. Any left over funds will be saved to get another server to start VPS's. 

The Impact

These upgrades allow us to provide better customer service in a market where customer service is seriously lacking. We want to show the world a web host/provider can do more for you than just take your money.  We can not currently afford the upfront cost's to make these purchase because we don't have the profit margins that many other hosts have. Our company has always put the customer before anything else and that is truly why these upgrades are needed. 

Risks & Challenges

With any change there are risks. In this case there are some technical hurdles that may come into play but our team is ready to face them head on. The other risks involved in changing our infrastructure is our monthly cost's increasing. We feel that with our current customers and  commitments to buy upon completion and the new customers this will open us up to we will have no issues meeting these new requirements. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cant help us financially we completely understand! Our business started with two people talking about us and has expanded from those two people. Help get the word about this campaign or our business by sharing on Facebook, Twitter or in person to friends and family.

story:
Who's running this show?

We are!


Jackie Gochenouer asks "What did you eat?" instead of "How was your day?" and her entrepreneurial spirit and obsession with food that pushes the envelope are values her parents raised her with. After managing a busy downtown lunch spot and opening its in-house juice bar, Jackie is looking to tackle her true passion, Dim Sum!

Derrik Soares grew up working in the restaurant industry. He is a restaurant marketing & operations expert, small business owner, and international touring musician. And he won't eat his beloved Portuguese linguica unless it's been cooked in a clay pig.

Together we will launch a New Asian pop-up called Dim Sum Yum, bringing amazing reinvented classics (curry steamed buns, anyone?) to the lively bar scene on Polk Street! Dim Sum Yum will be a fresh concept in Asian cuisine, adding some desperately needed variety to the pizza-saturated late night market.  

Bulgogi carne asada tacos with onion, cilantro, & pickled ginger.

Okonomiyaki with bacon.

Hoisin pork & sweet corn steamed buns.

Spicy sesame wings.

Pop-up?? Yep! This trendy craze started in London - an overlooked or underutilized space gets taken over for a limited amount of time by another business. It benefits both the host and guest businesses, because the host gets an instant facelift and the guest gets to dip their toes in the water without the risk of a permanent brick-and-mortar.

We'll be serving dinner at New Village Cafe Monday - Saturday, and also late night takeout on Fridays and Saturdays (open til 2:30a). We'll be serving inventive small plates like the pictures above, and you can visit our website to see the full menu!

 The Breakdown:

Here's what your contributions will help us with: 

  • Rent at New Village Cafe 
  • Pencil pushers (business expenses!) 
  • Cooking wares/equipment 
  • Initial food costs 

Holy perks! Check 'em out! Limited edition cookbook, free dinners, and that's not all! How would you like to be on our menu? It's okay, we're not cannibals! For $75 you can design your own dumpling special for us to run for a week. The bestseller will earn a permanent spot on our menu!

Restaurants are a tough business. But the NUMBER ONE reason restaurants fail is lack of funding. We have been cooped up inside, hunched over our excel spreadsheets for the past few months and we are confident that $9,000 is what we need from you beautiful people! We have a combined 20 years' experience in the restaurant industry and we know exactly what to do with the resources available to us.

Please note that we have chosen Flexible Funding - this means if you contribute via PayPal we can use the funds immediately, which is extremely helpful in these weeks before opening!

Even if you can't contribute, please help us spread the word! Post on facebook, twitter, etc or copy the web address into a message to someone you think might want to help us out.  

Also share our website: www.dimsumyum.com

Thank you!

Cooking wares/equipment

Holy perks! Check 'em out! Limited edition cookbook, free dinners, and that's not all! How would you like to be on our menu? It's okay, we're not cannibals! For $75 you can design your own dumpling special for us to run for a week. The bestseller will earn a permanent spot on our menu!
Restaurants are a tough business. But the NUMBER ONE reason restaurants fail is lack of funding. We have been cooped up inside, hunched over our excel spreadsheets for the past few months and we are confident that $9,000 is what we need from you beautiful people! We have a combined 20 years' experience in the restaurant industry and we know exactly what to do with the resources available to us.
Please note that we have chosen Flexible Funding - this means if you contribute via PayPal we can use the funds immediately, which is extremely helpful in these weeks before opening!
Even if you can't contribute, please help us spread the word! Post on facebook, twitter, etc or copy the web address into a message to someone you think might want to help us out.  
Also share our website: www.dimsumyum.com
Thank you!

story:
WELCOME TO MY CAMPAIGN TO FUND MY EQUINE RESEARCH WITH VETERANS! I am Dr. Wanda Whittlesey-Jerome, and I am an associate professor in the School of Social Work at New Mexico State University. My research focus is on building an evidence-base for the use of horses in psychotherapy, and the model I choose to focus on is Equine Assisted Growth and Learning Association's (EAGALA) Equine-Assisted Psychotherapy (EAP).  This treatment model is REALLY UNIQUE - because everything is 100% on-the-ground. There is no riding!!!!!

You may wonder why anyone would want to spend time with horses if they are not riding! Well, the truth is that when you are on a horse's level, miraculous things can happen! First, you must learn to negotiate a relationship with a prey animal that outweighs you by at least 1,000 pounds and is probably scared of you in some way, too. Second, horses are hyper-vigilant. That means they are sensing and perceiving every second (in case a predator is near - which might be you, by the way!) and they are honest and curious, and very social beings. Take it from me, being on the ground with horses can change your life in incredible ways for the better!

My current campaign is to raise funds so medically-retired Operation Enduring Freedom/Operation Iraqi Freedom/Operation New Dawn veterans can receive EAP in order to decrease their military-related stress and increase their health and wellbeing. It is a small pilot study that will hopefully lead to a HUGE Department of Defense (DoD) grant in 2015. THIS IS PART OF WHY I AM ASKING YOU TO HELP ME FUND THIS PILOT STUDY.

I received 5,000.00 from my college (College of Health and Social Services) and need to match that amount. YOUR GIFT WILL GO ENTIRELY TO PAYING FOR THE EAP TREATMENT so the veterans will not have to pay a thing. I am reimbursing them for their travel using the Federal Rate, and am providing food and water at the upcoming recruitment events. This will all come out of my pocket.

EAP requires an EAGALA-certified mental health therapist and an EAGALA-certified equine specialist. These professionals provide the treatment in an arena with horses. Horses eat a lot of hay, and drink a lot of water. They need attention every day, and safe places to sleep at night and rest during the day. As such, EAP is expensive to provide, 

However, EAP is a relatively brief, solution-focused approach to problem-solving and skills-building, so it actually costs less than long-term psychtherapy typically offered in an office-setting. Imagine - for each veteran participant there could be family members and/or important others who may benefit once the veteran begins the process of heart-healing. 

HEART-HEALING is what takes place when a wounded warrior returns home from battle. Having seen what he or she has seen, experienced, and probably dreamt about, they often return with a "break" in the psyche - a sense of "disconnection" - especially to soft, warm, loving feelings - that must be healed. This is what HEART-HEALING is all about. 

I have recently published an article on the healing impact of EAP on adult female victims of interpersonal violence (IV). My article includes a comprehensive literature review on EAP and IV, and in case you want to read it, the link is here: http://www.thepractitionerscholar.com/article/view/13570

I am joined on this pilot study by my graduate students who are also veterans. I am working closely with the Army Wounded Warrior Advocate of New Mexico, the Albuquerque Veterans Recovery Center, and Guadalupe Stables, LLC, of the North Valley of Albuquerque. 

The pilot study will begin after receiving Institutional Review Board (IRB) approval, which should be shortly. Then, after a round of recruitment events and meetings, the study will stretch 12 weeks and wrap-up in January of 2015. I will know in late spring whether or not I was awarded the large DoD grant for a much larger study.

Regardless of the DoD grant in the future, this small pilot study will serve 42 + participants, which is a very good size for a pilot - larger than many. For each of those participants, there will be others in their lives who can benefit as well.

THERE ARE PERKS FOR FUNDERS! For 100,00, I will send you a .pdf of the manuscript once the study is published. For 250.00, I will send you a new  DVD that includes myself, the EAP professionals, the horses, and a session of Veterans Recovery Center clinicians actually experiencing EAP for the first time - so you can see with your own eyes and hear with your own ears what they are sensing, perceiving, feeling and thinking. It should be QUITE SOMETHING TO SEE!

Please share my Indiegogo campaign link with others you think might be interested in supporting my study. With all my HEART,  I thank you most sincerely!!!

story:
Hello!

My name is Joshua Jones, and I have been selected as one of the delegates from the United States to attend the Slow Food International Event In Turin, Italy, Terra Madre. I applied and was chosen due to my experience as the Chef of Salt & Time Butcher Shop and Salumeria in Austin, Texas. At our shop we are dedicated to local food. From our whole animal butcher shop to our restaurant we choose to only use local proteins and vegetables. We are lucky in Austin that we have multiple urban farms as well as a rich community of farmers and ranchers within 100 miles of our city. I have spent five years building relationships with these farmers and ranchers to provide me with a year round supply of the best meat and produce that central Texas has to offer.


Today I am fundraising to help me offset the cost of international travel. As a delegate my housing and entry to the Terra Madre event are already paid for, but I could use help with other travel expenses. I am trying to not only attend this amazing event, as well as spend time in northern Italy learning more about butchering and use of produce. Our restaurant is by no means Italian, but we like to keep the traditional ideas and methods alive from this region, such as meat curing, sausage making, whole animal butchery, cooking in season, foraging, and just keeping things simple. Any donation will help me stay in Italy a few days longer and hopefully give me a knowledge I can not only bring back to my shop, but also my community.

story:
The Tramontane Cafe in Utica NY 

The Tram (as it is affectionally known) has been in the Utica New York community since 2008 providing a coffeehouse cafe that is open to all. We have a regular all- genre open mic as well as a spoken word, poetry, comedy open mic. We showcase musicians and other performers regularly as independent scheduled artists. The Tram is home to and supports The Utica Poets Society; The Utica Firefly Storytelling Series; The Guild of Thespian Puppets; and Shine Yoga & Wellness Studio.  

The Tram has and have hosted meetings regularly for The Utica Beard Council; The Central New York Photo Club; The New Hartford Science Teachers Book Club; The Mohawk Valley Go Club; Project U; and many more. We have a meeting room which is also home to our Tramontane Cafe Mini Gallery that showcases visual and creative artists regularly. We  also host The Central New York Roller Derby's Bake Sale fundraiser. 
The cafe sells not only traditional coffeehouse beverages and homemade baked goods (made on the premises), but also homemade soups, in-house salads and to-order sandwiches. We also provide a retail environment for local; regional; and national artists & writers who perform in the Tram. 

The Tram's Proprietors 

Garrett Ingraham is a Utica transplant from Sandy Pond, New York. He has been in Utica since 1988 for educational purposes and has worked in the Graphics Design and Press Business most of the time after graduating. Garrett met Robin in early 1993 and began an adventure in Small Business ever since. 

One Day Only Perk! $44! Garrett's Birthday 7/30! For One Day Only! Wednesday July 30th 2014: Choose this Perk to Invest $44 and receive an autographed copy of Garrett's upcoming ILLUSTRATED BOOK OF POETRY, CARTOONS, and SHORT STORIES! It will come with a stylish limited edition Utica Poets Society "Garrito Burrito" Pin, and you will be creatively mentioned on the thank-you page ! 

 

Robin Raabe is a born and raised Utican who attended some college for marketing, photography, & advertising until 1992. Working in various retail establishments, then choosing to embark on small business pursuits in 1993 with Garrett. 
Robin first opened a vintage clothing store in 1993 until 2000 and then also opened a joint venture coffeehouse with Garrett Ingraham in 1999 called Virgo Bat & Leo Phrog's Coffeehouse (VBLP's) until 2003. The two folks took a few years off and then decided to take the challenge of a new coffeehouse/cafe project in 2008. They have been running  The Tramontane Cafe in Utica NY ever since. Garrett still has a full-time job to assist with the costs of life and business.



The Tram's Goal is $42,000 for the top 3 of our 7 Wishes for our 7th Year! 

  • Cover the initial costs of an expanded kitchen (to make special/ & catered orders; better prep. space; possible delivery; weekly dinner/plate specials; to-order retail soup/quiche; and more):  including but not limited to construction, plumbing, and equipment. Electrical needs for a convection oven; Floor repair & tiling; Plumbing installation for sinks; Gas line installation for stove; Exhaust fan acquisition and installation plus an accessible window; Dutch Door acquisition and installation. Equipment acquisition including but not limited to: Commercial Stove; Convection Oven; 3-Bay Sink; Steel Prep Table; 6' Sandwich Prep Cooler; Stand Mixer; Microwave Oven; Air Conditioner; Exhaust Fan; Stove Hood; Cabinetry; Food Processor; Dishwasher; Baking/Cooling Racks; Cooking/Baking Utensils & Bowls; & more! We have  a lot of dishes, plates, mugs, and cups!
  • Cover the costs of some looming balances: We've been making payments on a few invoices and we'd like to clear our slate to move forward on obtaining more traditional lending options to continue with more major projects that will be beneficial to the business, building, and customers.
  • Cover at least up to 20% down to refinance our mortgage in the amount of about $12,000. 

A few of the awesome fun perks that we have acquired from many friends,  supporters, customers, and tramily range from Guild of Thespian Puppets buttons to a ride through Downtown Utica NY in a Model-T Ford to a Tram-catered Dinner with Vinyl Record accompaniment from Off-Center Records . There will be limited edition Tram t-shirts; bumper stickers; and posters as well as even the opportunity to share naming 6 months of our famous Sunday Open Mic Night. 
Thank you for taking the time to consider your level of support and strengthening a community anchor that strives to continue doing terrific things with great people like you as part of our "TRAMILY". Please contact us with any questions, comments, concerns, and/or answers! 

  •  If the TRAM could work on all our 7 Wishes, we sure would love your help! This campaign hopes to get as many accomplished as possible! 
Our 7 Wishes for our 7th Year Are As Follows:

  1. Refinance our Mortgage with a lender that has a better rate and terms. We need 20 % down (at least the amount of $12,000.)  to achieve this goal. 
  2. We'd like to create and install a small working galley kitchen in one of our rooms to provide a better work flow; more counter prep. space; offer our customers special plate dinners, bakery orders, more retail sale soups and quiches. 
  3. Clear up some outstanding debt balances making way for more traditional lending options that can help with our cooperative space as well as make for a better credit rating. 
  4. We would really like to upgrade our exterior presence with a mural project, lighting, and security and have better proper signage on the North facing wall. Outdoor seating, awning, and deck and a bicycle rack too!
  5. Upgrade our sound system with better lighting and speakers so that we can treat our customers to a more professional experience in the Tram performance nook.
  6. We wish to satisfy a demand for additional foodstuffs and beverages that require additional counter space as well as prep. ingredients. We would like to make more dietary concerned individuals feel as though they have more options.  We would also like to produce a full line of retail merchandise to include t-shirts; mugs; stickers; pins; keychains; travel mugs; guitar picks; and more. 
  7. Creation of room availability to encourage Tram supporters a place to visit over night in a nostalgic and eclectic Bed & Breakfast style. These rooms would also be used for visiting musical performers who are traveling to be able to stay without worrying about additional costs or losing income from a local show. 

 If the Tram were to fully realize some of what we dream,  we have a few other awesome ideas to move forward on as well! 

  • We would love to fully join a C.S.A. Community Supported Agriculture Membership Group Farm
  • The Tram could finally have a full-fledged awesome website
  • Additional Cabinetry and Shelving to further organize our vast array of dishes, mugs, and collections
  • Hiring of multiple employees to cover new and improved shifts such as bakery manager & dinner chef. 
  • Remodel our secondary bathroom facilities 
  • Upgrade our computer and internet to work towards a better co-working space 

    Some of the Risks & Challenges the Tram may face:

    One of the risks and challenges we see that we could face is not reaching our goal to the fullest potential amount needed. The reason we have chosen the flexible funding model is that if we do not reach our projected goal we would still be able to move forward on some of the ideas and investments we have outlined in our wishes and also use that knowledge and promotion to work towards another campaign or traditional funding practices. We would honor the perks and promises and continue to serve our customer base and supporters completely beyond all campaigns. 

      Other Ways You Can Help the Tram meet its goal! 

      • We appreciate your support whether financial, moral, and even a kind word or two. The more we can share our goals to make the Tramontane Cafe work harder for you and provide improved additional services the better for Utica, NY and you! 
      • You can help us get the word out by sharing our campaign with your friends, family, connections, and anyone else you think should work with us. Check out all the Indiegogo sharing tools under our notes and videos on the campaign page. 
      • Liking; Favoriting; Commenting and Sharing our posts and announcements, and milestones will help us stay fresh and move forward through the social media world thusly exposing us to new friends. 
      • If you know of or are someone interested in partnering and/or helping us in an independent fashion, please contact us via private message.
      • Blog about your Tram experiences, take photos, Follow and share your Tramness on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram (Tramstagram) . Show us your selfies! 
      • Pledge as a group or an individual, support us with your band or business too!
      • Share your pics and reviews on sites such as Yelp!, Happy Cow, Trip Advisor, Urbanspoon, Facebook, or any other similar site. We would be super duper grateful! 
      • If you're in the local Utica, NY area, come on by and grab a few promotional flyers and bring back the allure of the Street Team Effort! Say hello and that you heard about the campaign the next time you are in #Tramland! 

      Thank you very much for your time and consideration and your anticipated belief in the Tramontane Cafe in Utica, New York! We can't wait to meet you! Take Care, Robin and Garrett of the TRAM.

story:
Mitchell had an operation on his heart 5 weeks ago and unfortunately on the 26th of October he lost his fight and sadly passed away.

So many people want to help Lynnette and her family and helping take care of the funeral cost would be something that will stay with them forever, so I'm asking no matter how large or small if you could donate it would be very much appreciated and it will give Mitchell the send off he so very much deserves.

story: .

Our Story

  I'm a mom of a wonderful young man and we are so excited to embark on a new journey.   We are entrepreneurs at heart who want to purchase a photo booth for a  rental business.  The photo booth is great entertainment for a wedding, party, bar mitzvah, fundraiser, corporate event, prom and many many other events. It offers guests a wonderful fun time and they go home with a nice party favor to remember the event while creating memories. 


  We are excited about the opportunity to give back to our community.  For each photo booth rental a donation will be made to a local charity or to the renter's choice of charity.  Our first goal is to help our church build an orphanage for young girls in Haiti.  The home will keep them out of the hands of pedophiles and those who use the young girls for prostitution. 


What We Need & What You Get

 The photo booth, license, marketing tools, and insurance cost $7300.  We have been blessed to have raised $6000!!  All we need is an additional $1300 to get this going.  The photo booth comes with a high quality printer, awesome camera and everything else that will allow us to begin helping others create fun memories.  We appreciate you helping us so we have some goodies to offer you.  See the perks!

Thankyou and many blessings!


 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word so we can not only start this business but also help others!!  Forward this to your email contacts, share it on Facebook, Tweet it!

story:
THE STORY


Dear Friends,


For those of you who don’t know, I am going  to Kenya for 5 months to try to help build a Children's Home (or at least help it get rolling) and I'd like to  tell you about how you can help. Back in September took a month leave to visit the Belwop Children’s Home in Nyeri, Kenya. I stayed on-site with the kids and with the director, a widow and fellow believer named Veronica Mumbi, whom I am blessed to call friend.This trip ruined me, in the best way, and now I feel called to help make a difference there and here.

Basically, the verse in James that states that TRUE Religion, the kind that that God accepts as pure and faultless-- HOLY-- is just this: To take care of widows and orphans in their distress... that's it. Then I met a widow who takes care of orphans, whose faith is unlike anything I've ever witnessed, and realized maybe this wasn't an accident? Here was  a opportunity for religion to be put into action, for me, and anyone who wants to join. A need for a real home.

That was 4 years ago, and today, we have partnerships starting all over the place to make this dream a reality. Together, through making coffee, and playing music, selling T-shirts and bracelets, we have helped them come out of debt, purchase land, and now we want to move forward. No longer will these amazing kids have to sleep in a rented facility or worry about their next meal. Soon, they will have a place to sleep with colorful walls and comfortable beds and a kitchen full of food

But we have a ways to go.....


THE IMPACT

 SO far, through giving of funds from our True Religion Concert series and other fundraisers, we have raised enough to:

1.) buy 1 square acre of Land!

2.) design blue prints

3.) sponsor the kids and send them to school

4.) get started on the preliminary foundation

...and MORE explained in a letter from Veronica (the awesome Widow who runs the Belwop orphanage, my inspiration and friend):



Dear ones,

Because of you, the children can now enjoy an after-school snack, breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Because of you, they can eat meat at least two days every week.

Because of you, they can eat fruits as frequently as possible.

Because of you, the children can have butter on their bread.

Because of you, the children can have sausage at least twice a week.

Because of you, they can have ice cream once in a while.

Because of you, the children are always clean and smart, for bathing and washing soaps and detergents are no longer a problem.

Because of you, the children can praise their God with much joy.



HOW TO HELP

 I am raising support for the 5 months I will be there to cover costs of building. I already bought my ticket, and have saved up enough to sustain myself, but some of you have expressed a desire to help me financially, and so all the money you give from this point on goes directly to breaking ground on the new Belwop site... By the time I return in December I would like to see PHASE 1 happen, out of the $17k raised SO FAR:


1.) Water line (dug and placed in the ground, connected to the well up the hill)

2.) Electricity hooked up (poles and wires from surrounding community/ permits acquired)

3.) Wall built (help US media team lead by Kate and Aaron Johnson, coming to break ground in October, 2011)

4.) New Computers, up and running (at the current home)

 5.) Foundation laid (wet construction begun)


Once I leave, there are others coming after me to begin PHASE 2.  This will lead to the completion of the new home and Veronica's WISH LIST:

Full indoor kitchen

10 Bedrooms (10 kids, 5 bunkbeds per room= 100 kids!)

Washer and Dryer

4 bathrooms

Living room

Study

Staff

a slide!!/ playground

Two 15-passenger vans


Other Ways You Can Help

1.) Prayer. As Veronica would say, "God will do it." Not us....We need all the voices to the Big Guy we can get! Shoot one up right now? :)

2.) Spread the Word. Tell the story, come to the next event!

3.) Project Belwop 2.0: Join a team to help build the new children's home or donate to the building fund (so far we have raised $17k of $100k needed!!) www.ExtremeResponse.Org

 4.) Child Sponsorship: Friends of Belwop, Inc. is pleased to announce that our organization has been approved as a 501(c)(3) non-profit charity by the IRS.  All contributions made after October 27th, 2010 and in the future are fully tax-deductible.  www.friendsofbelwop.org

 

Thank you once again for your generous support of me and this project! I look forward to seeing God do amazing things this year and getting this home built!!

story:
My name is Britton Harris, I live in Austin, TX and it is my dream to play professional golf.  For the past 5 years I have been working a full time job, as well as scrounging up any other work I could, to try to afford the entry fees and travel expenses that come along with playing mini tour golf.  During this time I also committed myself to practicing as much as possible every day to hone my abilities while I tried to scrape together the funds to play in tournaments.  I have found out over the past 5 years that trying to fund myself has been a futile effort and that the expenses of this adventure is too high for me to cover. Golf is my passion and I know that if I were able to commit myself fully to the development of my game and to consistent tournament play my abilities could soar to great heights.  However, the only way that this would be possible is through the generous giving of others for the specific reason of helping my dreams become a reality. 

I ask that you donate to help me raise the money to be able to commit myself to one year of mini tour golf on the Adams Pro Golf Tour.  

I have attached a detailed spread sheet of how the expenses break down for one year of mini tour golf (you can get to the spread sheet if you click on the gallery tab at the top of the page).  Any funding that is received will be used in this exact way (except that it will be used for the 2014/2015 tournament season) and every penny will be stretched to the limit in order that it will last as long as possible.  


I am so grateful for your support in helping me realize my dream, without your generosity there is no way that this would be possible.

story: My campaign has now ended, but I want to thank ALL of you who have made a donation to my cause. I cannot thank you enough! Even though I've not met my goal, I am still so thankful for the support of the community out there. The funds that I have received will be used for the sole purpose of my cause. Thank you again, and may God Bless each and every one of you!! Love, Jennifer.

story:
What is Aspen Valley Foods?

It’s an on-line marketplace of products from the finest, local, small growers, producers and food artisans in the United States. All our food is healthy, delicious tasting, natural, organic and sustainably produced. We offer food from just about every category you can think of, except for fresh produce and dairy.

Not everyone has a farmer’s market nearby, and mostly these are only available in the summer, so we offer real convenience, wherever you live.

And there’s another big difference with our food other than convenience. After selecting it from producers and artisans who meet our rigid natural and organic production standards, we have top chefs test it all to find which tastes best and what’s the best way to prepare and present it. That way you don’t have to have potentially costly and time consuming (not to mention disappointing or embarrassing) experiments to find what really works for you.

With the convenience of on-line shopping (with prompt delivery) you only have one stop, just like a market. No more searching for grass-fed beef or artisan cheeses (for example) from dozens of sites – we locate them, test them, then offer you a selection of the best in each of sixteen food categories, in one easy to use market style site. Simple, fun shopping from your computer.

 

What We Believe In

We believe in sustainability. The Earth’s resources are too precious to be used just once. The food we sell will be produced and distributed with complete concern for the environment.

We will source and certify our foods only from the finest ranches, farms, vineyards, dairies, bakeries and food artisans in North America. Our suppliers produce on a modest scale, not on an industrial, non-sustainable scale.

Our food will be healthy, produced to uncompromising standards and definitions of natural, organic, family farmed and sustainable established by entities such as the Food Alliance and The Association of Family Farms.

Our food will taste great as well as being healthy. So we have top Chefs select and test it in advance.

We respect local farmers markets. Our desire is to bring good foods to buyers who are unable to participate in these markets, or who wish for a broader range of such products than are typically available at farmers markets.

We believe in transparency of information about our food, and we make authentic, verified source of production data for the origin of all our foods readily available to our customers.

We will deliver a superior shopping experience to our customers with a 100% guarantee.

For a complete statement of our Credo, go to www.aspenvalleyfoods.com/we-are-avf.php 

 

Why We Started Aspen Valley Foods

First of all, we simply don’t believe industrially produced food is either good for our bodies, our communities or our planet.

Second, we could see the market for natural and organic food was surging in the U.S., growing on average 10% each year. Plus, it has proven to be recession proof, predictable growth.

Thirdly, the growth of on-line shopping for food is also exploding, especially for higher-end quality (including natural and organic) foods.

Lastly, we believe in supporting smaller producers and food artisans; we live in a small mountain community close to ranchers, orchardists, wine makers, artisan bakers and a host of smaller producers of cheese, preserves and sauces. We love their healthy, naturally produced food and would like to see it enjoyed more widely.

 

What We’ve Done So Far

To test their ideas, the two founders, Alan Pilkington and Martha Silva, raised some seed capital from Friends and Family to support their personal capital contributions. They then tested the concept with over 1,000 American food and cooking enthusiasts in an on-line study by a top Internet research group. Guess what? People loved the idea; nearly 60% said they’d become customers.

Confirmed and even more enthusiastic and confident, they then created a comprehensive Business Plan and Private Placement Memorandum for investors. They recruited an experienced and talented group (over 20) of advisors to help create the plan and to vet it. At present there are over a dozen committed investors, but the company is still well short of its ambitious goal.

The reason is simple. The founders have a vision for a significant company, in its size as well as its high standards. Creating a national supply network of smaller producers and artisans, a comprehensive and competitive website, an extensive marketing and social media communications plan, complete on-line fulfillment, delivery and customer service systems for sixteen food categories and over five hundred products is no easy task, nor one for the faint of heart.

 

Our Path to the Future

To realize this vision, we’ve decided to build a state-of-the-art website, an adjacent food information website, national producer and supplier networks, a centralized warehousing facility in the heartland (to reduce shipping costs and limit our carbon imprint), a test kitchen and a sophisticated communications plan.

We plan to hire a group of talented and experienced people with specialized production, warehousing, fulfillment, cooking, distribution, web management, marketing, communication and customer service skills. We need a warehouse, a food testing facility and an office. Whew! All this takes a lot of capital (in the low $ millions), but the great news is we have identified a source which can provide all the funding we need, over and above what we’ve already raised.

The source is a special U.S. Government Program known as EB-5, a description of which can be found on our website www.aspenvalleyfoods.com/financial.php

 

The Next Big Step

In order to access this capital, and especially because it involves the U.S. government, we need to create a very special application.

It will involve specialized attorneys, economists, plan writers and others. We have to take our already thorough plan to a whole new level. In many ways it’s like creating a major grant application for a foundation or a university, for those of you familiar with such matters. But if we get it done, our attorneys are confident the capital will flow and Aspen Valley Foods will become a reality.

All of those great ideas will get a chance to come to pass, those great products will come to market. Our small producers and artisans will be happy; their local communities will be happy; our customers will be healthier and happy; our investors will be happy, so we’ll be happy; the planet will be happier. And you, an IndieGoGo supporter, we hope will be happier, too.

Read about some of the great perks you can earn for helping start a worthwhile company.

 

How IndieGoGo Contributors can help

You can help make Aspen Valley Food a success in two ways.

First, get the word out. Tell your friends about Aspen Valley Foods and about what a cool company it will be if they support it. (word of mouth, email, links to Facebook, Twitter and other social media)

Second, enjoy some of our amazing perks by making a contribution.

The total cost of the funding application project we’ve described is $125,000. The costs cover those specialized attorneys, economists, plan writers and others. The majority of the $125,000 is being raised from Friends and Family and other Private Investors.  We expect these sources to bring us within $45,000 of our $125,000 goal. If we can secure $45,000 (which includes IndieGoGo fees) from IndieGoGo contributors, we’re confident Aspen Valley Foods will be able to make a successful EB-5 application and that our vision of an on-line natural and organic food marketplace will become reality.

Please join us for the ride!

story:
Who are we?
 We are a community of diaspora users and contributors from the early days of diaspora.
  • Anish and Balasankar maintains Malayalam translations.
  • Nandaja and Praveen helps in making diaspora easy to install (packaging of diaspora for debian) - Stage setters
  • Hrishikesh - Diaspora prophet/The Pied Piper of Diaspora.
  • Ashokan - Cinematography
  • Anish, Atul and Vishnu - Actors        
  • Jishnu - Resident Nolan
  • Adhil - Pixel pusher.
  • Praseetha, Akshay, Labeeb and Hiran - Creators of color
 Why this campaign is important
  • Diaspora  is a culture. A culture against the loss of personal privacy by the  corporate social network giants. Diaspora enables us to keep one's data  with himself/herself and provides the flexibility to select the  shareable data. When the data is stored in his/her local machines and  not on a single central server, it provides the utmost security to  users.
  • Diaspora, being a distributed  system, is actually a network of multiple instances of the software  Diaspora. These instances are called pods. You can think of it like a  mobile service provider or an email provider.
  • One of the oldest and biggest Diaspora pod, poddery.com is at the verge of closing down.
  • This campaign is trying to prevent this calamity and protect the diversity. To prevent poddery from closing down so as to refuel the diaspora idea.
  • We are planning to adopt poddery.com from its current guardian and host it ourselves.
 
 What your contributions mean to us
Your  contribution is literally the fuel we need to keep this motor running.  Without that, poddery.com is dead, taking with it the credibility of  Diaspora culture. Your contributions will surely make history, the  history of a war between a david called privacy and corporate goliath.  Your contributions are goliath's pebbles. Provide them and be a part of this history.
 
What We Need
  • €389 is spent for amazon aws medium instance reserved for 3 years.
  • €175 is used to pay for bandwidth, considering 100% increase in bandwidth use per year and 10% increase in bandwidth cost per year by amazon.
  • €378 is kept aside for printing and sending T shirts.
  • €151 is kept aside for promotion of diaspora like organizing workshops, classes, etc.
  • €45 is set aside for paying the previous pod owner for renewal for June.
  • All the residual amount is spent for promotion of diaspora and any unexpected expenses occured.

 

For more detailed explanation: http://bit.ly/savepoddery-expense
If we do not reach the goal, we will use whatever amount we got to extend the life of poddery.com.
 
What You Get
  • €1 - Name on the "Donors" List
  • €4 - Details on the "Donors" List (homepage/blog/any url) and the one above
  • €8 - @poddery.com email alias and all the ones above
  • €16 - Photo on "Donors" list and all the ones above
  • €40 - T Shirt (max 25) and all the ones above
  • €80 - Name on front page (max 10) and all the ones above
  • €175 - Home Page Logo - size 250x250 (max 6) for one year and all the ones above
  • €400 - Sidebar Logo - size 100x100 (every page - max 3) for one year and all the ones above
  • AND A SUPER AND RELIABLE SOCIAL NETWORK WITHOUT THE FEAR OF SELLING DATA
The Impact
Your  contributions, by helping Diaspora, shows the world that we can  definitely share what we wish without selling anything to the corporate  giants. You control what, whom and when parameters of access regarding  your data.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
  • Share the Diaspora philosophy
  • Tell your friends why privacy and anonymity became one of the fundamental needs in cyber world
  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
  • Use Diaspora, talk Diaspora, be Diaspora
And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Who are we?
 We are a community of diaspora users and contributors from the early days of diaspora.


Anish and Balasankar maintains Malayalam translations.




Nandaja and Praveen helps in making diaspora easy to install (packaging of diaspora for debian) - Stage setters





Hrishikesh - Diaspora prophet/The Pied Piper of Diaspora.





Ashokan - Cinematography




Anish, Atul and Vishnu - Actors        




Jishnu - Resident Nolan




Adhil - Pixel pusher.




Praseetha, Akshay, Labeeb and Hiran - Creators of color


 Why this campaign is important



Diaspora  is a culture. A culture against the loss of personal privacy by the  corporate social network giants. Diaspora enables us to keep one's data  with himself/herself and provides the flexibility to select the  shareable data. When the data is stored in his/her local machines and  not on a single central server, it provides the utmost security to  users.




Diaspora, being a distributed  system, is actually a network of multiple instances of the software  Diaspora. These instances are called pods. You can think of it like a  mobile service provider or an email provider.




One of the oldest and biggest Diaspora pod, poddery.com is at the verge of closing down.



This campaign is trying to prevent this calamity and protect the diversity. To prevent poddery from closing down so as to refuel the diaspora idea.


We are planning to adopt poddery.com from its current guardian and host it ourselves.


 
 What your contributions mean to us

Your  contribution is literally the fuel we need to keep this motor running.  Without that, poddery.com is dead, taking with it the credibility of  Diaspora culture. Your contributions will surely make history, the  history of a war between a david called privacy and corporate goliath.  Your contributions are goliath's pebbles. Provide them and be a part of this history.
 

What We Need 

€389 is spent for amazon aws medium instance reserved for 3 years.
€175 is used to pay for bandwidth, considering 100% increase in bandwidth use per year and 10% increase in bandwidth cost per year by amazon.
€378 is kept aside for printing and sending T shirts.
€151 is kept aside for promotion of diaspora like organizing workshops, classes, etc.
€45 is set aside for paying the previous pod owner for renewal for June.
All the residual amount is spent for promotion of diaspora and any unexpected expenses occured.


 

For more detailed explanation: http://bit.ly/savepoddery-expense

If we do not reach the goal, we will use whatever amount we got to extend the life of poddery.com.
 

What You Get

€1 - Name on the "Donors" List
€4 - Details on the "Donors" List (homepage/blog/any url) and the one above
€8 - @poddery.com email alias and all the ones above
€16 - Photo on "Donors" list and all the ones above
€40 - T Shirt (max 25) and all the ones above
€80 - Name on front page (max 10) and all the ones above
€175 - Home Page Logo - size 250x250 (max 6) for one year and all the ones above
€400 - Sidebar Logo - size 100x100 (every page - max 3) for one year and all the ones above
AND A SUPER AND RELIABLE SOCIAL NETWORK WITHOUT THE FEAR OF SELLING DATA


The Impact
Your  contributions, by helping Diaspora, shows the world that we can  definitely share what we wish without selling anything to the corporate  giants. You control what, whom and when parameters of access regarding  your data.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:


Share the Diaspora philosophy




Tell your friends why privacy and anonymity became one of the fundamental needs in cyber world




Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.




Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!




Use Diaspora, talk Diaspora, be Diaspora


And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Improving the Experience of Birth for All Families in Miami

When we opened The Gathering Place two years ago, our mission was to improve the experience of birth for all women and families in Miami by establishing a dynamic, independent center for childbirth education, breastfeeding, parenting, and women's health care. We wanted to be a catalyst for change in our community by creating an environment where women and families could learn how to be full participants in their care and ensure they would approach pregnancy and parenting with information and confidence. The successes we have had along the way are due to the support and encouragement of our community - our moms and dads and babies, our staff, our mentors and our families. Our vision is a work in progress, the next phase of which is opening a birth center within the City of Miami.

We have a management team, a business plan, and a viable site in place. In order to make this next step a reality, we need your support.  

Women in South Florida need a community birthing center! #OneBigPush

Options are disappearing. Interventions are rising. Disparities are growing. South Florida is a challenging place to have a baby. 


A birth center will improve outcomes, including:

  • REDUCING FINANCIAL & CULTURAL BARRIERS. Miami-Dade County has one of the highest uninsured rates in the country due to the high rates of poverty and immigration. More than 700,000 residents (29.2%) have no health insurance, and prenatal care is rarely offered regardless of ability to pay. Magnolia will open its doors to many populations who may typically feel unwelcome in standard healthcare facilities, including the working poor, recent immigrants and adolescents.

  • LOWERING HIGH C-SECTION RATES. Miami has the frightening distinction of having one of highest rates of cesarean section in the nation - 1 in 2 women in Miami-Dade County gives birth by surgery. Of the ten facilities statewide with the highest cesarean rate, six are located in our county. Women in the care of midwives have lower than the national average rate for primary cesarean (4.4% to 9.9%, compared to 32%). The cesarean section rate for women receiving care in birth centers averages 6.1%, approximately one-half that in studies of low risk, in-hospital births.

  • CLOSING THE HEALTH DISPARITY GAP. The black infant mortality rate in Miami-Dade is almost three times higher than the infant mortality rate for white infants. Midwife-led care of low-risk women in birth center settings has yielded promising results, including reduction of poor birth outcomes like low birth weight, pre-term labor and infant mortality.

  • ELEVATING NORMAL BIRTH. Birth typically takes place in a hospital room, where women are confined to their beds by continuous fetal monitors and offered little one-to-one labor support. At birth centers, women are encouraged to eat if they are hungry, move about, spend time in a tub as they wish, and push in whatever positions they find most comfortable.

  • LOWERING COSTS BY REDUCING INTERVENTIONS. Nationwide 8-11% of babies are delivered by midwives, yet only a handful certified nurse midwives have privileges to deliver at area hospitals. Women who receive care from midwives have a significantly higher chance for a normal vaginal birth, fewer interventions, and successful initiation of breastfeeding.

  • IMPROVING BREASTFEEDING OUTCOMES. In the majority of area hospitals, mothers and babies are still routinely separated after birth. Breastfeeding support postpartum is often little more than lip-service, with formula feeding suggested at the first sign of difficulty. More than 75% of women in Miami-Dade County initiate breastfeeding immediately following delivery but only 9.9% continue to 6 months. None of Miami's hospitals meet the requirements for being Baby-Friendly. Magnolia will pursue Baby-Friendly designation.
  • INCREASED OPTIONS FOR MIDWIVES. Currently none of South Florida's existing birthing centers operate under an "open model" with a documented process which allows community midwives to apply for privileges and utilize the facility for their private clients.
Our mission is to improve the quality of health care for all women in Miami Dade County by establishing a dynamic, independent center for birth and women's health care. Families in our community need a birth center that provides access for all midwives and all women and their families. 

Here's how your money will help open the birth center’s doors

Our goal is that, starting in early Fall 2014, families in the Miami area will be able to birth at Magnolia Birth House. Our funding target for this campaign is $100,000. Here is where your money goes:

  • SECURING THE LEASE. We will be negotiating a lease term agreement of 5-10 years with the proposed landlord including credit during construction
  • FURNISHINGS, EQUIPMENT & SUPPLIES. Initial start-up expenses include legal expenses, accreditation/designation application, licenses, permits, office space, medical equipment, office equipment, and furniture.

  • BUILD OUT. Our proposed commercial space has already been renovated to meet current City of Miami zoning requirements and meets birth center specifications including ADA compliance as required by Florida’s birth center law and adequate parking. The property will need to be built out additionally to create two additional birthing suites, practitioner offices and a large classroom space.

  • IMPLEMENTATION OF MARKETING PLAN. In 2012, more than 36,000 women gave birth in Miami-Dade County. With an aggressive marketing campaign, Magnolia could capture less than 1% of births in the County and operate at or above capacity.

All women and their newborn babies deserve the best, and we are creating a beautiful, personalized, state-of-the-art facility specifically designed to meet their needs.


Our fundraising goal is large but achievable. Every donation - even a few dollars - will help us reach our goal and open our doors.


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Spread the word!! The more people who hear about this campaign, the better chance we have of meeting our goal! (Indiegogo provides tools to share this campaign through Facebook, Twitter and Google+) Please help spread the word by using #OneBigPush in your tweets and posts.

  • Educate yourself and your friends about the kind of services birthing centers offer! Know someone who's expecting? Ask them where they're planning on giving birth and encourage them to learn more about the benefits of birth centers and midwifery care.
By providing education and support we can foster confidence and respectfully guide women and their families through the process of pregnancy, labor and birth. Thank you for considering making a donation to help fund our work!

story:
The Breakdown

Last year I volunteered grunt work and helped tear down Burning Man. In appreciation of this work the organization promised me a 'gift ticket' for this year. At the same time the sheet was going around to sign up to acknowledge and accept this gift in advance, another sheet was going around to reimburse people for what they spent on a ticket for that year. I asked if this was in addition to a gift ticket, and somebody acting in a position of authority said YES.

Apparently, they were wrong.

Recently, volunteer coordinators reached out to me to inform me of this, and now despite my best efforts at sticking up for my integrity and honor, I'm left in the position of having agreed to help set up the entire shebang this year, help another camp get settled (CouchBurners), and help burn down a major art project I helped out with some (SeaCoRE)- all while having NO TICKET!!!

I did not budget for this, at all!

What I Need & What You Get

I have until MONDAY to click on a special link i was given that I can only click ONCE to purchase a ticket, with a credit card in my name. Whether the organizers feel bad or really need the help, I couldn't speculate. I WANT to help and see this through! 

I need approximately 1/3rd of the goal to JUST BARELY make it!

The Impact

THE MAN CAN'T BURN WITHOUT ME!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell people you know! EVERYONE you know!

story:
Opening Acts is staffed by a consortium of entertainment industry veterans who donate their time, expertise, and services towards enriching the lives of the program’s participants.  We will wake up your dream, discover your talent, kickstart your passion, eliminate your excuses - and make it happen!

 Opening Acts presents, produces, enables, and re-imagines opportunities at no cost to the participants; letting them rediscover talents that may have been lost, hidden away, or that they never even knew they had.

Whether it’s writing that book, recording that song,  learning that dance, or taking that stage; through your support of Opening Acts our members can realize their dream of a lifetime!

story:
WHAT IS DIVINE DIPS?

Divine Dips® Vegan Ice Crème is an indulgent, completely vegan ice crème that embodies the creamy richness, texture and flavor of traditional ice cream, without the drawbacks of dairy. 

We set out to create a vegan ice cream that tasted, melted, and felt like “real” ice cream. Through our own special brand of ‘artisanal alchemy’, Divine Dips is skillfully crafted from a proprietary blend of organic coconut milk, cashews, nut milks, fresh fruits, and other all-natural ingredients. It’s sweetened with organic agave nectar, providing just the right amount of sweetness without spiking blood sugar. The result is a health conscious, earth-friendly, yet sumptuous frozen innovation that rivals premium ice cream— in a class all its own.

Divine Dips comes in six flavors: Madagascar Vanilla Bean, Caffé No-Lait, Infinite Mint, Amaretto Almond Trio, Chocolate Raspberry Truffle, and ‘Rastaberry’ (Raspberry crème swirled with strawberries). New flavors in the wings include: Kiwi Passion (proceeds benefit GREENPEACE), Thai Tea, Yucatán Chocolate, Matcha Green Tea with toasted Pistachios, Gingersnap, and Lemon Yuzu.

OUR HUMBLE BEGINNINGS

We launched in early 2011, in a single Culver City, CA location. Word spread quickly, and within months we grew to more than 25 accounts. Divine Dips is currently available in retail markets and café/restaurant locations in the greater Los Angeles area.

Customer response has been overwhelmingly positive, and we’ve received calls and emails from people around the country asking if Divine Dips is available in their state, or if it can be shipped to them. We really want to be able to tell these folks: "Soon! Very Soon!" We’ve already been approached by WHOLE FOODS, as well as UNFI (A natural foods distributor), about bringing Divine Dips into their stores/product line offering.

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO GROW!

This endeavor began as a labor of love, entirely family financed. But growing pains were inevitable-- We need working capital to effectively meet a higher demand and supply more customers, and at the same time, create new jobs.

Our objective: To expand the availability of Divine Dips to a growing customer base that is seeking this quality product. Right now we are supplying all of our customers by making small batches in ONE 20 quart gelato machine

Finding the right investor fit has not yet materialized in an acceptable form, but we are bound and determined to get Divine Dips into the hearts and mouths of many more people. We felt this should be a grassroots effort, as great things are achieved when a lot of good people who care join forces.

WHERE WILL MY PLEDGE GO?

This campaign is to raise money for the Purchase of a larger second GELATO MACHINE and updated equipment- doubling our output capabilities.

Your donation will allow us to keep producing Divine Dips, get it into more and larger markets, and bring it to a location near you! Any support you can offer will give us the chance to make the company into all it can be. Please help a Small Business Grow!

Even if you can't pledge, please share our campaign with your family and friends on Facebook and Twitter!

Visit us at:
http://www.divinedipsicecreme.com
Read more about us here:
http://thesagepress.wordpress.com/2011/12/18/divine-dips-by-far-the-best-vegan-ice-cream-around/

http://www.backyardbite.com/2011/11/divine-dips-vegan-ice-cream-los-angeles/

http://keepinitkind.com/review-divine-dips-ice-creme/

http://theitalianvegan.tumblr.com/post/41954800238

story:
Embracing humanity with acts of LOVE...#1 at a time!

A Motorcycle Taxi Business Loan - will change Wibert's life. It will provide him with a New Motorcycle. He will be able to earn $200 per month and pay back $40 per month...the pay back will build up to provide another driver with a Loan. 

This is an amazing Act of Generosity that will keep on giving....you will touch and empower on real person and continue to empower others! 

Carlton Toews - Project Manager and Founder & Director of Project Help Haiti, www.projecthelphaiti.com has been working throughout Haiti for these past 7 years building Schools, Medical Clinics, Homes and providing loans.

it is my plan to raise funds for 4 Motorcycle Loans in the coming months.
story_txt:
Embracing humanity with acts of LOVE...#1 at a time!
A Motorcycle Taxi Business Loan - will change Wibert's life. It will provide him with a New Motorcycle. He will be able to earn $200 per month and pay back $40 per month...the pay back will build up to provide another driver with a Loan. 
This is an amazing Act of Generosity that will keep on giving....you will touch and empower on real person and continue to empower others! 
Carlton Toews - Project Manager and Founder & Director of Project Help Haiti, www.projecthelphaiti.com has been working throughout Haiti for these past 7 years building Schools, Medical Clinics, Homes and providing loans.
it is my plan to raise funds for 4 Motorcycle Loans in the coming months.

story:
La Petite Cantine


Taste is knowing the true quality ! Summertime is all about dining al fresco & under the stars ! !

Brush aside stereotypes to move forward and help us create and develop an outdoor restaurant run by people with special needs.


Like the general population,each person with a disability is an individual. They all have their own hopes, dreams, likes and dislikes. Disabled people who can work and who want to work face myriad barriers..

 

It's to our advantage to make the world a better place and teach people to accept themselves and to accept others. Help us give to special people the opportunity to participate in new experiences! We are asking you to work with us to develop a serious understanding of disabled people and the support they need to find employment.


My personal experience:

I have been fighting since my birth due to congenital heart defects. My heart doesn’t beat regularly so I had my first heart surgery when I was only 18 years old when doctors decide to place a pacemaker in my chest to help control my abnormal heart rhythms.


This device,

    


uses electrical pulses to prompt the heart to beat at a normal rate and I have already replaced it once. I will replace it again in about 4 years. Nowadays, through my personal experience in my 34's, helping special people through employment is one of my tasks. 

 

My idea is to compine great food and great motivated and talented people through dining in a casual and often party-like atmosphere.


                          


La petite Cantine's Philosophy:

A great outdoor petite restaurant is more than patio tables and umbrellas; it must thoughtfully create a sense of personality and character.

                                      


I think that eating outside enriches any meal. Our carefully planned and lovingly prepared menu will take you on a trip to the Mediterranean with recipes that none of them take more than 20 minutes to make. From starters to sides to main dishes and refreshing cocktails, this menu recipes are a burst of colour and a feast of tastes that take influence from Greece, Italy, Turkey ! La petite Cantine, enhances the local products and emphasizes on seasonal fresh vegetables, grown with care, picked the same day from our cantine's garden.

 

So.. don’t just dine out, dine outdoors by Experiencing the authentic !


Use of budgeted 52,900.00 usd Goal:

Food truck 12.000 usd





Restaurant equipment 12.000 usd

Farm rent 3.000 usd 

3 chemical WC 8.000 usd

Tent 3.000 usd

Constructions 5.000 usd

Custom logos - shirts and signs 3.000 usd

Administrative fees from indiegogo 6.900 usd


..We truly appreciate your help and support !
