story:
Who

We are Nano Metallics.   A team comprised of a research scientist with an in-depth background in physics and chemistry, and an entrepreneur - both humanitarians interested in bringing real solutions that make a big difference to society.

Our research scientist has spent the last 45 years in various research roles, working with varied sciences.  He holds 42 patents for various applications and processes.

Our entrepreneur and team leader as over 30 years of international business experience and manufacturing.  His recent work has been focused on environmental clean-ups and large scale industrial remediation.  His most recent efforts were spent bringing technology to Kuwait for cleaning up oil spilled in the desert after the first Gulf War - as part of a remediation initiative under a joint Kuwaiti-United Nations project.

Our research scientist's recent research and development has led to a method for delivering nano metallic particles for the control of microbiological growth and inactivation of viruses in unoccupied spaces.  Metallic ions in nano-sized particles are a known and proven science for inactivating viruses, bacteria, algae, fungi and harmful microbes.  

Specifically, he has developed a unique method that can be used to deliver a known science in a small, simple, low-cost, and highly effective device that can control the spread of the Ebola epidemic on Western Africa.  Each device shipped would also offer years of repeat operation to help control any future virus outbreaks.

This effort can be critical in helping the people of this region (and beyond) find a real solution for controlling the spread of this awful virus.


What We Need

We are looking to raise $250,000 to be used in a combination of ways to help bring immediate relief and control of the spread of the Ebola virus in the areas affected by the outbreak, as well as areas yet to be affected.

Before we can bring the device to the region, we have to file patent protection.  A total of 8 patents need to be filed.  Our budget for this is $70,000.  In addition, we need to purchase raw materials for building as many demonstration devises as possible.  We currently have 2 devices built, but need to build many more.  Our budget for demonstration devices is $85,000.  An additional $15,000 wold be used to transport the demonstration devices to he region via air freight.  We are also looking to travel to the region and hold several demonstrations.  We have already been invited to the Ivory Coast by the Ministry of Health, and Senegal by a local private group.  We plan to travel elsewhere in the region to offer as many demonstrations as possible.  Our travel budget to bring a team of persons to Western Africa for the demonstrations is $35,000.  We would also spend $8,000 on building an interactive website that would track our development of the project and host real time (or near real time) updates of the team's progress and demonstrations in Western Africa.  The budget for Indiegogo Fixed Fee is $10,000.  We would reserve the remaining $27,000 for any cost over-runs, additional fees paid to Indiegogo, general business needs, and have funds to help initiate additional manufacturing of devices upon our return.


What You Get

Helping us fund this effort would bring immediate help to a region stricken by a significant epidemic, and help save lives by helping to control the spread of the virus.

Contributors that donate $50 will receive a personally written Thank You note.

Contributors that donate $100 will receive a Trip Report and set of photographs related to our travel to the region and the demonstrations that took place, along with a personally written Thank You note.

Contributors that donate $1,000 can be part of the excitement and activities by logging into our website at a "members only" link for real time (or near real time) viewing of our demonstrations and product introduction, and updates on the impact devices are having in the region - in addition to receiving the Trip Report, photos and a personally written Thank You note.

Contributors that donate over $2,500 will receive their own personal nano particle metallic generator device that can be used for years in your home / office / car / or other - in addition to receiving full web access to real time events, the Trip Report, photos and a personally written Thank You note.  The device can also be used to manage control of mold, influenza and other microbial bacteria and viruses in unoccupied spaces. 

Given the time sensitive nature of this epidemic, and the amount of work that needs to be done to accomplish our goals, our funding goal is $250,000 within the next 45 days.  If the complete funding goal is not met, the funding generated will be used proportionally for the items outlined in our budget as we continue to raise funding through other outside methods.  


The Impact

The impact of bringing a device of this type to help manage the spread of the Ebola epidemic is immeasurable.  In speaking with numerous local groups in the region, the region does not have a solid solution to stop the spread of the epidemic, and many are scared.  Stopping the spread would also help keep the virus out of other countries in the region and elsewhere.

Paul has proven experience in bringing the science forward for a real solution.  Scott has proven experience in developing and managing projects of this nature and bringing them to fruition.


Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges presented by this project are a bit of a Catch 22.

Once we are able to present the device in local cities and villages demonstrating its affect,  we will generate an immediate demand for a very large number of units.  We will be faced with the challenge of being able to build an adequate number of machines to deliver to the various regions, and having to determine which region gets devices first.  We do not want to be put into the position of turning people in need down after the demonstrations take place. 

We plan to address part of this challenge by per-ordering supplies and components for manufacturing additional devices ahead of our demonstrations.

We will also work with local and international agencies to help create an effective distribution of the devices to assure areas with a greater need are served with some priority.


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to contributing, you can help by spreading the word of our efforts.   We will implement our own media and social media campaign once we are funded.

story:
Time To Share With Everyone What Is Possible Working With PS It Matters Companies!

PS It Matters (PSIM) companies Meals 4 Others.com and Purchasing 4 My Cause.com are solely focused at providing "tools" that support Causes and Organizations which are selected by our customers thereby making our communities better places to call home!  

Meals4Others is an online specialty food, personal and corporate gift store founded on a straightforward idea—you can purchase everyday items you want…at the same price as in your local store… and generate a 15% donation of your purchase price to feed someone in need at any Food Bank/Pantry of YOUR choice. 
 http://meals4others.com

In 2011, Meals 4 Others, the first PSIM company launched and it remains focused on eliminating hunger in our communities. In this 3 year period, our customer purchases generated donations providing over 685,000+ Meals at 336 different Food Banks and Food Pantries across the country!  This is all possible because "Every Purchase Feeds Someone In Need"!  A significant, real impact was made addressing the hunger crisis in our country and will continue to be made at Meals 4 Others as we are forecasted to exceed 850,000 Meals provided in 2014 alone!

The time has come to expand this impact to ALL Causes and Organizations that are important to our communities and customers.

Purchasing 4 My Cause is an online specialty food, personal and corporate gift store founded on the same straightforward idea—purchase everyday items you want…at the same price you find in your local store… and generate a 15% donation of your purchase price to support the Cause of YOUR choice!
http://purchasing4mycause.com

In August 2014 we launched Purchasing 4 My Cause. This was in response to many people celebrating our business model, but being frustrated that they could not use it to support Causes and Organizations that were important to them.  Purchasing 4 My Cause has been launched to support any and all community based effort (non-profit or not) that is makes a difference in our communities and our customers call it "My Cause".  Food Banks and Pantries can be selected, but now education, medical research (i.e. national or local cancer research organizations), church efforts, art organizations, and just about any effort to make our world a better place can be supported through individual or corporate purchases at Purchasing 4 My Cause.

We Can Give 15% Because We Do Not Market...Time to Market Our Message Is Now!

We are able to allow the 15% donation of our customers' purchase price to the Cause or Organization of THEIR CHOICE, by essentially eliminating the marketing costs of acquiring new customers via partnering with Non-profits and Corporations to "spread the word" about their exceptional results from purchasing items through Meals 4 Others and Purchasing 4 My Cause. Our customers share with other corporations in their communities the positive and grateful feedback received from gift recipients and the impact on their businesses of having partnered with a PS It Matters company.

While we ultimately believe that this successful referral-based model is the correct approach to grow the companies, prove profitability and positively impact so many communities, the time has come to get the word out by traditional marketing effort via print, direct mail and advertising!

Our Plans....Your Benefits...The Impact

Great ideas are only great if people know about them and can embrace them.  Our steady growth over the last 3 years proves that when people are made aware of Meals 4 Others and Purchasing 4 My Cause, they will utilize us regularly for personal and corporate gifts, gear and marketing materials.  Because we believe we are very close to monthly profitability, we do not want to change the business model in any form.  We will utilize traditional marketing outreach to share with as many people as possible what they can do both individually and corporately--without spending an additional dime--to support their Causes/Organizations, their Communities and, as corporations, to truly set themselves apart from their competitors.

Because we are in an advanced start-up stage, the ability to spend any amount of funding on marketing efforts will make a huge impact on our ability to expand individual and corporate client base.  If we are able to meet our funding goal, double our funding goal or achieve 30% of our funding goal, each of these result would advance the presence of Meals 4 Others and Purchasing 4 My Cause in the general marketplace.  While important to all of us at PS It Matters, it has an incredible impact on the organizations that will receive donations directed through our expanded customer base.

We are now seeking your direct support of our efforts to change the world to be a better place with each purchase at Meals 4 Others and Purchasing 4 My Cause. To thank you for your support at various levels we are offering the following to individual and corporate supporters:

  • Feed 10+ People In Need  - 2,000 Supporters with a $10 Pledge would direct in their name a $2.50 donation to the Food Bank in their state.
  • High Five  - 200 Supporters with a $50 Pledge would receive a $40 Gift Card at Purchasing 4 My Cause.com.
  • Sending The Love - 200 Supporters with a $100 Pledge would receive a $75 Gift Card at Purchasing 4 My Cause.com and FREE SHIPPING on all items purchased with the Gift Card(s).
  • Good Friend - 200 Supporters with a $250 Pledge would receive a $175 Gift Card at Purchasing 4 My Cause.com and FREE SHIPPING on all items purchased with the Gift Card(s).
  • PS It Matters "Family" - 50 Supporters with a $1,000 Pledge would receive a $800 Gift Card at Purchasing 4 My Cause and FREE SHIPPING on all items purchased with the Gift Card(s).
  • PS It Matters "Partner" - 10 Supporters with a $5,000 Pledge would receive a $4,500 Gift Card at Purchasing 4 My Cause and FREE SHIPPING on all items purchased with the Gift Card(s).
We have tried to create rewards that will extend our appreciation to individuals and corporations that partner with us in this funding effort. The gift cards can be used for a single gift card or we can send multiple gifts cards in whatever denominations requested.  In addition to being able to select from our wonderful offerings you will be further fulfilled knowing that 15% of the gift card value will be directed by YOU to the Cause or Organization of your choice.  

There Are Always Challenges

Building any business is full of challenges and PS It Matters is not an exception to that rule as we apply a social entrepreneurship business model to individual and corporate gifts.  The good news is that over the last 3 years we have invested more than $500,000 in building the infrastructure of the company so that it can now scale very easily.  What we have accomplished:

  • The food and gift side of the business is fully developed, proven and validated by our customers as comprised of quality offerings that exceed expectations.
  • Clothing and Marketing offerings have been fully developed and we have a good sense of exactly what customers want and how it can be provided within a competitive and profitable pricing strategy.
  • We have a dozens of corporate references that validate the positive impact this approach to providing gifts has had on them personally as well as on their business.
  • Customer selection of a Cause or Organization of their choice (“Personal Donation Localization”) has proven to be a unique and very compelling feature of our general business model.
  • Reusable bags and other volume programs that leverage our ability to “localize” and manage Cause-related giving is a proven, profitable aspect of the PSIM business.
  • Infrastructure of the business in the form of system, process and procedures is fully deployed and proven as a valued asset of the business.
  • Launching of P4MC is underway and prospects for this expanded approach have received widespread accolades from our corporate and individual clients.
  • The management and operating team are proven and completely capable of doing it “all” on a day-to-day basis.  Our Technical and Development team continues to improve and expand our operating systems capabilities to enable greater volume, increased offerings and improved efficiencies.
All of this positions Meals 4 Others and Purchasing 4 My Cause for growth and is the core of our funding efforts.  Increasing awareness levels will result in more individual and corporate customers.  We are committed to making it happen and will continue to work tirelessly to prove this business model and the good it can do for all who purchase from us given that "Every Purchase Supports Your Cause"!


Other Ways You Can Help

If the pledge approach does not work for you and you want to support our efforts...go on Meals 4 Others.com or Purchasing 4 My Cause.com and simply do some shopping and buy a gift.  Each purchase will support Your CAUSE and you will get...or send... some fantastic items with messaging declaring Your CAUSE!

If you are part of a corporation that sends appreciation, referral, holiday or other gifts, please encourage those in charge of making the gift decisions to reach out to us so we can share with them our corporate references and experiences.  Spread the word is all we ask!

The power of each of us to spread the word is amazing when applied.  If you cannot financially support us at this time, please make an effort to share this funding effort with others.  Encourage people you know to visit Meals 4 Others.com and Purchasing 4 My Cause.com to read about our efforts and see our offerings.  

Thank you for your time, consideration and support!

The management and operating team are proven and completely capable of doing it “all” on a day-to-day basis.  Our Technical and Development team continues to
improve and expand our operating systems capabilities to enable greater volume, increased offerings and improved efficiencies.

All of this positions Meals 4 Others and Purchasing 4 My Cause for growth and is the core of our funding efforts.  Increasing awareness levels will result in more individual and corporate customers.  We are committed to making it happen and will continue to work tirelessly to prove this business model and the good it can do for all who purchase from us given that "Every Purchase Supports Your Cause"!




Other Ways You Can Help If the pledge approach does not work for you and you want to support our efforts...go on Meals 4 Others.com or Purchasing 4 My Cause.com and simply do some shopping and buy a gift.  Each purchase will support Your CAUSE and you will get...or send... some fantastic items with messaging declaring Your CAUSE!
If you are part of a corporation that sends appreciation, referral, holiday or other gifts, please encourage those in charge of making the gift decisions to reach out to us so we can share with them our corporate references and experiences.  Spread the word is all we ask!
The power of each of us to spread the word is amazing when applied.  If you cannot financially support us at this time, please make an effort to share this funding effort with others.  Encourage people you know to visit Meals 4 Others.com and Purchasing 4 My Cause.com to read about our efforts and see our offerings.  

Thank you for your time, consideration and support!

story:
Hello Flying Annex

  

Laura Camp and Aaron Hale opened Flying Yoga in 2010 with the vision to create a vibrant health and fitness space in the burgeoning Temescal neighborhood. The studio is thriving, and the students, teachers, and staff bring a wonderfully authentic and energetic presence to our developing section of Telegraph. 

 

Aaron & Laura flying

 

Spreading out!

Flying Yoga is bursting at the seams and we've decided to add a new studio to the mix: the Flying Annex at 4202 Telegraph. The Annex will allow Flying to grow, adding to our regular studio schedule with more dance and strength classes and brand new offerings, like yoga and Zumba for kids.

Laura was a professional dancer and has a circus performance background, and she's keen to support the talented folks in the community by offering a low-cost space to share dance, circus arts, filmmaking, comedy, improv, socially engaged talks, and whatever else bubbles up. 

 

virtual Flying Annex by Jason DeAntonis | jasondeantonis.com

 

Would you like to join us?

We have a fundamental mission to offer classes and events at a fair market rate while paying our instructors and staff a good living wage. In addition to our regular classes, we offer donation classes and work/trade to help make our classes available to students from all walks of life. We feel a studio should reflect its local community and we want Flying to appeal to people from a wide range of ages, backgrounds, and interests.

Running a small business is a financial challenge and expanding into the Annex increases this challenge. A local business in the current marketplace can be successful and helpful to a community, yet have a small profitability margin for the owners. This makes expansion difficult and can stagnate a business even if the time is right for it to grow.

This funding effort will allow us to purchase the extras that will help the Annex serve as a performance and community space. It will give us the budget to install variable stage lighting, dance mirrors, a robust sound system, and beyond. The funds will also help us enhance the doorway, facade, exterior paint, and general curb appeal of the studio. 

We love our corner of Temescal and would be honored to have you join us in beautifying our neighborhood and enlivening our community.

 

sketch of Jan Damm performing at Flying by Kevin Woodson | kevinwoodson.com

 

The debut.

We've already started the buildout process and plan to open the Annex in April 2013.

 

We appreciate your consideration and support.

Laura, Aaron, Ryn, Argel, Mary & the entire Flying Crew

Video Editing and Footage by Debra Schaffner | aliengirl.net

Video Footage by Evan Cecil, Luke Sauer and Conor Murphy

story:
In an effort to help bring awareness , I am hosting a dinner for the residents of Nickelsville, the self managed eco-village for the homeless. These residents of Seattle need your attention, time and love.

http://www.nickelsville.org/

Cooking for 115 people is no small task, so I will need the help of as many people I can. If you feel like this resonates with you, I would love your help and the residents of Nickelsville will be more than grateful for your efforts. 

We will need the following:
  • Money
  • Food Ingredients
  • Time
  • Kitchen Space
  • Serving Dishes
  • Anything else you think we may need to serve 115 people

As we get closer to the date, I will be organizing all of the resources needed for this. Please message me if you are interested in volunteering & please share this with all who would like to help.

I am budgeting for $10 per head for the dinner.  If there is any money left over, it will be donated to the residents of Nickelsville to buy more food and supplies.

Here is a link to the Facebook event page.  If you want to be involved, please click that you are attending.  This will give me a better gague of what kind of resources are available.

https://www.facebook.com/events/111601078999337/?ref=ts&fref=ts

If you would like to contact me:

claudeeugenelee@gmail.com

story:
Miss Kitty's Kitchen is located in Marin County just minutes from San Francisco.  Marguerite Holloway, owner and aspiring entrepreneur, has been baking all her life -an ingrained skill passed on by her mother and grandmother while growing up on a large sheep station in rural Central Otago, New Zealand.  After many years in the restaurant business in California, Marguerite was invited to make desserts for an established seafood restaurant in Marin County.  Her signature, Lemon Meringue Pie became a huge hit with the patrons.   Many customers would place their order for the pie when they made their reservation!  And then came along Marguerite's to-die-for-Pavlova.  Paired with a dry champagne, this Kiwi-made Pavlova is "unparalleled decadence."   After realizing how very popular her downunder recipes were becoming, Marguerite created Miss Kitty's Kitchen, -  named after her beloved cat who passed in 2012 and in honor of her New Zealand heritage.

The purpose of Miss Kitty's campaign is to expand business throughout the San Francisco Bay Area in the following revenue generating channels:

- product sales to local cafes, restaurants, and individual customers.

- online sales for shipment anywhere in the US.

- local Farmer's Market community, a widely popular source for organic food products in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Miss Kitty's Kitchen needs your help to make this dream come true.  So, we are asking for your financial support!  If you are unable to give $, just spread the word!

 

What We Need

Miss Kitty's Kitchen is aiming to raise $28,000.  Those funds will be used for the following start-up needs:

- a new delivery truck

- establishing an online bakery with shopping cart

- marketing, packaging, permit expences, advertising

- cooking and baking equipment

- Farmers' Market set-up.

- rental for a larger kitchen

- Miss kitty helpers!

 

Food Source

Most of all know that there is no better way to compliment a terrific meal than to add terrific ending, a great dessert.  In an area of devoted foodies people are constantly seeking out new and exciting foods and love to support small local business.  Miss Kitty likes to use local organic ingredients to make sure people get the best of the best.  We also import specific items from New Zealand like the golden syrup and Edmond's baking powder to keep our recipes as authentic as possible.   Since we use alot of eggs we definately support local free range egg suppliers from happy hens.  We are convinced that they just taste better and there yolks are a little brighter.  Soon to be a member of Marin Organic's.

Now and the future

Presently Miss Kitty is celebrating the America's Cup celebration in the Bay Area with her fellow Kiwi's.  This is a great opportunity to share and promote the food of New Zealand in every aspect.  Upon raising our goal the Miss Kitty crew will expand into all types of kitchen accessories ie aprons, tools, recipe books.  Also, upon being a part of the Farmers' Market community we will expand into jarred preservatives.  Preservatives would include jams, sauces, pickles and chutney's.

How to order with us

Our website is under construction.  We will send out an email to announce completion soon.  Meantime we will post all information about our goodies on Facebook so you can order if you like.  Shipping is limited to cookies and squares only.  We do deliver for a small fee within the Bay Area.  If you have any specific questions please email us. 

Special Thanks

This campaign has been alot of fun and alot of work.  Thank you to Laurel Thornton and Danka Buchalova for all their expertise skills in making this happen.

story:
**Free Stasis HOT sauce with every perk $15+

 

Stasis is here to make Local, Seasonal, Delicious Eating Easy for You!

Our Preserves are:

low/no sugar - no additives or preservatives - sourced seasonally from local farmers

 

Owner Julian and his sister Megan in Stasis' local foods shop

Julian Katz founder of Stasis Preserves cooked professionally in restaurants around the city then decided to strike out on my own. In 2010 a small start-up begun focusing on preserving locally grown foods and enabling the local, delicious, and healthy bounty to last all year. Re-connecting us to our roots, the way we used to eat. This endeavour became Stasis Preserves.

Selling at The St. Lawrence, Brickworks and Trinity Bellwoods Farmers' Markets (and a few others) for the first growing season the business began to gain some ground. With the goal of supporting other small local producers, Julian decided to take the leap to open a small local foods shop. This became our production kitchen where we hand-make the preserves, as well as a community hub where people can find great local artisan foods. Stasis Preserves is now almost 3 years old and we are building a loyal fan base of enthusiasts who support the local food community. 

We are certified by Foodland Ontario as a locally sourced and made product.

WHY?

You should be able to access healthy local foods all year regardless of the weather outside. So we can enable local eating all year we need to produce a lot during the growing season. That's a large financial output all at once. Seasonal eating is delicious, healthy and honest. We want to enable people to access the foods they want. We want to help people support small farmers that are working hard to feed our cities and are up against huge industrial farms. 

If each family contributed $10 a week into the local food system that would add 2.4 billion to our local economy.

We are asking for $30,000 to help us make enough preserves to keep up with the demand. People want to eat local all year, we want to help them do just that. We have had three successful seasons but with the launch of our local foods store and extra costs we simply do not have the funds.

We want to build a sustainable business that can support itself, and the community. People want to eat locally, so we need your support to give you and everyone that option.

 

THE ONTARIO PRESERVES

 

With your help we hope to make enough of these delicious preserves to last until next year's growing season:

Ontario Strawberry Rhubarb, Fruit Spread with Ontario Cranberries

Ontario Raspberry, Fruit Spread with Ontario Cranberries

Ontario Blueberry, Fruit Spread with Ontario Cranberries

Ontario Red Wine and Cherries Spread

Ontario Caramelized Onion Spread

Ontario Pears and Roasted Garlic Spread

 

Why Your Help Matters:

  • You will be able to eat locally all year  

  • You will be supporting local farmers and enabling people to choose local food all year

Our preserves also do not contain:

  • any additives or artificial preservatives - we use only clean ingredients.

Support us, so Stasis can support you, your health, local eating, and small scale farming to keep us and our land healthy. It's about re-connecting to how we use to keep fresh produce in season all year. We want to help people re-think how they eat and re-connect us to the communities and flavours of our foods. We want to keep small farmers in business and limit our carbon footprint by sourcing from within our communities and province.

Stasis Preserves has been growing steadily. As we enter our fourth growing season we are striving to keep up with demand. We've simply hit a growing pain. This year we need to produce more than ever before, but we need your help to fund it.

You deserve to know what's in your food and where it comes from. Stasis Preserves believes in transparency and accountability. We believe that quality and taste are the most important aspects of food. We know that there are thousands of people that believe, like we do, that protecting our small independent farmers is real food security, and that the most delicious food is local, and hand-made. We want to share our local bounty with you and make it accessible.

If Our Goal isn't Reached:

If we don’t reach our goal we will still produce as many jars as we can. We will simply run the risk of running out of supply before the next growing season, like we did this year. This limits what we buy from local farmers, your ability to buy local produce year round and is a limit to our business as a small start-up. By having a steady supply, we can affect change and support our community by always having a local alternative. We can prove that eating great food from our region is more delicious while also changing the food system for the better. We don’t have to import strawberries from across the world when we can grow them in our backyards and preserve them in Stasis all year.

 

THE BREAKDOWN

  • Most of the money will go to produce, jars, labels, vinegars, organic sugar, spices, 67% ($20,100)

  • Staff costs to make the preserves and package and ship your perks 10% ($3,000)

  • Overheads: rent, utilities, transportation to the farms 10% ($3,000)

  • Indiegogo fees 9% ($2,700)

  • Credit card processing fees 3% ($900) 

 

THE PERKS

We are offering all kinds of unique, delicious perks. Take a look the the right to see what you awesome things you can get and if you have any questions send us an e-mail: info@stasispreserves.com.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP: SHARE

You can always help!

We know that is isn't all about dollars and cents and some people want to help, but can't afford to give money. Instead, we ask you to send this campaign around to family, friends, and 'friends'. Connect people to what we are doing, so they can support us and local food. Spread the word telling people about the importance and value of our goal using copy and past or Indiegogo's share tools. Make some noise, so people take notice that eating local is always an option.

 

@stasispreserves

https://www.facebook.com/stasispreserves


 

FAQ

What makes your product so much more delicious and healthy?

We preserve the produce fresh and at its height of ripeness. This creates a naturally more delicious taste. We use no artificial additives or preservatives, and have completely clean ingredients. Fruit & Sugar and/or Vinegar and Spices. That's it. We are a fruit forward line, not loaded with sugar, letting you taste the fresh produce.

How is it preserved without pectin or preservatives?

Through the thorough research and development of our line we've gained all the knowledge and experience to keep everything preserved safely. You can keep our jars on the shelf for a year and a half, and once opened in the fridge for conservatively 4-6 weeks. Many last over two months. Avoid double dipping or leaving it out of the fridge for too long.

What Flavours do you have?

We have 7 core flavours: Raspberry, Blueberry, Strawberry Rhubarb, Red Wine Cherry, Caramelized Onion, Pear & Roasted Garlic Spreads, and a Hot Sauce.

Why are the called Spreads?

The difference between Jams are Spreads is simply that our spreads contain less sugar than jams. Canadian laws state that a "jam" has to have at least 68% sugar. Our spreads have way less than that.

We call our spreads "spreads" on the label so they they are not mistaken for high sugar "Jams" or "Preserves" (65% sugar).

Our savoury spreads are similar to a "chutney" or a "relish" but the rules are too specific and don't apply to what we are making (for example a "chutney" must have at least 15% oil, ours has none).

How do I choose my flavour?

After the campaign, we will send out a survey to ask which flavour(s) you would like. 

Is the product organic?

Some of our produce is organic. Becoming certified organic is an expensive process many of our farmers are very small and simply cannot afford the legal certification. Most grow organically, but just aren't certified. We know how all of our produce is grown.

Chemicals are expensive, and farmers don't want to use them. Some spray only if absolutely necessary to save a crop, and there is always a regulated time before going to market that they cannot be sprayed. For example, carrots cannot be sprayed 2 months before being sold.

How is the produce sourced?

We build relationships with various small, local farmers through our farmer's markets. We talk to people, make connections, and talk about food!  We take trips to the farms to visit the people, taste the food, and see the practices the farmers use.

How is the product made?

Every jar is made my hand by Stasis staff and Julian himself in a certified commercial kitchen. This enables us to create a tightly quality controlled product. The product is cooked for a certain amount of time, until the texture and flavour is just right. We test the acidity and sugar levels for safely and consistency. We batch code our lots with best before dates and track all the details so the process is fully traceable and accountable. We can sleep well knowing that our products are safe, delicious and local.

How will I get my Perk?

We are excited to share our preserves with you! We will send out your perks by the end of September once every preserve has been re-stocked after the busy growing season.

Where can I learn more?

www.stasispreserves.com

@stasispreserves

https://www.facebook.com/stasispreserves

OR email us with any questions info@stasispreserves.com

Why are the called Spreads?
The difference between Jams are Spreads is simply that our spreads contain less sugar than jams. Canadian laws state that a "jam" has to have at least 68% sugar. Our spreads have way less than that.
We call our spreads "spreads" on the label so they they are not mistaken for high sugar "Jams" or "Preserves" (65% sugar).
Our savoury spreads are similar to a "chutney" or a "relish" but the rules are too specific and don't apply to what we are making (for example a "chutney" must have at least 15% oil, ours has none).
How do I choose my flavour?
After the campaign, we will send out a survey to ask which flavour(s) you would like. 
Is the product organic?
Some of our produce is organic. Becoming certified organic is an expensive process many of our farmers are very small and simply cannot afford the legal certification. Most grow organically, but just aren't certified. We know how all of our produce is grown.
Chemicals are expensive, and farmers don't want to use them. Some spray only if absolutely necessary to save a crop, and there is always a regulated time before going to market that they cannot be sprayed. For example, carrots cannot be sprayed 2 months before being sold.
How is the produce sourced?
We build relationships with various small, local farmers through our farmer's markets. We talk to people, make connections, and talk about food!  We take trips to the farms to visit the people, taste the food, and see the practices the farmers use.
How is the product made?
Every jar is made my hand by Stasis staff and Julian himself in a certified commercial kitchen. This enables us to create a tightly quality controlled product. The product is cooked for a certain amount of time, until the texture and flavour is just right. We test the acidity and sugar levels for safely and consistency. We batch code our lots with best before dates and track all the details so the process is fully traceable and accountable. We can sleep well knowing that our products are safe, delicious and local.
How will I get my Perk?
We are excited to share our preserves with you! We will send out your perks by the end of September once every preserve has been re-stocked after the busy growing season.
Where can I learn more?
www.stasispreserves.com
@stasispreserves
https://www.facebook.com/stasispreserves
OR email us with any questions info@stasispreserves.com

story:
Hello, my name is Mitchell. I have been living in a Nursing Facility since 2006 as a paraplegic. In 2009, my health turned toward the worst and I now have Quadriplegia.

With the use of Streaming Internet, I would be able to travel the world without leaving my room.

The only Internet Provider is Comcast. The monthly cost is $58.95/mo.

If I get more than what I am asking, I would like to take some college classes via the Internet. But all this cannot be achived without your donations. I would rather learn something as I lay here.

I encourage everyone to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

story:
Go Digital or Go Dark

Parkhill Cinema has been a source of entertainment for Tarboro and surrounding areas for over 22 years. We have maintained the lowest ticket and snack prices of any theatre around and truly love being a part of this community. We’ve seen moviegoers laugh at the comedies, cringe at the horrors and cry at the dramas. Kids smiling and dancing during the animated movies has always been a treat. We have strived to give everyone fast and courteous service and our popcorn is delicious! We have recently installed new seats in our auditoriums to give everyone a more comfortable movie experience. But all of this is in jeopardy unless we can upgrade to digital equipment.

For almost a hundred years, movies have been created using 35mm film and shown on 35mm projectors. Hollywood is now phasing out this way of showing movies and replacing it with a new digital system. Converting to digital is quite expensive, especially for a small town theatre like Parkhill Cinema. So, we are asking for the community’s assistance to help us with the conversion.

Not only do we want to keep showing movies and making memories but we want to continue to support Tarboro and Edgecombe County. We are firm believers in shopping locally and supporting local businesses because doing so helps keep revenue in our town and community. Tarboro is a great place to live and we want to remain a part of that.

So, what’s so special about digital? Of course, a digital movie has a sharper image. There are no more “burning” images when a projector would stop unexpectedly. It is also an eco-friendly alternative. We will be able to offer more special events like birthday parties, classic films and movie marathons and most important is that more movies (and a more variety of movies) will be made available for us to play. It will be a huge positive for Parkhill Cinema moviegoers!

We hope you will check out the different donation options and perks. We appreciate your support as we strive to keep Tarboro’s hometown theatre alive!

story:
Help revolutionize the way wine is discovered, remembered and shared. 

Download on the Apple App Store (It's free!)

Overview:

Tipsi was created to help simplify and enhance wine ordering at restaurants. Our application aggregates, processes, and publishes restaurant wine list data to enable personalized and restaurant-specific recommendations to make wine drinking a straightforward, pleasurable, and memorable experience.  

Tipsi is fully integrated with Facebook, Twitter and Foursquare, ensuring users can share their experiences, reviews, and preferences with friends and colleagues.  We are focused on NYC, but plan to expand to other major cities as soon as NYC is completed.  Is your favorite restaurant not processed by Tipsi yet? Want to use Tipsi, but don't live in NYC? Simply upload images of a wine list through the app if you want a local restaurant processed.  

Our Story:

Tipsi began as the hungover brunch project of three friends who wanted to democratize wine enjoyment.  Recalling a wonderful dinner party we'd all been to the night before, the next morning none of us could remember the name of the amazing wine we'd enjoyed!  We wondered if this happened to everyone and informally polled family, friends, foodies and aficionados and realized we were not alone...many people have had a great wine and had no way to record and retain that experience, let alone sort and share them. We surveyed the wine app community and to our dismay found that all the existing technologies were geared towards wine experts and collectors and not the normal restaurant patron. As enthusiastic wine drinkers with diverse backgrounds in technology and operations, we lacked any specialized wine knowledge beyond knowing generally what we liked.  By chance, we were introduced to world-renowned Sommelier Anani Lawson who joined us to build a platform that compiles, stores, and indexes restaurant wine lists. This is Tipsi, a revolutionary way for everyone from a casual consumer to a true connoisseur to evaluate their palate, confidently discover new varieties, and socially share exceptional wine experiences in a functional and unpretentious way. 

Why Tipsi:

Wine selection is personal, expensive, and extremely nuanced making it challenging and stressful to the casual consumer. Restaurants take advantage of this by up selling and cleverly structuring and pricing their wine lists to push higher margin products to their benefit and not the consumer's. Tipsi came to be because we as consumers were frustrated by the status quo. Wine is often 40%+ of a total dinner bill, yet it is the greatest unknown when consumers need to make a purchase decision. Additionally, like preferences in art or music, wine "taste" is completely unique from person-to-person. Depending on your budget, wine familiarity, and specific location, you can receive a recommendation that is personalized to you, your meal, and your party. Tipsi empowers you to discover your unique virtual taste.

Use of Proceeds:

  1. Populate NYC wine lists (we have 13% of Manhattan and Brooklyn processed)
  2. Add liquor store search and recommendations 
  3. Add vendor portal for collection directly from restaurants, wineries and liquor stores
  4. Stretch Goal - Add additional cities beyond New York

Contact us directly for more information.

Risks:

Data Acquisition 

  1. Currently a few cents per bottle - goal of $0.25 cents per bottle
  2. Direct collection from vendors will dramatically lower costs

Technology 

  1. Tipsi is still developing technology for local vendor search and acquisition
  2. Tipsi is still developing technology to connect wineries directly with consumers, a key point to Tipsi's strategy  

Tipsi has a great team addressing all of these challenges and will overcome them with help from you, the users.

Share:

Like what you hear? Want to be an even bigger supporter? Help us by becoming a Tipsi evangelist and share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and directly with your friends to help us continue to bring a truly revolutionary product to market! 

Help us democratize wine.  

Drink Smart. Get Tipsi.

story:
Who We Are

Up to 60% of all businesses fail during the first 3 years of operation. This means many of the owners of these businesses have lost all of their savings and have to start over working for somebody.  Allison and Fred, have over 70 years of combined business experience and it is our goal to help change those numbers.

We are business consultants that provide needed services to small to medium sized companies in order to grow their firm.  We are asking for donations, in whatever size you choose, to help us help others realize the American Dream of owning their own business. The money we raise will allow us to continue to offer substantial discounts to companies and start ups who need  help and are experiencing cash flow issues.


Please watch our video for details on the types of services we offer our customers.

How Your Donation Will Impact Others!

The money we receive from your donations will be applied to our customers most in need. It allows us to extend greater credit lines or deferred billing to those with extremely poor cash flow.  We want others to be able to embrace the American Dream by successful at owning their own business. Part of our goal is to create and keep careers in the United States and eliminate the instability and worry of  jobs moving overseas. Please help us restore faith in the US business community.

Our Personal Business Backgrounds:

           Education

  • MBA in International Business (4.0 GPA). Walden University, a division of the Harvard School of Business' Laureate Program
  • PMI Certified PMP. Stony Brook University (Project Management Professional)
  • Post Graduate Legal Certificate. Adelphi University
  • Bachelor of Fine Arts:  NYU Producing (Financial) Emphasis.

           Professional Highlights

  • Experienced with startups; business plan documentation, corporate structuring, and developing new market strategies

  • Crafted investor presentations and trade events that yielded $11MM funding from Intel 

  • Professor & Faculty of Business Administration at an Advanced University Level

  • Project Manager for many proprietary software development projects. Budget range: $2M-$20M

Other Employees have the following skill sets.

                       Professional Highlights

  • Retired Military
  • Owned and Operated several retail organisations in the New York Metropolitan Area. Industry sectors include:
  1. automobile
  2. medical
  3. ice-cream
  4. drug testing
  5. mobile medical diagnostics
  6. life insurance testing
  7. photography and videography
  8. air conditioning & heating
  9. energy management
  10. fine jewelry

Visit our website @ www.visCusa.com for additional information o

All The Ways You Can Help

The Many Ways You Can Make a Difference to Others:

  • Make a financial contribution via a perk box
  • Help us get the word out by making some noise about our campaign to your friends, family, and colleagues
  • Ask your contacts to visit our Indiegogo campaign www.igg.me/at/viscusa and leave us an encouraging note (But to leave a note, public or private,  you need to create a user account first)

Thank you for reading our story and helping us reach our goal

HERE ARE TESTIMONIALS of CLIENTS WE ALREADY HELPED:

Maid Bigade of Derby CT 

Adopt-A-Battalion of Massapequa, NY

story:
While we travel through the Greek tradition and culture, we realize that the table has a significant presence in every aspect of the lives of people of this place. Around the table, family gathers to share, joy and sorrow. The mother offers the best in her children with a good meal while she is waiting to turn her husband tired from the job to give him a bit of respite from a tiring day with a plate of a really tasteful meal.

At weddings and funerals, celebrations and miseries people gathered at the table, not only to eat but to complete a sharing from the heart in a mystical way. To eat, laugh, cry together, to mourn, to have fun. The table is not furniture for us. It's part of everyday’s life and the bonding between people. This is the importance given by the Greeks to the “trapeza” for so many centuries, has been transformed in part of Greek Culture.

Ingredients:The air and waters of Greece, the traditions of the place and its people , the words that say the old women in the villages, the hands of ordinary people who gather the fruit, the care of parents who raise their children with the hope that the world isn’t just industrial.
Preparation:First listen carefully as your grandmother talking about things she learned from her grandmother. Then create a laboratory where nothing is random - neither temperature nor the composition of the material, nor pure raw materials. You put the best fruits and finish with a beautiful gift.
Serving:Making sure that every jar, every linen sack, each box has the best content, we welcome the visitors that are looking for the “pure and unique” and speak to them for the taste and healthy life. We give them to taste products in the cities already forgotten.
This is the recipe of Greek tradition. The Greece that we received from our ancestors, we loved and we deliver to our children. Discover it by yourselves… We offer it on your plate ...


What we need & What you get

The past year we managed to get almost 16000 bucks by creating furnitures, candles, paintings, souvenirs and many many other things as a team. We worked a lot! Now that summer gets is coming up we need to prepare a new place to house our "magic". These 16000 are enough for only the permissions and some of the renovation. We need 20000 more to complete renovate and buy equipment, print players and some other basic needs.

We are not here to take. We are here to give. Through this campaign we attend to build a workshop that will make people smile.

*We are about to offer numbered wooden cases with a collection of organic liquors like you never have tasted before.

*Limited edition bottles with organic tsipouro with a drop of handpicked forest fruits.

*Wooden limited edition cases with a collection of herbs selected from the high mountain. Pure and clean like the nature offers them.

*Coupons to buy from our website whatever tackles you down!

*Many products and souvenirs

*But our best offer is a five day free vacation in our facility where you spend the day up on the mountain with us. We 'll conduct a tour and spent the day in amazingly beautiful places in nature. Food and accomodation will be fully covered.

If you have ever tasted a pure natural mushroom selected by hand in over 1200 m. high on the mountain, combined with the special flavor of wild oregano and preserved in organic extra virgin oil.

We all know many things about Roman Empire. But which of us really knows what their delicatessen food used to be?? We are happy to inform you that one the most favorites Roman deli was chestnut soup!! We are planning to recreate it in beautiful packages just for you.

Haven’t we got you attention yet? Lets try one more!

Take a look in our video above….

We need the money to get started. No matter how hard we work isn't enough. After that we ‘ll make you chance your point of view about real food. We just need a push…

story:
$2 can be spent on so little....Our story is simple to us but we don't expect everyone to understand.  Chris and I, Leanne, always talked about adoption, even when we were dating.  See, it's not about rescuing a child from an orphanage and getting a pat on the back.  It's about seeing a need and meeting it with the desire we have to raise children.  We are able to conceive easily, we have two beautiful daughters, Haylee and Audrey.

But it breaks our hearts to know that there are children who will not even have a chance at having a family.  We do not promote pulling a child out of their home, no matter the poverty.  A family should ALWAYS stay together.  We are going through an agency that is reputable in both countries because they only adopt out children who are truly orphans and they work hard in each country to promote and help inter-country adoption and to sustain and grow healthy families.  The goal is to build healthy families around the world....and even if they are not healthy due to poverty, it is still not a reason to deem those child "orphans." 

Orphans are the children who have been abandoned, whose parents have died, who are given up because the parent(s) knows they cannot care for them and it was their decision to make, or, in many cases, the child is a result of rape and the mom feels it is too painful to keep that baby.

God doesn't look at genes.  Over and over He speaks of adopting us as His own.  He loves us like He loves His Son, Jesus Christ, when we choose to accept His gift of forgiveness, grace and mercy and redemption He offered us by Jesus' death on the cross and resurrection.  He writes to us that there is no longer a difference between Jew and Gentile, we are all loved equally when we become His children. I am that Gentile who is loved, thank you Jesus.

So, in faith, recognizing that adoption is a beautiful, hard, long, forever journey, we are trusting and already feel that our next two children, one adopted from Haiti and one from Ethiopia, will have just as much a place in our hearts and home as our two daughters.  We tell people often that God has placed this so much on our minds and hearts that it is more normal for us to plan our family in this way than to get pregnant with our next two.  We have seen other friends choose this same path and we know that God has directed us to do the same.

Why two?  Well, the journey started with just one adoption from Ethiopia two years ago.  But the waiting time has gotten longer and our paperwork just sits in the embassy, and therefore the stretch in age between our youngest daughter and our next baby from there is increasing.  We thought that maybe we would want four children and as time has dragged on and Haiti's requirements on a family for adopting opened up more to us we thought maybe we would adopt from there after we brought our baby home from Ethiopia.  But, we were advised by our agency that the time it would take to bring a child from Haiti would probably fit into the time we are waiting for our child from Ethiopia.  (As a side note, the children are not picked out.  We will know who they are after they are referred to us by our agency.)

So, we are "concurrently adopting".  We are adopting internationally simply because we love different cultures and know it would not be an issue to incorporate that into our daily lives and because we know that the situation is dire in many of the orphanages over in both countries.  Thankfully our agency moves the children (when they have been thoroughly investigated and found to be actual orphans) from those orphanages to a healthy transition home.  Both countries do not have a well-functioning foster care system like we do here.  We have many friends fostering here in the states and we have friends adopting domestically and we have friends in our position.  All families are called to help in the way they feel God has led them so that all areas of need are covered.

We are doing as much as we can on a youth pastor's salary and my part-time jobs to provide for these adoptions.  Most of Ethiopia's cost ($35,000) had already been provided, saved and fundraised but then the decision to adopt from Haiti was made and we have started all over again.  Some money can be switched from our Ethiopian adoption to Haiti but some cannot.  Haiti costs can range anywhere from $28,000 to $38,000 (trust us, when you see all the fees laid out for adoption you understand why they cost so much, IT MAKES SENSE!).  We need much of this money within the next year because this adoption will progress so fast.  By next year we will be visiting our toddler and a year later we will bring them home.

$2 can be spent on so little....in our family it's a box of Timbit donuts or Haylee's lunch at school or a tip for the kids drying off my van after a car wash.  But would you consider donating $2, one for each child? Would you consider retweeting our story or sharing it on Facebook so that others could give just their $2?  With the money we can use from our Ethiopian adoption we need about another $15,000 more in the next coming year but for now we are starting with $6,000.  

 

We don't believe every family  is called to adopt because it is all consuming and a different journey than getting pregnant and giving birth.  But the Bible does tell us to care for widows and orphans.  I recently watched a girl I have mentored for 5 years, her three younger siblings and their father, bury their mom and wife.  Our hearts are so compelled to care for this widowed father and his family.  Our hearts are compelled to care for two legitimate orphans by bringing them into our home and loving them as our own, as God does for us today and every day forward.  Would $2 be one of the ways you can do James 1:27?

(And, of course, it doesn't have to be just $2, but that could go without saying...)

www.stephensonadoptionjourney.blogspot.com
story_txt:
$2 can be spent on so little....Our story is simple to us but we don't expect everyone to 
understand.  Chris and I, Leanne, always talked about adoption, even 
when we were dating.  See, it's not about rescuing a child from an 
orphanage and getting a pat on the back.  It's about seeing a need and 
meeting it with the desire we have to raise children.  We are able to 
conceive easily, we have two beautiful daughters, Haylee and Audrey.But
 it breaks our hearts to know that there are children who will not even 
have a chance at having a family.  We do not promote pulling a child out
 of their home, no matter the poverty.  A family should ALWAYS stay 
together.  We are going through an agency that is reputable in both 
countries because they only adopt out children who are truly orphans and
 they work hard in each country to promote and help inter-country 
adoption and to sustain and grow healthy families.  The goal is to build
 healthy families around the world....and even if they are not healthy 
due to poverty, it is still not a reason to deem those child "orphans." 
 Orphans are the children who have been abandoned, whose 
parents have died, who are given up because the parent(s) knows they 
cannot care for them and it was their decision to make, or, in many 
cases, the child is a result of rape and the mom feels it is too painful
 to keep that baby.God doesn't look at genes.  Over and over He 
speaks of adopting us as His own.  He loves us like He loves His Son, 
Jesus Christ, when we choose to accept His gift of forgiveness, grace 
and mercy and redemption He offered us by Jesus' death on the cross and 
resurrection.  He writes to us that there is no longer a difference 
between Jew and Gentile, we are all loved equally when we become His 
children. I am that Gentile who is loved, thank you Jesus. So,
 in faith, recognizing that adoption is a beautiful, hard, long, forever
 journey, we are trusting and already feel that our next two children, 
one adopted from Haiti and one from Ethiopia, will have just as much a 
place in our hearts and home as our two daughters.  We tell people often
 that God has placed this so much on our minds and hearts that it is 
more normal for us to plan our family in this way than to get pregnant 
with our next two.  We have seen other friends choose this same path and
 we know that God has directed us to do the same.Why two?  Well, 
the journey started with just one adoption from Ethiopia two years ago.

of need are covered.We are doing as much as we can on a youth

story:
Short Summary

My name is Erin Brioso, and I am the current President of Making Lives Better at Rollins College in Winter Park, Florida. Making Lives Better the organization is a family. It's my family, and it's a family all over the world. Whether it's Nepal or our own backyard in Orlando, our greatest desire is to do just what our name suggests-- but specifically in the capacities of Health and Education. I have been involved with MLB since my first year at Rollins in 2010. 

Making Lives Better, also known as MLB, was founded in 2009 as a student led service organization at Rollins College. Its mission is to improve the lives of people in rural communities around the world in the impact areas of Health and Education. Our vision is of a world where access to health and educational resources are the solution to better lives. Over the past four of years MLB has maintained its focus on Nepal and we are planning to have our fourth service trip in the summer of 2014. In those 4 years we have raised over $75K with the generous support of our college. But we cannot continue to rely on our incredible school to help us achieve our goals. We need YOUR help. 

Having reached over 4,000 people in four years, we believe that our Health Camps, Educational Outreaches, and Water Purification projects (Mission Aqua) are imperative to the quality of life for many people throughout Nepal. 

This campaign is meant to fund the majority of our Educational Outreach. Every year at Rollins we hold 3 large fundraisers, but that simply is not enough anymore. Over the last four years our educational efforts have increased school enrollments by 30 % and reduced incidence of water-borne disease affecting children in a significant way. Your contributions would effectively help us sponsor 5 orphaned girls to be able to attend school, as well as provide a year's worth of school supplies as well as improvements in technology equipment at a Public Primary school in a rural village in Nepal. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000 to effectively reach our goals for this years Educational Outreach Project! We will be sponsoring 5 orphaned girls school tuition and housing for the year. We need exactly $5,000 to do this. The "Sponsored a Future..." donors are absolutely essential for this.  

Horace Mann is known as the "Father of Education" in the United States. He was an Educational reformist, and he is responsible for establishing a Public School system in America. The "Horace Mann" donor is of critical importance to our endeavors because like he argued, "access to a Public Education is a nation's best way to ensure a society of disciplined judicious, active citizens."

Unfortunately, if we do not meet our goals for the Educational Outreach projects we will be unable to achieve the full potential for contributing to the status of Education in Nepal over our 3 week service trip. Many people are opposed to the idea that people should interfere with the status of other nations development-- and we see that point. We are not doing that at all, we are simply assisting people in rural Nepal to have a better chance at achieving their own full potential-- and the way to do that is through a good education and the means by which they can achieve that. 

 

The Impact

In the past four years that Making Lives Better has existed, we have reached over 1,000 people in rural villages in Nepal, raised over $75K to achieve our endeavors, as well as sharing meals, perspectives, culture, and love to countless people. Having now established 3 other branches of MLB at colleges around the United States, we feel the only place to go from here is up! Our goal is to keep assisting to provide better access to Health and Educational resouces to people in rural communities around the world in order to make lives better. You can be apart of that. You can make a difference-- even if it's by spreading the word. Every child and adult deserves a trip to the dentist or a general physician, and every human being deserves access to clean water; every child deserves to receive an education-- no matter the circumstance.

This project is valuable to you, the contributor because it only takes one person to make a difference. Whether its through a simple smile, a word of encouragement, or through a monetary donation-- you can be the one to make a difference. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! A huge way that you can help is by spreading our story and inspiring your friends, family, and even passerby's to donate or get involved in some capacity. 

Please look toward the Indiegogo sharing tools for more information on how to help! Or contact Making Lives Better directly at Makinglivesbetter9@gmail.com.

story:
Help Celebrate Community Resilience in Chicago!

WHEN:    November 1 through 3, 2013

WHERE:  Roosevelt University, Chicago

This November, Chicago will host its second annual Bioneers gathering! This three-day event will build a movement of visionaries and innovators working to address our biggest social and environmental issues with solutions inspired by nature. Attendees will engage with inspiring keynote speakers, interactive workshops, performing artists, local exhibitors and plenary sessions to Celebrate Community Resilience. 

Bioneers (biological + pioneers) believe that if humans follow nature’s organizing principles of kinship, cooperation, diversity, symbiosis and continuous cycles of creation we CAN solve our most pressing environmental and social challenges without harming our planet, and at the same time, foster equitable, just and democratic societies.

This year, we have invited an array of local and national speakers to inspire a local, grassroots movement.  Invited speakers include:

  • acclaimed author and ecologist Sandra Steingraber;
  • David Orr of the Oberlin Project;
  • Albert Bates of The Farm;
  • ecological history scholar John Michael Greer;
  • Ameena Matthews of the Interrupters and Cure Violence;
  • Gunther Hauk of Spikenard Farm Honeybee Sanctuary

Visit our website at www.bioneerschicago.org to see who else is participating and what they are bringing to our gathering!

We need you to help build this movement. By donating to our fundraising campaign, you are helping to bring these inspiring speakers to Chicago and igniting an ongoing movement for change.

What is Great Lakes Bioneers Chicago?   

Great Lakes Bioneers Chicago (GLBC) is a local, self-organized Bioneers group. To learn more about National Bioneers, visit their website.  

Our 2013 theme is Celebrating Community Resilence. As we are faced with increasing challenges and changes in the environment and society, we must develop adaptive capacities to not only survive, but thrive. We'll explore this topic through interactive workshops; panels; skill shares; the arts (including performing arts); and plenary sessions so our words are transformed into actions.

Who Is Making this Happen?

Our November gathering is being hosted by Eco-Justice Collaborative, Roosevelt University, Peace Productions and the Pierce Family Foundation. Our core planning committee is made up of a committed group of volunteers who believe that positive change is possible.

Why Support Us?

Our gathering will function as an oasis of hope that sparks mass creativity and engagement. By helping us cover the cost of producing the gathering, you will help us get the word out, sowing the seeds for a successful action-oriented movement. The November gathering will lead to the creation of an action plan that  not only identifies what can be done to make Chicago a more sustainable and just city, but also includes strategies for implementation, a time line, and person or organization responsible for making it happen.  This plan will be the blueprint for action in the coming year.

We are lowering our ticket price this year so more people will be able to participate in the gathering and creation of our action plan. We don't accept donations from organizations or corporations that don't share our mission and vision, so we are increasing our fundraising efforts from small donors like you. Your contributions will help us link individuals and organizations together in order to foster connection, cross-pollination, and collaboration of people and ideas - all focused on positive change.  

Get Connected!

  • Subscribe to our email list and receive periodic updates.
  • Visit our website.
  • Link to us on Facebook.
  • Follow us on Twitter (@chibioneers)

story:
OFFICER FIRED for STOPPING BEATING of Mentally-Challenged young man

We complain a LOT about "Where are the good cops?  Why aren't the good cops stopping the bad cops?"  Well ... here is one who did ...  PLEASE HELP!!!

Officer Regina Tasca who was with the Bogota Police Department in New Jersey, was called to help a mom with her Mentally-Challenged son.  Two back-up officers arrived from a different department, and began beating the boy.  Regina tried to pull them off of him and STOP the beat down.  The boy was taken to the hospital with cuts and bruises.  Regina was FIRED ... the other two officers were never even questioned.  She is suing ... and her legal bills are astronomical.  We can HELP!!

story:
Some residents of Vine City can still recall its glory days, back when businesses, schools, and church memberships thrived, and civil rights leaders, including the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr., called this place home. These days, however, the neighborhood faces high unemployment, drug problems, record foreclosure rates, and the after-effects of natural disasters, including a major flood and tornado.

But within this blighted community is a smaller community offering hope and healing to homeless and low-income individuals, including veterans. Located on Rock Street, Quest Community Development Organization (formerly known as Quest 35 Inc.),  was founded by Leonard Adams in 2001. The Gulf War veteran and former entrepreneur turned his talents to the nonprofit world when he realized the need to help chronically homeless and drug-addicted individuals in the area.

To date, his organization has assisted more than 4,000 individuals with supportive housing. Quest properties include renovated and new apartment buildings, a housing complex, and a two-story headquarter building on Rock Street, a tidy cul-de-sac off of Joseph E. Lowery Boulevard.

Among these safe havens is Quest Veterans Village, a 12-unit garden-style apartment building housing disabled veteran men and women. Two years after it opened in 2011, Adams took another look at the property and discovered its residents had no place to come together outdoors.

This fall, CL’s Do Good Campaign is teaming up with Adams’ nonprofit to create an outdoor gathering space for veterans, complete with seating and new plantings, including flowers and decorative grasses. Renovations will begin mid-fall and a volunteer day for planting is scheduled soon after the Thanksgiving holiday. As part of Creative Loafing’s Do Good Campaign — a series of grassroots partnerships with various local neighborhoods and nonprofits — the Atlanta-based news organization is working with Quest to raise $2,500 to help fund the greenspace project. Do Good sponsor the Home Depot Foundation will match donations dollar for dollar up to $2,500.

The resulting $5,000 will enable Quest Veterans Village to build a dedicated outdoor seating area and garden for residents. It will also honor the soldiers and their service as they re-establish themselves within a deserving Atlanta community.

Read more about this project on CLATL.com: Do Good Vine City!

story:
New updated link for anybody who wants to still donate to Jeffrey's statue.

http://www.youcaring.com/memorial-fundraiser/je...

Jeffrey is the five-year-old Toronto boy who died of pneumonia, septic shock and starvation at the hand of his maternal grandparents, who had been named his guardians. When he died 2 months before he was to turn six, he was a mere 21 pounds — about as much as he weighed on his first birthday.

Locked in his unheated room for up to 14 hours a day, left to sit in his own waste, deprived of food, made to feel worthless as a human being. Jeffrey was so severely starved, that in the last few days of his short life he didn't have the strength to lift his own head.  His siblings were conditioned to call him "pig" and he was forced to drink from the toilet. The last night of his life, he could be heard weeping before his suffering came to a tragic end.

Dr. Stanley Zlotkin, a leading researcher in paediatric nutrition at Toronto's Sick Children's Hospital who examined Jeffrey's body, testified that he was shocked at Jeffrey's condition and stated Jeffrey's case was "worse than anything I have ever seen in my research, or work in Africa.”

When Jeffrey was a toddler, before he was taken from his parents, he was very energetic and loved Superman, jumping off chairs trying to fly. Our mission is to raise funds in order to erect a life size bronze memorial statue in the image of Jeffrey wearing his Superman costume. 

Jeffrey's statue will be constructed in a manner to allow children to interact with. This will in a sense, allow children to play with Jeffrey, a neglected, abused child that was prevented from having any friends to play with himself during his short life. Jeffrey was a vulnerable little boy who deserved so much more than what he got.  Our statue will honour Jeffrey, a boy who never had a chance to grow up.

This memorial will become a centrepiece tribute within Greenwood Park, Toronto.  It will be a symbol to everyone about how important it is to be diligent about reporting suspected instances of child abuse to prevent another needless death such as Jeffrey's.

We hope that many of you who are made aware of this important project will be able to provide some financial assistance. All donations, be they of small or large amounts, will assist us in our mission of erecting a Memorial statue to honour forgotten, neglected children whose tiny voices went unheard.


Artist rendition of what Jeffrey's statue will appear as. Both Jeffrey and the bench will be in bronze. The entire monument will weigh over 700 lbs!


Who has been talking about us:
