story_txt: New updated link for anybody who wants to still donate to Jeffrey's statue.http://www.youcaring.com/memorial-fundraiser/je...Jeffrey is the five-year-old Toronto boy who died of pneumonia, septic shock and starvation at the hand of his maternal grandparents, who had been named his guardians. When he died 2 months before he was to turn six, he was a mere 21 pounds — about as much as he weighed on his first birthday.Locked in his unheated room for up to 14 hours a day, left to sit in his own waste, deprived of food, made to feel worthless as a human being. Jeffrey was so severely starved, that in the last few days of his short life he didn't have the strength to lift his own head.  His siblings were conditioned to call him "pig" and he was forced to drink from the toilet. The last night of his life, he could be heard weeping before his suffering came to a tragic end.Dr. Stanley Zlotkin, a leading researcher in paediatric nutrition at Toronto's Sick Children's Hospital who examined Jeffrey's body, testified that he was shocked at Jeffrey's condition and stated Jeffrey's case was "worse than anything I have ever seen in my research, or work in Africa.”When Jeffrey was a toddler, before he was taken from his parents, he was very energetic and loved Superman, jumping off chairs trying to fly. Our mission is to raise funds in order to erect a life size bronze memorial statue in the image of Jeffrey wearing his Superman costume.  Jeffrey's statue will be constructed in a manner to allow children to interact with. This will in a sense, allow children to play with Jeffrey, a neglected, abused child that was prevented from having any friends to play with himself during his short life. Jeffrey was a vulnerable little boy who deserved so much more than what he got.  Our statue will honour Jeffrey, a boy who never had a chance to grow up.This memorial will become a centrepiece tribute within Greenwood Park, Toronto.  It will be a symbol to everyone about how important it is to be diligent about reporting suspected instances of child abuse to prevent another needless death such as Jeffrey's.We hope that many of you who are made aware of this important project will be able to provide some financial assistance. All donations, be they of small or large amounts, will assist us in our mission of erecting a Memorial statue to honour forgotten, neglected children whose tiny voices went unheard.Artist rendition of what Jeffrey's statue will appear as. Both Jeffrey and the bench will be in bronze. The entire monument will weigh over 700 lbs!Who has been talking about us:http://toronto.ctvnews.ca/hundreds-donate-to-fundraising-effort-for-jeffrey-baldwin-statue-1.1646161http://www.ottawacitizen.com/news/national/Hundreds+strangers+donating+fundraising+effort+Jeffrey/9405362/story.htmlJeffrey's segment begins at 8:08http://www.cbc.ca/player/News/Canada/Ottawa/ID/2431021363/www.1310news.com/2014/04/24/talk-to-the-hand-ottawa-man-raises-funds-for-memorial/www.cbc.ca/metromorning/episodes/2014/01/08/commemorating-jeffrey/www.680news.com/2013/11/28/funds-being-raised-for-jeffrey-baldwin-bronze-statue/ www.citynews.ca/2013/12/04/ottawa-area-dad-trying-to-raise-25k-for-jeffrey-baldwin-statue/www.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/11/28/ottawa_area_man_raising_funds_for_jeffrey_baldwin_statue_in_greenwood_park.htmlwww.thestar.com/news/gta/2013/12/03/jeffrey_baldwin_memorial_tree_vandalized.htmlwww.insidetoronto.com/news-story/4298570-funds-being-raised-to-remember-the-life-of-jeffrey-baldwin/http://app.toronto.ca/tmmis/viewAgendaItemHistory.do?item=2014.PE25.6www.cfra.com/News/Ottawa-Regional-News/Carleton-Place-man-raises-money-for-tribute-to-Torwww.ottawasun.com/2014/01/09/ottawa-man-raising-funds-for-jeffrey-baldwin-statue

story:
SecondWindCottages.org // like us on Facebook

Frequently Asked Questions

Do you have questions about this project? Visit our FAQ page at secondwindcottages.org/faq to see answers to some common questions.


Homeless in Ithaca

Ithaca, NY is a small sophisticated and progressive city, but behind a few buildings downtown, the "Ithaca Jungle" was a continuous encampment of homeless men and women year-round for decades – until last Christmas.  Up until that point, Carmen Guidi was a self-made auto-body-shop owner living for himself in the Newfield hills and doing the "right thing" but not really caring for others. His life began to change as he read a book, went to Haiti, met a homeless man who committed suicide, then dedicated himself (and his finances) to giving the local homeless a place to live with dignity.

As the last 6 men in the Jungle became willing or desperate to leave that place in the deepening cold of winter, Carmen bought heated camping trailers one by one and hooked them up to water and electricity on his own land to give them housing. The Ithaca Jungle became empty just before Christmas 2012. Right now, all of those men are still living in the campers and Carmen relates to them as a friend. This year Carmen heard the call to build a village of tiny cottages, and he donated 7 acres of beautiful land behind his business (on the bus route) for that purpose.

The long-term vision of Second Wind Cottages is to build up to 18 tiny and separate 16x20' cottages in 3 phases to transition men from homelessness to renewed lives in the community. This fall the first 6 are being built. Volunteers and skilled professionals have rallied to get that done, and donations by local contractors and building suppliers have been generous and amazing!

We've raised $49,300 privately so far, but will need a total of $90,000 to $120,000 to finish the work. Local people, businesses, and churches are helping generously and we're working hard to finish the interiors by December 1st, but we need more help to finish the work.

As we launch this campaign, the Ithaca Jungle is almost empty again for the second winter in a row. That's a reflection of the new reality that 6 formerly long-term-homeless men are no longer among Ithaca's homeless.  We want to build these cottages as a transition and pathway out of homelessness... helping 6 men, then 6 more, and 6 more after that.

Phase One: Six Tiny Heated Cottages

Exteriors of 6 cottages are almost done and the interior work has begun.  They will feature:

  • a total living space of 16x20' including a full kitchen and bath
  • donated furniture which the men can take with them to their next apartment
  • one of the best views of the hills surrounding Ithaca (really, it's true)
  • (and after Phase II) a large "common building" for group events, recreation and laundry

The Vision: Homes and Friendship

Carmen first met the men of the Jungle by bringing them pizza and blankets, and the difference was he kept going back. As each man decided to accept it, Carmen helped some into medical care, some into rehab, some into regular apartments and jobs, and he kept investing in the relationships. Now those same men have begun to help each other.

The ultimate vision includes offering life-skills training, personal goal-setting, vocational and financial coaching, and open-ended 1-on-1 friendship. Each man is different, so each one will have a different path to health and progress. This is not a meant to be a program, it's a meant to be a relationship.

How You Can Help

We need funds now in order to finish the cottages by our target date of December 1st. With almost 100% donated labor, we estimate the cost of each cottage will be around $15,000 (with around $30,000 added to the total for environmental site work) — an amazing price for what'll be achieved in men's lives! Some lives have been saved from medical crises already!  We need your help to:

  • ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about this project
  • come to the worksite to help us build any Saturday (if you live near the Ithaca area)
  • give what you can financially to help buy materials

Together, we can end homelessness in Ithaca one life at a time.


Our "Thank You" Gifts


Local Artists help sponsor the Cottages

"Moon Flight" by Laura Petrisin, a gicleé print
(gift for the Wintertime Companions level of donations)

www.laurapetrisin.com

Laura is an artist/illustrator residing in upstate NY. Her paintings have been shown in art galleries, shops, and wineries across the Finger Lakes region of New York as well as in other regions and states. Her subject matter ranges from landscapes to wildlife to character portraits. She also loves book illustrating and has illustrated childrens’ books such as Poster Girl, published by Aboon Books and Pearl Girl, published by Penguin Readers.

"Island Beach State Park" by Janelle Tompkins, on canvas
(gift for the Waves of Compassion level of donations)

www.janelletompkins.com

Growing up in New York, Janelle pursued her artistic skills through private and group art lessons. She then studied at Tompkins Cortland Community College and the University of the Nations in Kona, Hawaii. She completed an Illustration Internship under local artist Christi Sobel. Janelle uses acrylic, oil, colored pencil, pen and ink and charcoal, with an interest in drawing nature and landscapes.

"Waiting for the Wind" by Benlin Alexander, on canvas
(gift for the Wind Beneath Our Wings level of donations)

www.benlinalexander.com

Benlin lives in Ithaca, NY and has recently opened his own professional illustration studio, working on children's books and various other commissions. In the summer of 2013 he worked at the Cornell Lab of Ornithology and is currently showing a collection of his work there.

story:
Matt and Janabai, both raw food chefs, met and fell in love in Santa Monica, California. After a head over heels affair based on a mutual appreciation for Gandhi and raw chocolate, they decided to open the aptly named Euphoria Loves Rawvolution café in Santa Monica (RAWvolution for short!)
 
In the seven years RAWvolution has been open, it has become so much more than a place for tasty, healthy food. It is a community hub, an activism center, a chocolate vortex, a haven in the big city, a conscious educational center, an inspirational catalyst for artists and writers, and a home for a community that might not otherwise have one.
 
We have helped thousands of people all around the world find a new way of living, one that helps them to remain youthful and full of energy, with the power and abundance inherent to raw, living foods. 
 
We've made buying local, organic produce, grown on family farms, and other green business practices top priorities. We were the first restaurant in Los Angeles, and possibly the world, to provide zero-waste packaging exclusively.
 
Now, we need your help!
 
Our landlord is trying to evict us.
 
He has been trying to replace RAWvolution with a corporate coffee chain, or whomever will pay the highest rent.
 
We've already raised money from our community, and need just $7,000 to fight the good fight for unique, independent business, green business practices, eco-conscious, compassionate food, and true community!
 
Other Ways You Can Help
 
Please get the word out about this campaign. Share it with anyone you know who is part of the community, or loves raw food.
 
Save Rawvolution IndieGoGo Campaign
http://www.indiegogo.com/save-rawvolution
 
Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign anyway you can. Let everybody know.
 
And of course, please join us for a meal! Bring your friends!
 
Hashtag your communcations about our campaign with #SaveRawvolution

story:
On October 27th, Montanna Durham and her dad Troy were in a terrible car accident caused by a drunk and drugged driver. Troy lost his life 2 days later because of his injuries and Montanna has endured major surgery to repair 4 broken vertabrae in her neck. She is currently on the spinal cord rehab floor of a local hospital working to recover.
   Montanna and her mom Michelle have been a source of strength for our entire community throughout this painful ordeal. The medical costs are expected to be a major burden and we, their friends, are doing everything we can to help.
   This is our chance to make a difference in their lives like they have made a difference in ours. Please consider making a donation to help out a beautiful, caring, and wonderful family.

story:
Families experiencing homelessness are similar to other, housed families living in poverty. In fact, many poor families – homeless or not – share similar characteristics: they are usually headed by a single woman with limited education, are usually young, and have high rates of domestic violence and mental illness. Some families living in poverty, however, fall into homelessness, usually due to some unforeseen financial challenge, such as a death in the family, a lost job, or an unexpected bill, creating a situation where the family cannot maintain housing. Homeless families comprise roughly 34% of the U.S. homeless population. In 2011, the Point-in-Time Homeless Count by the Austin Independent School District identified approximately 980 homeless families, which includes over 1,300 children. The counts are often lower than in realty, given the families that live temporarily in motels or doubled up in other’s homes. The typical sheltered homeless family is comprised of a mother in her late twenties with two children. 84% of homeless families are female-headed. Single parent families are among the poorest in the nation leaving them extremely vulnerable to homelessness. Minorities are overwhelmingly represented in the homeless population: 43% are African American, 15% are Hispanic, 8% are white and 3% are Native American.

Please help us in our efforts to make sure that this Thanksgiving is a memorable one for those less fortunate. Too often those of us that are privileged take for granted the everyday blessings and opportunities that many others don’t have or have lost in today’s tough economic times.

We are planning to raise money to buy groceries and prepare hot meals that will be delivered to highly populated homeless areas and to the doors of poverty stricken families located in the East Austin area.

story:
Hello! My name is Anita Parker, and I became a raw vegan chef as a way to help the members of my community, learn ways to thrive in life, rather than just survive.

My goal is to teach, and empower others to take control of their health.

Fermented foods are known to be the key to a healthy digestive system and immunity. Studies show that kimchi is effective in fighting viral infections, reduces inflammation, and may be a potential cancer fighter.

The fermentation process multiplies the availability of the nutrients, and minerals in the kimchi. I use only the best organic produce from the local farmers, and markets.

I've been told even by local chefs, that my kimchi is the best they have tasted, and that it's tastier, and of a higher quality than the selection offered in our grocery stores.

I am so passionate about providing this to the community. It can help improve our residents health, and also supports the local farmers.

Blessings to anyone who can help me with funding to obtain the necessary permits, and licenses to be able to prepare this kimchi, and put it on the market.

It will be helpful to people struggling with auto-immune issues, and inflammation, a major cause of disease.

What I need is:

$350 to rent commercial kitchen space to produce a batch

$400 for liability insurance

$500 for Fl. Dept of Agriculture permit to market fermented food

$450 for the batch test  

Once I meet these goals, and obtain the permit, I will have your gifts to you within two weeks. You will see for yourself how tasty, and beneficial this natural probiotic is!

Kimchi also enables us to have protection by eating God-given food, rather than resorting to pills purchased in the store. Life begets life. : )

If you don't want to contribute financially, I'd be ever so grateful if you would " like" my campaign, and also, " like" my website to help give it more visibility! Thank you so much!! I will be eternally grateful.  : )  I will include all supporters in my nightly reiki blessings.  xoxo

story:
Many Thanks to each Contributor!

There's still time to help FIC go from grunge to GREEN in 2013.

Either mail a check to:

FIC Green Office
RR 1 , Box 156
Rutledge MO 36536

               or

 
Visit http://www.ic.org/in/donate.php.

Thanks, 

The FIC board and staff

<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>

Making the Shift from Grunge to Green

FIC has been in the business of promoting cooperative culture for 25 years. The first decade we operated out of Board members' bedrooms and "virtual" offices. Then a supportive group donated an unused house trailer. We hauled that to Sandhill Farm and set it up as our first permanent office. For the last 15 we've made do with that flimsy '70s era facility that's bitter cold in January and sweltering hot in July. Enough is enough.

Last year the Board made the commitment to establish decent working conditions for our growing operations, and our first choice is to relocate to Dancing Rabbit, a thriving ecovillage of 70 adults on the way to hundreds, located just three miles away. As one of the foremost ecovillages in the world, Dancing Rabbit is effectively creating a truly sustainable village! Read stats here on the dramatic resource use reduction: http://www.dancingrabbit.org/resource-use-average-american-vs-dancing-rabbit-2011.

                   CLICK TO WATCH THE VIDEO >                               

               

 

Why does FIC need a new office? The old one is falling apart, very difficult to maintain decent working conditions, and barely protects our inventory.


The new energy-efficient, Green building we aspire to construct will have many advantages:

  • much larger pool of prospective staff.
  • more convenient for staff to do short shifts, which translates to more prompt service (a short walk instead of a three-mile bike ride).
  • synergistic visits: people coming to DR will also get to see FIC; people drawn to FIC will get DR as a bonus (and DR already gets hundreds of visitors each year!)
  • possibility of office interns who can readily find temporary housing at DR. This will help us undertake special projects economically while at the same time bring new blood into the organization.
  • better organization of resource files.
  • better preservation of materials.
  • meeting space for FIC Board and staff.
  • much better atmosphere control=better staff morale.

Here's our budget

Expenses
800 square foot energy efficient office with furnishings         $90,000

Income
Indiegogo campaign                                                     $45,000*
Major donors support & Foundation Grants                         $45,000

If everyone who's contacted us for information about cooperative living in the last 25 years gives only $1 each, we'll make our goal for this campaign.

*NOTE: It is fine for us to exceed this goal and we're happy to share more perks if we decide to keep raising more of the funds through this campaign!

 

What You'll Get...

Over the last quarter century FIC has proven our ability to promote community and provide a hungry public with up-to-date and comprehensive information about who's doing what and where. Now we need your help to keep helping you and all those who will follow, looking for cooperative alternatives. 

For supporting this campaign, you'll receive some of that inspiration and information as our gift, including...

               

 

      ...and more!  View more perks over here ----->

        If we're successful, FIC will have the greenest          
                   building in the state of Missouri! 

                YOUR green today will help make
                   OUR green possible tomorrow.

 

Simple ways to help if you don't have $ to share!

  • Can't give a donation? Use the share tools below to spread the word.
  • Help us get the word out! Share on facebook, email, on your blog. Every little bit helps!

<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>

IF YOU DO NOT WISH TO MAKE AN ONLINE DONATION, PLEASE MAIL YOUR CHECK TO: 

Fellowship for Intentional Community 
RR 1 Box 156-W
Rutledge MO 63563-9720
story_txt:
Many Thanks to each Contributor!
There's still time to help FIC go from grunge to GREEN in 2013. 
Either mail a check to:
FIC Green OfficeRR 1 , Box 156Rutledge MO 36536
               or 
 Visit http://www.ic.org/in/donate.php.
Thanks, 
The FIC board and staff
<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>
Making the Shift from Grunge to Green
FIC has been in the business of promoting cooperative culture for 25 years. The first decade we operated out of Board members' bedrooms and "virtual" offices. Then a supportive group donated an unused house trailer. We hauled that to Sandhill Farm and set it up as our first permanent office. For the last 15 we've made do with that flimsy '70s era facility that's bitter cold in January and sweltering hot in July. Enough is enough.
Last year the Board made the commitment to establish decent working conditions for our growing operations, and our first choice is to relocate to Dancing Rabbit, a thriving ecovillage of 70 adults on the way to hundreds, located just three miles away. As one of the foremost ecovillages in the world, Dancing Rabbit is effectively creating a truly sustainable village! Read stats here on the dramatic resource use reduction: http://www.dancingrabbit.org/resource-use-average-american-vs-dancing-rabbit-2011.
                   CLICK TO WATCH THE VIDEO >                               
               

 
Why does FIC need a new office? The old one is falling apart, very difficult to maintain decent working conditions, and barely protects our inventory.
The new energy-efficient, Green building we aspire to construct will have many advantages:

much larger pool of prospective staff.
more convenient for staff to do short shifts, which translates to more prompt service (a short walk instead of a three-mile bike ride).
synergistic visits: people coming to DR will also get to see FIC; people drawn to FIC will get DR as a bonus (and DR already gets hundreds of visitors each year!)
possibility of office interns who can readily find temporary housing at DR. This will help us undertake special projects economically while at the same time bring new blood into the organization.
better organization of resource files.
better preservation of materials.
meeting space for FIC Board and staff.
much better atmosphere control=better staff morale.

Here's our budgetExpenses800 square foot energy efficient office with furnishings         $90,000IncomeIndiegogo campaign                                                     $45,000*Major donors support & Foundation Grants                         $45,000If everyone who's contacted us for information about cooperative living in the last 25 years gives only $1 each, we'll make our goal for this campaign.
*NOTE: It is fine for us to exceed this goal and we're happy to share more perks if we decide to keep raising more of the funds through this campaign!
 
What You'll Get...
Over the last quarter century FIC has proven our ability to promote community and provide a hungry public with up-to-date and comprehensive information about who's doing what and where. Now we need your help to keep helping you and all those who will follow, looking for cooperative alternatives. 
For supporting this campaign, you'll receive some of that inspiration and information as our gift, including...
               
 
      ...and more!  View more perks over here ----->

                YOUR green today will help make                    OUR green possible tomorrow.

story:
Welcome to Silicon Allee

Who are we?

We are Silicon Allee, the only independent and community-driven tech news source in Berlin, and Germany's biggest startup network.

We are an organic and authentic part of a scene which we helped create - and at our core we have: 

  • Editorial independence
  • Authenticity
  • Quality journalism
  • Outstanding content
  • Berlin's most valuable international network of high influencers

There is no company behind us; we are organically grown and completely community-driven. Think of us as the PBS or BBC of the tech media in Germany.

What do we want to achieve?

We want to expand – to become bigger and better and provide more community- and business-orientated benefits.

Why are you running a crowdfunding campaign?

As an independent English-language tech news site in Germany, we are fulfilling a major need. Startup people, be they entrepreneur, investor, programmer or marketing guru, need to be able to read, discuss and disseminate ideas and the latest innovations in a language they understand. As most foreigners who come to Berlin trying to get their business off the ground do not speak German, we have made it our mission to make the market more easily accessible for them.

How will we accomplish our goals?

We want to invest in our editorial team to find the hottest new journalistic talent, expand our coverage and reach more people with what is happening in the startup scene in Berlin and across Germany every single day. This will include exploring the ever-growing connections between Berlin's lifestyle scene and the tech community.

We will also work with our partners in education and event-hosting to help push one of the world's fastest-growing startup hubs.

What do we want from you?

We need more resources to realise our ambitions and help support the tech community in Germany to an even greater degree! The money we raise in this campaign will help us improve our platform as we implement a sustainable business model including ad sales, sponsorships, custom networking events and PR/media consultancy which will allow us to maintain our independence in the long run. Specifically, we are looking for funding for the following:

  • €7,500 for expanding and improving our editorial team

We want to discover the best freelance content out there. The money will be invested into a six-month program to fund content from professional sources, both up-and-coming and experienced, to give a new take on the tech and startup scene in Berlin and Germany. This program will give us the chance to not only introduce some fresh voices, but to plan ahead for the expansion of our full-time editorial team later this year. 

  • €7,500 for diversifying our event schedule

Following on from the success of our original breakfast meet up and other events – including a major international hackathon – we want to establish bigger and better events, something which needs more resources. We need the funding to secure the coolest venues, hire the biggest DJs and cater for our guests in the best way possible. The goal is to put on an extra event a month for a year using this money.

  • €5,000 for a comprehensive, regularly updated Berlin startup directory

Everything will be in here - the companies, the people, the deals. In addition, this section will include a series of How To guides for entrepreneurs. This directory will provide a vital one-stop source of information which many people in Berlin and across Germany have repeatedly been asking for. The money will be spent on logging and checking the information, writing the directory copy and programming and hosting the site. 

  • €5,000 to build a unique startup job network

This will include improving and fostering links between the many universities in Berlin and the digital industry to tap into the enormous student pool of talent, as well as establishing and promoting job fairs not only for students but for everyone involved in startups.

Background 

We founded Silicon Allee in February 2011 as a way of bringing together people from Berlin's startup scene, which was then just beginning to blossom. Starting out as a monthly meet up, we quickly saw the need for an English-language tech blog from Berlin, about Berlin. After all, how could people around the world discover what was happening here if all the coverage was in German?

Four months later, we launched the Siliconallee.com website, and since then we have been a uniquely independent tech community in Berlin. After sourcing a small amount of starting-up investment, we are still almost completely owned by our original founders and remain committed to our organically-built community.

Our Editor-in-Chief is David Knight, a born-and-bred Londoner who has lived in Berlin since 2006. He has worked for major online German news portals including Bild.de, where he helped set up and run innovative Second Life-based publication The AvaStar and English-language platform Bild.com, and Spiegel International. His background in both traditional British newspapers and modern online publishing, together with his extensive experience of Berlin and what makes it tick, gives him a unique perspective when it comes to the growing tech scene in the city.

Since we started, Silicon Allee has become a byword for the Berlin startup scene outside of Germany - hence we have attracted much media attention from outlets including Berliner Morgenpost, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Le Monde, Swedish Radio, Deutschland Radio Wissen, WDR, Monocle, Die Welt, Bild, Spiegel and many more. 

And it's not just Silicon Allee that the world is sitting up and taking note of - many of the startups which we have helped to find an audience have gone on to make a name for themselves on a global scale, mirroring Berlin as it continues its progress towards becoming a genuine world city.

Companies like SoundCloud, EyeEm, UPcload, twago and Vamos may be in different stages of development, but they all form part of Berlin's future; a future which is distinctly digital.

And Germany is starting to sit up and take notice. The country's President, Joachim Gauck, joined the Mayor of Berlin Klaus Wowereit on a tour of the Factory, a tech hub currently under construction alongside the former route of the Berlin Wall, and where Silicon Allee already has its headquarters. German Chancellor Angela Merkel and her deputy, Philipp Rösler, have also pledged their support to the emerging digital economy.

Things are getting better - but Berlin has plenty of growing to do as a tech hub. As a loudspeaker telling the world about what's going on here, we are helping to bring in investors and attention from Silicon Valley, New York, London and elsewhere.

Sounds great - what perks are you offering to supporters?

There are five different incentives for you to donate to our campaign:

€40 - a free coffee at our next monthly breakfast meet up and entrance to an exclusive post-crowdfunding event if we meet our target

€100 - a limited edition Silicon Allee Supporter t-shirt

€500 - sponsorship at one of Silicon Allee's highly successful breakfast meet ups

€2,000 - an exclusive sponsorship of our next special evening meet up

€5,000 - both the previous sponsorships plus get YOUR logo on our site for 3 months

Whether you put in €5 or €5,000, we value your help.

We really appreciate any support you can give us - please help us spread the word by sharing news of this campaign!

story:
Indiegogo Project - Thestockpur(Suit).com

We are trying to raise 50K so that we can “kick” start our 5 year plan.

Our five year plan is to move our family to our dream house and location. In order to do this we are going to invest in our investment strategy Thestockpur(Suit).com

By investing in this Indiegogo project you will receive the same report that we are going to use to grow 50K into 400K in 5 years. If you chose to invest along with us then you will be able to reach your financial goals as well.

I am asked every day why are you not investing in your own report? The answer is very simple, in order to invest you need to have enough capital. As the provider for 4 children and my stay at home wife, there is no money left at the end of the month to invest.

Using my own stock strategy I would be able to be financially independent in 5 years if I had only 50K capital to start with.

For an entire year I blogged about what stocks I would purchase, hold or sell each day for the year. The blog is located here thestockpursuit.wordpress.com

Over the year I was able to achieve a 27.7% return

Getting a return like this would allow many to be independently wealthy in only a few years.

The year previous to that I made 43.8% but did not blog about each daily transaction.

I will supply by e-mail every open (Nasdaq, and NYSE) Market day, the report that I created and use, as well as all the related numbers to my current performance so that you can see exactly how the strategy is working for me. Proof is in the pudding! Everyone believes that money can be made in the stock market but few know how, investing/pledging in this Indiegogo you will see exactly how I am performing in the marketplace as well as getting an in depth look at exactly how I am making money in the market. 

On our website thestockpursuit.com we sell the report for $19.95 per year so you are getting access to this for a fraction by investing in this Indiegogo project.

Everyone believes that money can be made on the stock market! On the other hand I don't believe that many people know how to make money on the stock market! This opportunity will allow you access to see exactly how money can be made, and this will shed light on exactly how.

*For every $50 that you pledge to our project, you will get an entry to a draw that we will hold at the end of the 5 years, where we will give back the $50,000 to one lucky supporter of our project. 

 

 

 

 

 


*The project needs to achieve 100% of the pledge amount and we need to achieve our goal of $400,000 within 5 years for the draw to take place.

story:
Hello Friends and Family of Vince Hannay

My name is Rachel Sanchez and I am a friend of Vince and his Mother Lynne. It has been amazing to see how many people have come together to show their love and support during this difficult time.

As most of you know, Vince was in a plane crash on Monday August 13th and is currently in critical condition in Kelowna. His mother Lynne, along with other close friends and family have been tirelessly at his side while he goes through his surgeries and remains in induced coma.

What We Need 

We are hoping to raise $10000 dollars for Lynne and Vincent. This money will go towards any expenses incurred by this tragic event including but not limited to Lynne's travel and accommodation to Kelowna, costs related to Vincent's care and recovery as well as any other specific needs Vincent and his family may have.

The Impact

Sadly, I know all too well the emotional, financial and psychological impact a tragedy of this magnitude can have on a person and their family. Vincent was a very close friend of my husband who passed away in a motor vehicle accident in 2006. My brother who was also in the accident, was placed in critical condition and spent weeks in hospital. I was fortunate to have people like Lynne and Vincent during this time as they both made substantial efforts to support our families and help my brother pull through.

By providing some financial support for Vincent, it will allow Lynne and the rest of Vincent's family to focus more on what matters the most - helping Vincent get better.

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating money is not a possibly at this time, you can also help by spreading the word as much as you can to others who you believe would like to contribute.

Every contribution, positive thought and encouraging message makes a difference. 

Thank you and much love to Vincent.

story:
The Keith B. Hayes Foundation was created to honor and memorialize Keith, who passed away on September 14th, 2007 at the age of 20 due to a progressive muscular/skeletaldisease and to continue his spirit of giving to others in need.

As of October, 2012 - we are pleased to now be able to provide funds to help Dr. Salvatore DiMauro with Columbia University Medical Center, New York, NY to support his research on the specific and extremely rare genetic disorder which afflicted Keith. Hopefully, in the future, this research by Dr. DiMauro and others will be able to help treat individuals with this same condition.

In addition, The Keith B. Hayes Foundation will award an annual scholarship to a student at Ramapo College of New Jersey who has similar medical and physical challenges as Keith.

Also, ongoing grants will be awarded to organizations providing support to those who are facing physical challenges:

The Rockland Independent Living Center, Nanuet NY provides advocacy and leadership in the creation and development of an accessible and integrated community for people with disablities, so that they may pursue lifestyles of their choice - and recognizes Keith each year with The Keith B. Hayes Memorial Spirit of Mentoring Award.

The Children's Cardiomyopathy Foundation (CCF) is a national, non-profit organization focused on pediatric cardiomyopathy, a chronic disease of the heart muscle. CCF is dedicated to accelerating the search for cures while improving diagnosis, treatment, and quality of life for children affected by cardiomyopathy.

The Wheelchair Foundation, CA is a non-profit organization with a goal to provide a free wheelchair to every child, teen and adult worldwide who needs one, but has no means to acquire one.

We thank you and all who will benefit from the Keith B. Hayes Foundation thank you as well.

Sincerely,

Sheila, Sadler, Adam and Brian Hayes

The Keith B. Hayes Foundation | A component fund of the Community Foundation of Orange and Sullivan

www.TheKeithBHayesFoundation.org

The Community Foundation of Orange and Sullivan is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. All gifts are tax deductible under current tax laws. The Community Foundation can be reached by calling 845-769-9393

www.CFOC-NY.ORG

story:
-”Retreat? Hell! We’re not retreating; we’re just advancing in a different direction!”

                                                                                                                      -Oliver P Smith

                For those not wanting to read the entire blog post here is the short and bitter sweet of it.  Due to ongoing difficulty in a medical diagnosis coupled with increasing medical bills and the fact that I have been out of work for a prolonged period of time, the walk across the United States is going to have to be cancelled.  I am still walking 3000 miles, however, I am just going to do it in smaller micro walks of 1-3 day excursions.  Due to all of this unraveling right at the start I am going to issue refunds to everyone who sent me monetary contributions this coming week. I encourage all of you to donate that money to Child’s Play.  Thank you all for your support and no one is more disappointed in the way things have transpired than I am.  Please keep an eye on this website in the coming few weeks for a complete overhaul detailing my “reinvention.”  If you want a more drawn out explanation please keep reading.

     I write this on Easter morning.  So to everyone who celebrates Easter I wish you a joyous day.  I would also like to share with any fans of the Alien franchise out there who also happen to enjoy Easter this…

                I said I was not going to do medical updates anymore but this post requires at least a small addition in order to support the context. My MRI scans came up mostly well. There is nothing insidious lurking within that I need to be imminently worried about.  They did show two things which could help explain some of my symptoms. The big one is the discs in my spinal column show signs of degeneration.  It is too early to start screaming “Degenerative Disc Disease!” but it does run in my family.  Both my mother and father have had spinal surgery due to disc issues.  This can be hereditary and most often is the result of the spine not being aligned properly.  So I am off to see a chiropractor.

      I also have cysts in my sinus cavity which could be causing the headaches I have been getting.  Hopefully some anti-inflammatory and allergy medications will knock that out in a few weeks.  We are still suspicious of Lyme as it can be hard to tack down as a solid diagnosis and as such I am being referred to another specialist. Of course seeing specialists requires long waits and the soonest I can get in is two weeks away.  I have stated before I am not good at waiting so I am done doing so. It is time to officially cancel the walk across the United States and come up with a new plan, which it turns out I already have.

                I am going to be honest in that this idea was not my own.  Both my mother-in-law, Marlene, and the Canadian Crusader, Brandon, suggested the idea of “micro walks.” I am still going to walk 3000 miles.  I am just not going to be able to do it all in one go. A micro walk will be a 1-3 day trip planned in advance.  The trips will be things like a few days on the Appalachian Trail, or drive to New York and walk Long Island.  I am going to have a counter up on the main page that I shall tick down from 3000 until I reach zero.  It is not quite my dream but I am excited about many of the possibilities that these micro walks bring.  I could bring Elika, or other people who would like to take a walking trip.  I know of one person at least who would jump at the chance for a few days on the AT… Andrew I am looking at you.

                So I am going to revise my website in the coming weeks with as many of these micro walks as I can.  I already have over a dozen or so floating around in my skull.  It pains me that the walk across the US had to end in such fashion but I am not going to allow myself to wallow in it.  I know it did not even get off the ground, but the months I had planning it were some of the best in my life and there is no reason I cannot just keep doing so, I just need to change my pace a bit. Thank you everyone who has supported me, I truly mean it.

story:
Short Summary

We are traveling to Bulawayo, Zimbabwe to prepare a place for 20 orphans by repairing and refurbishing existing structures and building new facilities to house and care for these orphans.

  • Hello, my name is Ian Cotton and I am a registered PE in electrical engineering in the state of Washington.
  • In the nation of Zimbabwe there is much poverty, disease and crime that marginalizes and threatens the well being of orphaned children.  This project seeks to create a model orphanage for the nation of Zimbabwe.
  • Reaching my funding goal will purchase my airfare and ground transportation to this remote site.  Anything above my goal will go towards construction materials and equipment for the bakery.
  • The land is in a protected trust that prevents it from being sold, or used for other purposes than that of housing and providing for orphans.  We will be working with Aglow International of Zimbabwe on this project.

Help me reach my goal and impact the nation of Zimbabwe by providing a home for 20 children and countless others on into the future!

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the details of what this money will go towards and how it will be spent for my trip from September 11-27.

  • The goal is to make this site safe and secure for children, while also providing for their food requirements and making the site finacially self-sustaining.  Your contribution will:
    • Pay for my travel expenses to the site outside of rural Bulawayo, Zimbabwe.  Any extra finds will help finance the following.
    • Repair the abandoned buildings on site and make them suitable for habitation.
    • Secure the site to make it safe for children and protect them from being kidnapped and sold into slavery.
    • Provide equipment for the bakery and purchase livestock and seed for planting.
  • As a contributor to this project you will not only have the gratitude of the generations of children who will find a home here, but as an amatuer photographer I will be chronicalling the trip on film.  Every contributor will be recieving a unique photograph of the Zimbabwe landscape or people.  Please let me know what your interests are!
  • Any funds recieved will go towards funding my travel expenses even if the goal is not reached.

The Impact

This is not just an orphanage we are building, but a model for future orphanages in all of Zimbabwe!

  • By contributing to this project, you are funding the future for not just the 20 orphans that will be initially housed, raised, fed and educated on this site, but there is the potential that this orphanage will become the template for future facilities.  Help us complete this project with excellence!
  • I work in the construction industry and have done work with Africa in the past.  In 2008 I performed repairs on the PV system of an island orphanage on Lake Victoria.
  • I will be travelling with a group from my church, Sonrise Christian Center, and the group leader has been in Zimbabwe and worked with these people on 3 previous occations. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know we are living in hard times.  No contribution is too small, even the donation of $1 will have an impact.  Jesus said that the widow at the temple gave more with her two small mites, than all the rich men of the temple (Mark 12:43).

  • If you are unable to contribute financially, please pray for the Lords provision, protection and blessing on this project.
  • Please feel free to share this cause with others and get the word out.

Whew, thank you for reading all of that information and for responding in prayer to this request.  Be blessed and thank you again for your patience and grace.

story:
Our Story

Guru Signal is a local, crowd based, IT solution. We connect consumers to local IT professionals through the web. The whole thing will be free to consumers and technicians and we will only take a small portion of profit to cover operating costs and monetary guarantees on hardware loss/damage.

Consumers get cheap, fast, local, service that they wont have to pay for if it doesn't fix the problem, and technicians will get a trusting consumer base and a wage significantly higher than at a big-box retailer.

We will background check and verify credentials for all of our technicians guaranteeing that consumers are safe and in good hands. Service will only cost 30$ for a house call plus 30$ for every hour required past the first 30 min.

My name is Chance Wees and I am a Programmer, Game Designer/Developer, and Entrepreneur. I had the idea for this service about 2 weeks ago and I thought it sounded good enough to make a reality. The team from my game studio and I are working on the web service and website which we hope to have ready for deployment within 45 days.


The Impact

Our goal is to get people in touch with the help they need immediately for a low realistic price and get our contractors the contracts they need and a decent wage. We will be the anti-big box repair shop. We will give our contractors the vast majority of the money all the while guaranteeing competance and safety. Why? Because it's the right thing to do, and hell, maybe we can still make money.


What We Need & What You Get

We need at 10000$ to cover initial costs. This includes website creation (we're not designers), funds to buy some office supplies required for business logistics, and some initial capital to back our guarantees and cover local advertising. You'll get a myriad of different rewards for your contributions ranging from a simple thank you on our website and discounted service, to partial company ownership or Free Service for Life!


Other Ways You Can Help

We are really excited about this idea and we hope that you will be too. We hope to vastly improve the lives of local contractors and maybe save some people from the heartache of computer failure. Please tell all of your friends about Guru Signal. Get the web-o-verse thumping. Let's let people know there is a better alternative to Big Box computer repair and that it will be here soon. The quicker we can get the service up and running here in our local test bed the sooner we can unleash it world-wide.

story:
We've decided to refund the money to all the contributors and close the campaign. This campaign was not successful in raising funds to pay for the legal fees for the lawsuit filed below. But we did raise some awareness on the issue and sparked conversations.



Stay tuned: http://www.ustream.tv/urbandrones

story:
My name is Sandy Foster. I've been doing photography since shortly after 8th grade when I bought my first camera. I love the more candid aspect over the more posed photography. I love taking candid over more posed to capture the emotion of the moment, to catch those moments of life that are all to often passed by and beauty in nature.  I use both film and digital cameras with a special love of working in the dark room.

In short, my campaign is to bring the joy we find in life to others through candid photography. If it's a picture of my family, pets, or vacation I'd put on my wall, a t-shirt, the fridge or a mug, I want my customers to feel the same way. I also want to provide options to individuals and businesses who like to change up what's on their walls to "rent" artwork for a change every so often or if an area needs staging. I also would like to use my film and dark room knowledge to bring this dying art to bring this joy to others

Contributors will help me realize a dream of my own while I help others realize their dreams of artwork and family memories. It's been said, “Life is not measured but the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away." This is what I try to capture with my photography of people, places, events, and pets. Help me bring these little joys into the lives of others.

I need $2500 in funding to go towards my first year's subscription for my online gallery, the "Not Your Normal Photography" business course, my Merchant Retail license, to begin building inventory  of prints, gifts and framed artwork for the renting crowd.

I have a few different perks. The lower levels have different size prints. Middle levels have a couple package options, including poster and canvas sizes for several upper level perks.

If I don't reach my entire goal, funds will start paying towards my online gallery, Merchant license, business course, then inventory. Anything above and beyond funds needed will also help add to inventory and other equipment and supplies, such as backdrops and stands, lighting systems, dark room equipment, etc,


My campaign will help me connect with people desiring photos of family, friends, pets, events and places that are different than traditional portrait work and open new places to others through my own personal travels that I want to share with others. Through an online gallery, I will be able to share my work with a wider audience that would allow me to share my work with others and for them to share ideas with me to create more artwork. My campaign will also allow me to connect with people that would have an interest in learning to work with film, developing film and prints themselves in their environments.

I have taken photos for weddings, engagement photos, a Quincenera, as well as other portraits for friends with disabilities. I love to capture people "in the moment". I have taken courses in developing film and prints as well as other dark room work.

Can't contribute financially? That's ok. Please contribute by spreading the word about my campaign. Pass the info along by word of mouth, e-mail, social media and/or the Indiegogo share tools. Heck, use them all if you'd like!!! Let's get the ball rolling on this.

story:
The Swag!   (you will be emailed about size and style after donating) 




What is Revelry?

Revelry Brewing Company is Charleston's newest addition to the rapidly growing craft beer scene.  Three guys came together, each with unique strengths and experience, with a plan to produce beer that takes an experimental approach to style with an emphasis on consumer education.  We've worked hard to achieve this dream for over 2 years, invested all our spare time and savings and managed to obtain a government backed SBA loan (holy hell, that was difficult).  Now, we have an excellent indoor/outdoor venue near downtown Charleston, a functioning 10BBL brewhouse, and are blessed to have some awesome friends and family that have helped us along the way!

Beer isn't just yellow fizz anymore and today's consumer is more discerning and engaged in their selections.  We plan to blur the lines with respect to established styles and brewing methods and provide an educational platform in which even the most novice beer drinker feels comfortable discussing beer.  We hope our patrons leave the brewery with a new found appreciation and knowledge for what craft beer options exist in today's market.


However, opening a brewery comes with a hefty price tag.  Because we have done this all on our own (to this point) through our savings and a small business loan, we are left with a longer list of necessities than we have cash to support.  We hope that any of you that are passionate about beer and pushing the limits of what is available in your community will consider becoming a supporter of this special cause.  We are a brewery for the community with intention of being a platform for advocacy, fundraising (non-profit), collaboration and education.


Your contributions will not only validate our mission and your desire for more options, it'll ultimately help us reach our goal of being an anchor in the Charleston area and supporter of the "little guy with big ideas!"


What We Need & Why

For a brewery to function through the logistical process of wort in, beer out, certain equipment is needed to facilitate a smooth process while maintaining high quality standards.  With your help, we plan to purchase the following additional equipment:


DME 4-head Keg washer/Filler ($8,000 to $12,000): http://www.premierstainless.com/kegwashers.html  (example keg washers)

12'X17' Distribution Cooler ($8,000 to $12,000): http://www.jesrestaurantequipment.com/product.asp?itemid=47496&utm_source=googleshopping&gclid=CJnByIjb5sACFYMF7Aod9koA1w   (example cooler)

Misc. Lab Equipment ($1,000 to $3,000): http://brewingscience.com/supplies_guide.htm  (example items)


In order for us to effectively supply the greater Charleston area with our brews, we need to invest in a large storage cooler to house our beer for distribution pick up. Without a large cooler, we won't be able keep our distributed kegs cold, thus affecting the quality of our beer that gets distributed. We also need to be able to clean and fill kegs fast enough to get our beer to market. If we don't have the proper equipment to clean and fill our kegs, there is a greater chance of infected beer. Without these items, our capacity to put our delicious beer into your favorite local watering hole will be diminished.


Our secondary goal is to have a laboratory dedicated to yeast storage and propagation in an effort to provide a quality product while pursuing experimental endeavors.  If we are fortunate enough to exceed our fundraising goal, any additional funds will be spent on the items below:

Microscope

Autoclave

Hemocytometer

CO2 tester

Dedicated lab Freezer


The Impact

While these items may not seem very exciting, they are critical for proper brewery function and quality control.  Your investment in Revelry will help ensure that we are able to produce a quality product and provide more local options for you to enjoy at your favorite watering hole.  

This campaign is intended to be transparent and we are willing to answer any questions you may have as to why we might need these items or a clearer understanding of what they do and how it impacts the brewery and its product.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that cash isn't the only way to get where we are going; if you have any skills and extra time on your hands, we'd love to know how you may be able to help us in other ways around the brewery.  Every day there's something new going in or up and we pay handsomely in beer and pizza should you want to get your hands dirty with us!

You can also help by getting the word out about our campaign to your friends, colleagues and loved ones via social media platforms.  If everyone is able to share this campaign with just a few people, we feel confident that we can reach many, many people that may be interested in donating to the cause.

Without these items, our capacity to put our delicious beer into your favorite local watering hole will be diminished.Our secondary goal is to have a laboratory dedicated to yeast storage and propagation in an effort to provide a quality product while pursuing experimental endeavors.  If we are fortunate enough to exceed our fundraising goal, any additional funds will be spent on the items below:MicroscopeAutoclaveHemocytometerCO2 testerDedicated lab FreezerThe ImpactWhile these items may not seem very exciting, they are critical for proper brewery function and quality control.  Your investment in Revelry will help ensure that we are able to produce a quality product and provide more local options for you to enjoy at your favorite watering hole.  This campaign is intended to
be transparent and we are willing to answer any questions you may have as to
why we might need these items or a clearer understanding of what they do and
how it impacts the brewery and its product.

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that cash isn't the only way to get where we are going; if you have any skills and extra time on your hands, we'd love to know how you may be able to help us in other ways around the brewery.  Every day there's something new going in or up and we pay handsomely in beer and pizza should you want to get your hands dirty with us!You can also help by getting
the word out about our campaign to your friends, colleagues and loved ones via
social media platforms.  If everyone is able to share this campaign with
just a few people, we feel confident that we can reach many, many people that
may be interested in donating to the cause.

story:
LONG DISTANCE TRIATHLON WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS 2014

'No matter what, I need to make this happen.' 

This year marks my 3rd triathlon season. What started as a way to raise money with The Leukemia and Lymphoma Society's TEAM IN TRAINING turned into a real pass(obsess)ion! 

My first season I completed 8 triathlons: 1 Short Distance, 1 Sprint, 3 Half-Ironman, 1 full IRONMAN and 2 Olympic (one of which I ran barefeet because I forgot my shoes in the first transition) Maybe a little crazy? Yep. AND I LOVE IT! 

Being a full-time student, I haven't had the chance to fully dedicate myself to the sport and since I graduate in April 2014, World Championships seems like the perfect challenge to see just how far I can go. 

And I need YOUR help!

           


What it is:

Like the Olympics, World Championships change location each year. This year, the Long Distance Race takes place in Weihai, China on September 21st, 2014.

The World Championships Long Distance Triathlon is an event that requires qualification as an age-group participant or as a professional athlete. I qualified in my age group (under 24 years old) by participating in the Vancouver Subaru Half-Ironman which is a 1900m swim, a 90km bike ride and a 21.1km run. I finished 3rd with a time of 5:45. 

My goal in China is to be 30 minutes faster and have a time of under 5:15. It is an objective I believe I can achieve by being focused and training vigorously.


Where the money goes:

For the race alone, I estimate I will need $3000.

  • $400 for the race entry  
  • $400 for the Team Canada uniform 
  • $900 for the flight
  • $1000 for accommodations, food, and insurance
  • $300 for gear (bike maintenance, race supplies, etc.)

Reaching my campaign goal will help me focus more on training and less on finances.

Corporate Sponsorship opportunities:

7.1. Sponsor Space A:

a) This space is directly
below the country code (See Diagram 1. Sponsor Logos:
size and space).
b) The maximum height is
20cm.
c) The maximum length is
15cm.
d) Up to 3 sponsor logos
may be positioned in this space.

e) The athlete may have 1, 2 or 3 logos in this space. Each of the logos must

represent a different sponsor.

7.2. Sponsor Space B: upper left front:

a) This space is for the manufacturer of the uniform or for another sponsor.

b) The maximum height is 4cm.

c) The maximum length is 5cm.

d) The space must be on the left hand shoulder of the uniform – not the middle.

7.3. Sponsor Spaces C: side panels:

a) Sponsor logos may appear on the side panel.

b) The maximum width is 5cm.

c) The maximum length 15cm.

d) Only one sponsor logo is allowed on each side and it must be the same sponsor

logo. International Triathlon Union  ITU Competition Rules  2014

e) This space must be visible from the side of the body. If, due to the athlete body,

this space is partly visible from the front, it has to be visible also from the back.

7.4. Sponsor Space D: lower front:

a) The maximum height is 4cm.

b) The maximum length is 5cm.

c) This space can be on the lower left or right side of the uniform but not both.

7.5. Sponsor Space E: upper back:

a) One logo of any sponsor may appear above the family name on the back.

b) The maximum height is 10cm.

c) The maximum length is 15cm.

7.6. Sponsor Space F: upper front:

a) One logo of any sponsor may appear above family name and/or the country

code on the front.

b) The maximum height is 5cm.

c) The maximum length is 15cm.


Perks:

No matter what perk you choose from, all of them come with my sincere gratitude and tons of karma points! :)

I decided to use my creativity to thank you for your generosity. You can choose from an exotic handmade souvenir from CHINA, a copy of my artwork or an original piece of art made by me, that I can customize upon request, OR you can just have a good laugh at my expense by making me do something goofy and post a video of it on this page!


*** I will keep posting new perks and new art that you can choose from every week, so make sure to come back on this site often and look for updates! ***


What if I go over my fundraising goal?

Right now, I can't afford to hire a coach or a nutritionist. I coach myself and follow a training and nutrition plan to the best of my abilities. By using the help and knowledge of experts, real progress can be made.

Any extra money will go towards: improving my training, equipment upgrade, nutrition assistance and consultations with health specialists.


"           I want to see how far I can go in this sport. Even though triathlon is an individual discipline, going to World Championships is like being on a big team with the rest of the country. Team Canada.         "

How you can help:

If you can't help financially, you can help me spread the word! I also accept virtual hugs, high fives, and positive energy!

  • PLEASE leave a comment on my page! Any feedback, suggestion or encouragement is essential and will give my page more visibility :)
  • Share my Indiegogo page on Facebook and with your friends!

Thank you so much for your help, I can't do it without you! 

Claire

story:
Push. Order. Enjoy.

Pizza...when it's good it's great...and when it's bad, it's still pretty good.


The Pizza Bite Button works with wireless technology to send your preset order from your smartphone or computer to your favorite local pizza shop instantly… and that’s it! One touch and your food shows up! 

Your order is paid for automatically from funds in your personal Pizza Bite Button account. Much like an EZ-Pass can check or replenish your account balance anytime you want. You will also receive an alert when you balance is getting low.

The Pizza Bite Button not only makes ordering your favorite meal easy, but it’s great for local small business. This is one of our many small business projects, all geared towards boosting local economies and helping people to support their local communities.



An Idea Born Over Lunch

The Bite Button Company is the brainchild of the three founders of ThinkActBuyLocal.com, LLC. Gregory Panos, Raymond Steinbacher, and Jeffrey Morgan, formed ThinkActBuyLocal.com, LLC., in 2013 as a company devoted to helping local, small businesses grow and compete in this ever-changing business environment, with our mission being to provide products (applications) and resources that will allow small businesses to optimize all the latest technology.  

The idea for an easier way to order food for delivery came about when the founders ordered pizza for the office. They realized that they ordered the same items on the same day of the week...every week. After researching this phenomena, it was discovered that about 86% of all pizza orders (for delivery) follow this pattern. 

National pizza chains have the resources to create online ordering systems that make it easier for patrons to order pizza. During our discussion, we discovered that we had all ordered from one of these national chains, not because of the quality of their product, but due to the convenience of ordering through their system. This is when the lightbulb went on.

We postulated that we could create an app, tied to a device (refrigerator magnet) that made it so easy to order food (pizza) from your favorite vendor...at the push of a button. The issues we faced were:

  • How to involve multiple pizza vendors
  • How to make it work without tethering it to a specific phone or device (in other words, NOT using bluetooth) so that you can use the button even when your phone is not within the area. This way parents can allow the kids or their baby-sitter to order dinner while they are enjoying a night out.
  • How to make the entire process of ordering seamless, so that all financial transactions are automatic.

In the matter of a few days we felt that we pretty much had a solution. The button would act somewhat like an EZ Pass used on highways for tolls. We would create the backend dashboard where participating vendors would be able to post their menus. The patrons would activate their button by making a minimum deposit (i.e., $50.00). They would then be able to choose a vendor, and set up a 'standing order'. When the button is pushed, the order is sent to the chosen vendor, and upon delivery, the vendor would be paid (less a small commission)  through the funds on deposit with the button. The funds would be automatically replenished at a chosen level. 

We then built a rough (very rough) prototype for proof of concept. When it worked, we felt we had a winning concept, so we applied for a patent (and are currently patent-pending), created a business plan, and decided to crowd-source our funding.

This is the 30,000 foot view of the process. It is obviously much more involved and detailed. Our goal is to raise enough capital to manufacture the first 10,000 Pizza Bite Buttons, and make sure that we create an infrastructure that will be capable of handling the growth rate we anticipate.



The Importance of 'Local'

With over 90,000 local pizza shops in the United States the Pizza Bite Button will help to bring more business to our local economies and save you time and hassle!

Everyone should understand that supporting local businesses helps to maintain a strong community, both economically and socially. The mission of our organization and The Pizza Bite Button is to promote patronage and support of locally owned small businesses, while educating consumers as to the positive impact socially, economically, and environmentally this engagement creates.

                               

Small businesses need to be integrated into the mobile landscape and connected to the world of social media. That's where we come in...
Think. Act. Buy... Local will keep you connected to the world at the forefront of social media and engage your local pizza parlors through our Pizza Bite Button, so you can help promote a more connected and prosperous community.



Our Plan

We are raising money on INDIEGOGO to fund the initial production run of Pizza Bite Buttons and the integration of our proprietary back end software. With your help we can all have fresh, hot pizza at our doorsteps with no hassles… all at the push of a button! 

All Pizza Bite Buttons will be manufactured in the U.S. by local businesses further supporting our small business movement to think, act and buy local. Eventually we plan to offer multiple Bite Buttons for Chinese food, Delis, the munchies and more but for now we are focusing on your favorite and ours… pizza!



Development

We have been working for a while now, from our first "Frankensteined" prototype to a more refined button, on perfecting the process involved in ordering from the Pizza Bite Button. 

With your help we can fund the initial run of buttons and complete the backend software needed to bring you fresh hot local pizza... at the push of a button!

And yes!... when you request a button so that you can set up a
Pizza Bite Button account it comes to you in a tiny pizza box (left)!



The Team

The management team of The Bite Button Company consists of the three founders, Gregory Panos, COO, Raymond Steinbacher, CIT, and Jeffrey Morgan, CMO. 

           

(L to R) Gregory Panos, Raymond Steinbacher, Jeffrey Morgan


Gregory Panos, COO.

Gregory Panos has 30 years experience in the real world of retailing & marketing. As an entrepreneur, Panos has specialized in many industries; specialty chocolates, juvenile products, toys & games, hospitality...and owned and operated several successful restaurants, (what did you expect?...he's Greek). Greg was named a first degree Global Influencer by Fast Company Magazine in 2010.

Raymond Steinbacher, CIT

Raymond Steinbacher is a best-selling author of several books, including 'Computer Friendly!' Raymond has helped over 1.4 million people learn how to use their computers in plain and straightforward English. A technology expert and electrical engineer whose proficiencies include: custom programming, SQL database design, management and implementation, network management and troubleshooting, technical writing, website and product brand development using social media, SEO and traditional advertising, video production and editing. Mac, Windows.

Jeffrey Morgan, CMO

Jeffrey Morgan has been a professional graphic designer and photographer for the past 19 years. After graduating from Long Island University, Southampton in 1995 Jeffrey spent 5 years working as an Art Director for Saks Fifth Avenue in New York City. After leaving New York, Jeffrey worked for two different ad agencies and a tradeshow design firm. In 2007 Jeff took the plunge and started his own ad agency offering a wide variety of services to his clientele. Jeff lives in Chester County with his wife and three children.


Press


Daily Local News - Push-button pizza: West Chester firm has magnetic idea for ordering take-out

story:
I am a Board member/a passionate supporter of IPM (International Partners in Mission), a development agency founded in 1974 and headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio. The reason why I am passionate supporter of IPM is the fact that, over the past 40 years, it has partnered with over 300 community-based organizations around the world to implement 348 Project Partner children, women and youth initiatives in over 40 countries. The projects are incredible and often become self-sustaining. Your contribution is not just a payment, leaving the woman or child in need of another payment in the future, but a way to allow such folks in need to leverage your contribution to become self-sustaining. 

Why international, when there are plenty in need here in the U.S.? For me, the answer is three-fold: (1) IPM focuses on those children and women on the fringes of society that don't have basic needs such as food and water (fortunately, such needs in the US are mostly provided already); (2) a dollar spent internationally is much, much more impactful than the same dollar spent in the U.S.; (3) IPM is a small organization that has very little overhead so more of a contribution goes directly to the children and women in need.

IPM’s mission is to work across boundaries of culture, faith, and economic circumstance with children, women, and youth, to create partnerships that build justice, peace, and hope. In 2013 alone, IPM shall impact some 60,000 of the most marginalized individuals around the world, through providing technical assistance & training programs and financial assistance to more than 60 Project Partners in some 20 countries.

As one of the few development agencies headquartered in Cleveland, IPM has helped connect the city to the world in multiple ways. IPM annually hosts more than ten international visitors to Northeast Ohio to share their expertise and experiences on various topics of global importance with local institutional Partners as well as by stemming the brain drain, by bringing over 30 people so far from countries such as India, Ireland, Italy, Kenya, and Romania to Cleveland to work in the local office. Finally, through its Immersion Experience Programs, short-term trips to the countries and communities, where IPM works, initiated in 2003, IPM has enabled over 1,600 individuals to walk in solidarity with the locals and to become advocates for international social justice. In 2014 alone, IPM shall organize more than 20 Immersion Experience to 6 countries, including the Dominican Republic, El Salvador, India, Italy, Kenya, Nepal, Tanzania, and the USA.

In celebration of its 40th anniversary, IPM is committed to enhancing its ability to provide support for its project partners and to continuing to connect Cleveland to the World.

In order to enhance its decision-making abilities, IPM will be hosting its inaugural General Assembly—a weeklong series of events in Cleveland, October 13th-17th, 2014.

The G.A. shall include a core group of 40 stakeholders from IPM’s international constituencies—including persons from Brazil, Canada, Colombia, the Dominican Republic, El Salvador, India, Italy, Kenya, Nepal, and across the USA. The participants will come together to deepen and broaden the indigenization of all aspects of IPM’s governance, operations, and programs.

The G.A. will be a weeklong series of luncheon and dinner events, most of which will be open to the public. They will bring together renowned local and national speakers and will cover local and global topics, ranging from the activity of global nonprofits in Cleveland to women’s rights in Kenya. A highly anticipated guest is Rick Steves, television personality and author of Travel as a Political Act as well as Travels in Europe with Rick Steves. Steves is a passionate advocate for independent travel, encouraging his audience to become ‘temporary locals’ and visit not just major cities, but also villages and towns that are off the beaten path.

The General Assembly will also include IPM’s annual event, Namaste! Multi-Cultural Celebration, which raises funds for the over 60 Project Partners that IPM is currently supporting in the Unites States as well as across the globe. The eventfeatureslive entertainment with global music and cultural dance performances, a variety of eclectic foods accompanied with a diversity of wines and other beverages, a fabulous silent auction, and a wide selection of fair-trade handcrafts from around the world.

I believe that the G.A. will allow IPM to deepen its lived commitment to its mission, vision and core values, better serve its Project Partners throughout the developing world and further connect Cleveland to the world. 

By funding this campaign, you will support a nonprofit that has had an incredible track record for over 40 years, supporting its ability to continue supporting community-projects across the world and to make Cleveland a more global city. 


    The Impact

    Check out the partner projects at www.ipmconnect.org.

    1)  You can have an impact on a specific project you identify, or 

    2)  Your contribution can be used for a project that the Executive Director, Joseph Cistone, and the rest of the staff, determines has the most need. 


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please spread the word about the campaign and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! 

      Thank you for your support,

      Garnett aka Gary
