Your contribution is not just a payment, leaving the woman or child in need of another payment in the future, but a way to allow such folks in need to leverage your contribution to become self-sustaining. 
Why international, when there are plenty in need here in the U.S.? For me, the answer is three-fold: (1) IPM focuses on those children and women on the fringes of society that don't have basic needs such as food and water (fortunately, such needs in the US are mostly provided already); (2) a dollar spent internationally is much, much more impactful than the same dollar spent in the U.S.; (3) IPM is a small organization that has very little overhead so more of a contribution goes directly to the children and women in need.
IPM’s mission is to work across boundaries of
culture, faith, and economic circumstance with children, women, and youth, to
create partnerships that build justice, peace, and hope. In 2013 alone, IPM shall
impact some 60,000 of the most marginalized individuals around the world, through
providing technical assistance & training programs and financial assistance
to more than 60 Project Partners in some 20 countries.
As one of the few development agencies headquartered in
Cleveland, IPM has helped connect the city to the world in multiple ways. IPM
annually hosts more than ten international visitors to Northeast Ohio to share
their expertise and experiences on various topics of global importance with
local institutional Partners as well as by stemming the brain drain, by
bringing over 30 people so far from countries such as India, Ireland, Italy,
Kenya, and Romania to Cleveland to work in the local office. Finally, through
its Immersion Experience Programs, short-term trips to the countries and
communities, where IPM works, initiated in 2003, IPM has enabled over 1,600
individuals to walk in solidarity with the locals and to become advocates for
international social justice. In 2014 alone, IPM shall organize more than 20
Immersion Experience to 6 countries, including the Dominican Republic, El
Salvador, India, Italy, Kenya, Nepal, Tanzania, and the USA.
In celebration of its 40th anniversary, IPM is committed to
enhancing its ability to provide support for its project partners and to continuing
to connect Cleveland to the World. 
In order to
enhance its decision-making abilities, IPM will be hosting its inaugural
General Assembly—a weeklong series of events in Cleveland, October 13th-17th,
2014. 
The G.A. shall include a
core group of 40 stakeholders from IPM’s international constituencies—including
persons from Brazil, Canada, Colombia, the Dominican Republic, El Salvador,
India, Italy, Kenya, Nepal, and across the USA. The participants will come
together to deepen and broaden the indigenization of all aspects of IPM’s
governance, operations, and programs. 
The G.A. will be a weeklong series of luncheon and
dinner events, most of which will be open to the public. They will bring together renowned local and national speakers
and will cover local and global topics, ranging from the activity of global
nonprofits in Cleveland to women’s rights in Kenya. A highly
anticipated guest is Rick Steves, television personality and author of Travel as a Political Act as well as Travels in Europe with Rick Steves.
Steves is a passionate advocate for independent travel, encouraging his
audience to become ‘temporary locals’ and visit not just major cities, but also
villages and towns that are off the beaten path.
The
General Assembly will also include IPM’s annual event, Namaste! Multi-Cultural
Celebration, which raises funds for the over 60 Project Partners that IPM is
currently supporting in the Unites States as well as across the globe. The
eventfeatureslive entertainment with global music and cultural dance
performances, a variety of eclectic foods accompanied with a diversity of wines
and other beverages, a fabulous silent auction, and a wide selection of
fair-trade handcrafts from around the world.
I
believe that the G.A. will allow IPM to deepen its lived commitment to its
mission, vision and core values, better serve its Project Partners throughout
the developing world and further connect Cleveland to the world.  
By
funding this campaign, you will support a nonprofit that has had an incredible track
record for over 40 years, supporting its ability to continue supporting
community-projects across the world and to make Cleveland a more global city. 

  The Impact 
Check out the partner projects at www.ipmconnect.org.
1)  You can have an impact on a specific project you identify, or 
2)  Your contribution can be used for a project that the Executive Director, Joseph Cistone, and the rest of the staff, determines has the most need. 

  Other Ways You Can Help Please spread the word about the campaign and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! 
Thank you for your support,
Garnett aka Gary

story:
The 1995 American Mt. Everest Expedition would like to express our sorrow for the Sherpa's that lost their lives in April 2014.  Our fund raising efforts will ensure  the funds are provided to the families of the victims. 

Our Expedition was a commemorative climb to follow in the footsteps of the early pioneers, George Mallory.  His grandson was on our team and the hope was to possibly find the body of his grandfather who at that time did not have Sherpa support.  Today, climbers around the world are able to reach the summit safely due to Sherpa's that help with load carries and establishing a safe route.
In respect to the families of the Sherpa hero's that perished, since they survive on an annual US income of less that $450/year/US, their children will never have a chance for a good education without our help.
Please contribute to this cause to help those that unselfishly gave their lives helping other fulfill their dreams.  Now it is our time to help them fulfill their family dreams.  It is who we are and what we do.

story:
Who We Are

We are two men who are driven for the success of Local Business. Tom Snider grew up in Southern California and moved to Salt Lake to start a new life! With a Love for shopping local, he soon came to find out that it was hard to find where everything was. "All the websites were okay, but were rather confusing." He came up with the idea of creating a new website. That website has turned into ilovemyslc.com 

"The website needed to be helpful, easy to navigate, and different. The difference that ilovemyslc.com offers is that we want to tell your story and honestly get you known in the community."

The specialty to our website is the video we provide. Companies are constantly spending more and more to build their online presence. Local business should have a stronger web presence. We understand that can be a costly and time consuming pursuit. Local and small businesses need help and that's why this site has been created. That is also why Tom teamed up with Kenny Larson.

Kenny Larson has been passionate about film for most of his life. He has spent the last 2 1/2 years editing and capturing footage for a business in West Valley Utah. 

This Website is here for you. A lot of people wonder, "Whats the catch?" Honestly, just two hours of a business owners time. That's it. 

Ilovemyslc.com is honestly dedicated to building your story. Why not have a website that wants to work for you? 

To launch it, we need your help. 

We Need You

We need your help to Launch. We plan on this being the only time we ask for money from people and businesses for these services.

  • We have a goal of $5,000 
  • Why? To provide you with high quality footage we need to up our gear. 
  • 1000 for our camera
  • 500 for the Lens
  • 150 for new lights
  • 1850 for Web and constant Video Development.
  • 1,500 for 6 months of marketing and reach. 
  • 500 for miscellaneous fees

We have some fun incentives in mind. Of course swag and even Salt Lake Bees tickets! The more you donate, the more you could receive.

  • If we do not reach our goal, we will still use the money we fund raised to move our mission forward.
  • We also need you as a business to help us know you want a video. Sign up for a video by following our link to the pre-launch site.
  • We cannot start this without you. 

The Impact

By getting involved, you will have the opportunity to be a part of not only a website, but a movement. 

  • Knowing where to shop helps us do better business and live better lives. 
  • As we shop local it will strengthen the economy, help other business grow and be born. That means more jobs, more ideas being born, and more unity in a community. 
  • We know that we can't just wave a magic wand and it will happen over night. However, if you can catch the vision and jump on board, then this ship will set sail. Lets do this together!

Challenges and Obstacles  

Like everything in life, there are challenges and obstacles. Our top ones are really, time and money. We want to provide the best website and video possible. That's hard to do with out help. If given the tools, we can build the most beautiful website and video for your company. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate money. You can help by sharing this with everyone you know. Let it go crazy online and see the power the web has. If everyone in your friends list shared this campaign, imagine what would happen. 

We also need more businesses to jump on board! You will want to eventually, so why not? Get your free video this week!

  • Remember use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Trendy Kitten, run by Jen, wants to provide a wide variety of items: from chic to cheeky!

Jen has been in the fashion industry for years and wants to share that experience with everyone. Fashion doesn’t have to be expensive, and it doesn’t have to be bought right off of the runway. There’s a whole lot more to living a fashionable lifestyle. The Trendy Kitten wants to both educate about and sell these items in an online boutique.

Jen has invested her money to get The Trendy Kitten started and build its online store; we need your help to stock it and launch it! Our goal is to raise $800 - and with your help, we can do it. Plus, we’ll give you some pretty sweet swag for helping us out.

If we don’t hit $800, any donated funds will be applied towards remaining Trendy Kitten startup fees. You’ll still get your promised swag. We’re pretty cool like that.

While The Trendy Kitten is new, we’ve been involved in other fundraising and crowdsourcing gigs. We’ve raised money to help pay people’s hospital bills, pay for life events, and to support local charities or schools. What can we say? We like to help out - and we hope you’ll return the favor.


Can’t donate? We could still use your help getting the word out. We’d appreciate any shout outs, whether you use the Indigogo share tools or make up your own message on your social media account.

story:
Short Summary

A group of co-chairs of the March on Springfield for Marriage Equality Oct. 22, 2013 needs help in paying for various aspects of the March. The event is scalable based on funds raised.

The funds will be filtered thru a 501-c-3 group. 100% of the funds will be used to pay for costs of promoting the March (t-shirts, posters, stickers, etc.) and actually producing the March.

This is an educational event.

IMPORTANT: Equality Illinois is just the fiscal agent for this event, they are not running the event.

The Impact 

The March on Springfield is meant to complement other parallel efforts that are happening to secure passage of the marriage equality law in Springfield during the Fall Veto Session. Other groups will focus on the lobbying and politics, we will focus on the educational outreach needed to host a March on Springfield with thousands of people Oct. 22, 2013.

What we need 

We need Team Leaders across the state of Illinois to make sure they get materials into all House of Rep districts in the state.

We need corporations to underwrite t-shirts and buses for their own employees, to give them Tuesday, Oct. 22, 2013 off as a service day. It will serve as a marketing effort for the company while increasing employee morale and loyalty.

We need people to "show up ... one day ... for the rest of your life" on Oct. 22, 2013 in Springfield, Illinois.

What funds will help pay for:

1) Posters

2) Post cards

3) Promotional materials such as stickers, t-shirts, etc.

4) Buses

5) Costs of producing the March in Springfield

https://www.facebook.com/MarchOnSpringfieldForMarriageEquality

For information on getting involved in other ways, email:

tracy@windycitymediagroup.com

story:
My name is Tasha Shelton. I am a 38-year-old wife and mother of three. As long as I can remember, I’ve always enjoyed “playing” in hair. Teaching myself basic braiding and cornrow techniques, I eventually made a hobby of styling the hair of family and friends. It began as a hobby, but through much struggle and passion, it is has now become my career. With this reality comes a breakthrough for not only me but for those I love. My family history reveals only a few successes along the way so with this achievement, my children and other family members can find hope, aspiration, and purpose.

This campaign will fuel the construction of the It’s Only Natural Salon. The realization of this salon will fulfill my ambition to serve others through hair styling and hair care. My goal is to provide a unique service to women and girls by offering personal hair styling as well as hair care education. For years I have heard the cries of ladies who want to look their best so they can feel good about themselves. When they come to It’s Only Natural Salon, they will leave with a beautiful look, a lift to their self-esteem, and with information on how to care for and maintain their hair.

While the space for the salon sits vacant and ready to be used, I need help with the contents and cosmetics. This includes curtains for the windows, paint for the walls, and the installation of a shampoo bowl. To create a nurturing atmosphere for an endearing hair-styling experience, $3500 must be raised. Your contribution is not all about helping me to launch a business, though that’s a small fraction of it. It is mostly about changing lives; beginning with my own, then extending to every customer I will serve. If you don’t think hair styles and hair care can make a difference in someone’s life, just compliment someone today on the way that person’s hair looks or just take a look in the mirror. Good or bad, the way your hair looks will have an impact on how you feel about yourself.

This campaign begins my journey; I am on my way.  With your help I’ll be able to see a dream become a reality, and I’ll be able to give my clients a much deserving hair care experience. You can be assured that all funds raised will go towards the construction of and furnishings for It’s Only Natural Salon.

story:
What is MaaDisha?

Hi there! My name is Poonam Bhatia and I am the founder of MaaDisha. MaaDisha creates organic and herbal products that are based on ancient holistic principles to not only heal you, but harmonize your energies within. Our products are chemical-free, paraban free and cruelty free. Our goal is to create products that leave you feeling both naturally healthy and radiantly beautiful.

MaaDisha is committed to giving back to the community, and that is why we have pledged to donate $1 for every Soap5 that is purchased directly to the No Kid Hungry campaign. So, for every $10 dollars you donate you will receive a Soap5, and $1 of that will be going to No Kid Hungry!

What is No Kid Hungry?

The No Kid Hungry Campaign strives to end childhood hunger in America. Shockingly 1 in 5 children in this country struggles with hunger. No Kid Hungry connects kids in need with nutritious food and teaches their families how to cook healthy, affordable meals.

Ending childhood is possible and with your help MaaDisha can help give back to this amazing and worthwhile cause.

What We Need & What You Get!

For every $10 donated you will receive a MaaDisha Soap5, and $1 will be donated directly to No Kid Hungry.

Our goal is to sell 1,000 soaps, and therefore donate $1000 to the No Kid Hungry Campaign.

There is no limit to the number of Soap5's you can get through this campaign ie. if you donate $100 MaaDisha will send you 10 Soap5's and MaaDisha will donate $10 directly to No Kid Hungry.

MaaDisha's Soap5 has been formulated to rejuvenate your skin while harnessing the power of natures “Ayurganic” ingredients to promote healing and give you that soft, touchable skin. Soap5 comes in 5 different scents and MaaDisha will send you a randomly selected scent.

** It should be noted that we will accept donations under $10, but no soap will be provided. Also, shipping costs are included in your $10 donation. 

The Impact

Purchasing one of our Soap5's will not only be beneficial for your skins health, but you will also make an impact in the life of a child.

story:
Short Summary

'Arlene's Apparels & More' is a new resale-consignment shop established early this year and it is located in SE Houston, Texas. The resale shop is owned and operated by Arlene Parris. With over 25 years in the Sales & Customer Service Industry, her career has granted her insight into business operations & experience in running her own company. Her confidence and passion for helping others will lead her to have a strong successful business. Arlene, very familiar with the needs of her community, has leverage and keen insight into her specific industry: with a wide selection of
new and used name brand/designer consignment goods at discount cost, her niche
store has no direct competition in the immediate area.

Within nine months, 'Alrene's Apparels & More' has established a steady stream consignment drop-off, on both a daily and weekly basis. Ours is the only consignment store in the area that offers our customers the opportunity to earn extra funds. We are able to capitalize on this incredible opportunity because we don’t have to purchase merchandise to resell and the majority of our consignment customers bring in high quality items. Due to our success, we now need a larger store to expand our business and offer more employment for the community. We have secured a
new location which offers very good foot traffic and easy accessibility. We have efficiently designed the store's layout to increase sales and give the customers the utmost attention. This attention to detail combined with our passion to help others and knowledge of the resale industry will help the store reach a profitable level quickly. We will also offer employment to those in our community. In addition, this new location is large enough to host monthly crowd-funding events for other struggling small business owners in need of funding.

Your funds will be used mainly to renovate and fix up the historic building, offer employment to help the economy, and continue consignment to help everyone and anyone in need of extra funds. This larger space will also allow us the opportunity to host a monthly "Crowd-funding Event." Such an event will allow us to give back by reaching out to other successful business owners in the area, requesting that they match any funds raised in our event and donate both meals and their time in order to help us organize this event. 

Funding 'Arlene's Apparels &  More' Will Help Us to Help Others In Four
Ways:

1.  Beautify our newly designated historical district by renting and renovating the new space. Before now, it has only served as an abandoned eyesore in the neighborhood.

2.  We will try to do our part by helping the economy and offering paid employment. In addition, we will provide a college internship program, open our doors to any retired seniors, and take care of vets seeking volunteer positions.

3.  We will offer extra funds to those in need with consignment.

4.   Finally, we will offer a monthly crowd-funding event to serve other small business owners.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To fulfill its goals and objectives, 'Arlene's Apparels & More' requires funding in the amount of $60,000.00 to ensure its successful future. Funding will be allocated toward the listed expansion elements.

Expansion Summary

  • Employment & Wages/2+ Part-Time Employees Minimum Wage Payout For A Year-$15,080.00
  • Repairs And Construction/2 AC Units/Sheet Rock & Paint/Floor/Ceiling Tile/Electrical Repair/Plumbing Repair-$20,000.00
  • Sign & Sign Permits-$3,000.00
  • Insurance & Re-Sale Bond Certificate-$2000.00 
  • City & State Licenses & Permits-$800.00
  • Rent/Due to Large Amount Of Construction & Renovation (Will Request 6 to 12 Months Free Rent)/Will Need Deposit Payment-$2,700.00
  • New Computer System with CD-RW, Printer, Quick Book, Payroll, & Point Of Sale Software, Bar Code Label Printer, Scanner and Corresponding Inventory Management Software-$3,000.00
  • First Six Months Telephone & Utilities-$1,200.0
  • Assorted Office Supplies & Office Expenses-$500.00
  • Office Furniture(Used Show Cases & Office Desk)-$1,800.00
  • Display Equipment Including Extra Fixtures, Racks, Hangers, Showcases, Shelves & Table (Used)-$2,500.00
  • Surveillance Cameras & ADT Alarm-$1,000.00
  • Advertising- in local and general publications and newspaper-$1,000.00
  • Legal fees for the creation of the corporation and general business forms-$2,500.00.

Based on our projections, we believe that awarding funding to 'Arlene's Apparels & More' will be a sound investment. With the increasing demands on employment, we believe we will successfully capture our target market, meet our financial objectives, and fulfill our mission.

Shopping Perks

To allow our community's low-income family fair access to our store, we will offer coupons, gift cards, loyalty cards, and implement a store credit program for frequent shoppers. In addition, we will offer additional discounts to any customer who LIKE us on Facebook. Our current customers really love that we welcome price negotiations.

  • Other perks include employment-fulltime, part-time, internship, and volunteers opportunities.
  • Consignment perk: one man's trash is another man's treasure. Don't trash it, sell it on consignment!
  • Crowd-funding perks: we'll host monthly crowd-funding events to help other small business owners with extra funding.
  • Community & Neighborhood perks: we will beautify and maintain our historical building in the newly-designated historical district. 

Not Enough Funding

If we are unable to reach our funding goal, any funds obtained will be distributed across the company. The majority of our funding request will serve our community by allowing us to offer employment while reserving a year's salary for 2+ part-time employees in advance. If full funding is not obtained, we will seek other funding events or use a portion of merchandise sales. This process will take some time, but I have faith it will be done.

 

The Impact

'Arlene's Apparels & More' aims to provide our community a better way of life; to our future employees we will give honest employment; and our customers will receive good quality merchandise at reasonable prices. We exist to attract and maintain two types of customers: the buyers and the consignors.  We hold leverage over our competition because we provide a superior quality product line, low cost competitive prices, negotiable prices, and a friendly atmosphere. We are the only consignment shop in our area and we attract clients due to our willingness to serve our community in any way possible.

Our goal is to excel in the consignment and resale business by increasing our product lines annually. By opening a larger location with more varieties of services, we will be able to play a small part in repairing our economy by offering employment opportunities. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to support us by funding our campaign, then please spread the word about our business! Tell your friends, family, co-workers, and church members about us. Lead them to our page on  www.Indiegogo.com so that they can see what we are looking for and why. We just ask that you help us help our community. Help us tell the Greater Houston area and the whole world where we are located and what we have to offer.  If people know where we are located and our goals, they can support, shop, and take advantage of our daily sales. These actions will help us raise funds to secure the larger location.

Understanding America's current economy, we intend to support our neighbors by keeping our prices low - our community members won’t have to pay extra for the merchandise they want and need. Our expansion will allow us to offer more merchandise through our continuous emphasis on customer satisfaction, introduction to product enhancement, while establishing long-term relations with our consignment customers.
story_txt:
Short Summary'Arlene's Apparels & More' is a new resale-consignment shop established early this year and it is located in SE Houston, Texas. The resale shop is owned and operated by Arlene Parris. With over 25 years in the Sales & Customer Service Industry, her career has granted her insight into business operations & experience in running her own company. Her confidence and passion for helping others will lead her to have a strong successful business. Arlene, very familiar with the needs of her community, has leverage and keen insight into her specific industry: with a wide selection ofnew and used name brand/designer consignment goods at discount cost, her nichestore has no direct competition in the immediate area. Within nine months, 'Alrene's Apparels & More' has established a steady stream consignment drop-off, on both a daily and weekly basis. Ours is the only consignment store in the area that offers our customers the opportunity to earn extra funds. We are able to capitalize on this incredible opportunity because we don’t have to purchase merchandise to resell and the majority of our consignment customers bring in high quality items. Due to our success, we now need a larger store to expand our business and offer more employment for the community. We have secured anew location which offers very good foot traffic and easy accessibility. We have efficiently designed the store's layout to increase sales and give the customers the utmost attention. This attention to detail combined with our passion to help others and knowledge of the resale industry will help the store reach a profitable level quickly. We will also offer employment to those in our community. In addition, this new location is large enough to host monthly crowd-funding events for other struggling small business owners in need of funding.Your funds will be used mainly to renovate and fix up the historic building, offer employment to help the economy, and continue consignment to help everyone and anyone in need of extra funds. This larger space will also allow us the opportunity to host a monthly "Crowd-funding Event." Such an event will allow us to give back by reaching out to other successful business owners in the area, requesting that they match any funds raised in our event and donate both meals and their time in order to help us organize this event. Funding 'Arlene's Apparels &  More' Will Help Us to Help Others In FourWays:1.  Beautify our newly designated historical district by renting and renovating the new space. Before now, it has only served as an abandoned eyesore in the neighborhood.2.  We will try to do our part by helping the economy and offering paid employment. In addition, we will provide a college internship program, open our doors to any retired seniors, and take care of vets seeking volunteer positions.3.  We will offer extra funds to those in need with consignment. 
4.   Finally, we will offer a monthly crowd-funding event to serve other small business owners.  What We Need & What You GetTo fulfill its goals and objectives, 'Arlene's Apparels & More' requires funding in the amount of $60,000.00 to ensure its successful future. Sign & Sign Permits-$3,000.00
Insurance & Re-Sale Bond Certificate-$2000.00 
City & State Licenses & Permits-$800.00
Rent/Due to Large Amount Of Construction & Renovation (Will Request 6 to 12 Months Free Rent)/Will Need Deposit Payment-$2,700.00
New Computer System with CD-RW, Printer, Quick Book, Payroll, & Point Of Sale Software, Bar Code Label Printer, Scanner and Corresponding Inventory Management Software-$3,000.00
First Six Months Telephone & Utilities-$1,200.0

story:
Short Summary

Zion Care Orphanage and Widow Center in Shangirai, Tanzania is the vision of Rebecca and Japheth Mollel. With the help of a dedicated team of international sponsors, the Center became a reality in 2010. Today, there are 17 orphans ages 3-14 living at the Center.

As it stands today, the Center is at times dependent on donations in order to provide food for the orphans and widows. But the opportunity has now presented itself for them to buy a plot of farm land nearby. With this land, they would become self-sufficient in terms of food. The sole purpose of this campaign is to raise the funds necessary to buy the farm land.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise SEK 28,000 (EUR 3,000), which will be used to buy the Center the farm land they need to become self-sufficient and able to feed the orphans who live at and widows who visit the Center. Your gift of any size is greatly appreciated.

The Impact

Being able to farm this land would mean food self-sufficiency for the Center. And that would make funds otherwise invested in food available for other important projects, such as the maintenance and development of the Center.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to make a donation today, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends on Facebook. The more people that get involved, the more likely it will be that we are able to reach our goal and purchase the farm land for the orphans and widows at the Center.
